member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.APipeConnection
member.summary: Returns whether anonymous pipes are in use for this connection

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.AutoCommit
member.summary: Whether to autocommit statements after execute.
member.value: On (true) or Off (false), default is true

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.ClientName
member.summary: Name of client as reported to the server.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectionLifetime
member.summary: The time a connection remains in the pool before the connection is terminated.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.Country
member.summary: Country setting to use for the connection. Requires SQL.INI
member.value: String name of country in country.sql

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.DataSource
member.summary: The hostname or IP of the machine to connect to.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.FloatFormat
member.summary: This determines how SQLBase FLOAT types will be retrieved from the database.
member.value: Float, Double, Decimal (default)

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.LongVarcharFormat
member.summary: This determines how SQLBase LONG VARCHAR types will be retrieved from the database.
member.value: Default, Bytes, Chars, String

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.Ini
member.summary: The SQL.INI file to use. This is required to use a Country setting or a custom error.sql.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.IniFile
member.summary: The ini file to use.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.InitialCatalog
member.summary: Database to connect to

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.InputMessageSize
member.summary: This sets the maximum size (in bytes) of the input message buffer.
member.value: Size of buffer, in bytes
member.remarks: A large input message buffer can help performance while fetching data from the database because it reduces the number of network messages. Note that a large input message buffer can affect system throughput because of concurrency. Any row currently in the input message buffer can have a shared lock on it (depending on the isolation level) preventing other users from changing that row. Therefore, a large input message buffer can cause more shared locks to remain than are necessary.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQLBase specific isolation level
member.value: A string containing one of the supported isolation levels.
member.remarks: The supported isolation levels are: CS, RR, RL, RC, R1, R2, R3

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.NamedPipeConnection
member.summary: Returns whether named pipes are in use for this connection

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.OutputMessageSize
member.summary: This sets the maximum size (in bytes) of the input message buffer.
member.value: Size of buffer, in bytes
member.remarks: The most important messages sent from the client to the database server are SQL commands to compile or a row of data to insert. A large output message buffer does not necessarily increase performance because it only needs to be large enough to hold the largest SQL command to compile, or large enough to hold the largest row of data to insert. A large output message buffer can allocate space unnecessarily on the both the client and the server. Rows are always inserted and sent one row at a time (except in bulk execute mode). A larger output message buffer does not reduce network traffic unless bulk execute is on.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.Password
member.summary: Connection password (not concealed, use SecurePassword if possible)

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.SecurePassword
member.summary: Connection password (protected).
member.remarks: Supply a copy of the SecureString value, as it will be freed by SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.PoolSize
member.summary: Number of unused connections to keep in the pool.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.Port
member.summary: Port number of remote server instance. Only applicable for TCP.
member.value: Number between 1-65534, default 2155

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.NoRecovery
member.summary: Connects to the database with recovery enabled.
member.remarks: Use with caution! If the database is not safely shut down while connected with recovery off, database will be corrupted and data will be lost! Default: true

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.ServerName
member.summary: The name of the SQLBase server. If specified, name will be verified before connecting.
member.value: Server name
member.remarks: This field is optional, but if specified, the .NET provider will verify the remote server name matches this value when connecting.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates if security-sensitive information, such as the password, is not returned as part of the connection if the connection is open or has ever been in an open state.
member.value: If true, then the sensitive security information, such as password, cannot be retrieved once the connection is open.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.Timeout
member.summary: The command and socket timeout length
member.value: Time to wait, in seconds. 0 means infinite.
member.remarks: This will also set the socket timeout.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.LockTimeout
member.summary: The lock timeout
member.value: Time to wait, in seconds.
member.remarks: Accepted values: 0-1800, default is server value. A return of -1 means unset (uses server value).

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.Transport
member.summary: The network transport method to connect to the server.
member.value: The string value set is mapped to one of the enumeration values in Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Transports
member.remarks:
This accepts a string matching any of the following:
* npipe, Named Pipes, Named Pipe, NamedPipes, NamedPipe, SQLNPIPE
* TCP, TCPIP, TCPV4, TCPV6, Socket, Winsock, SQLWS32
* apipe, SQLAPIPE

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.User
member.summary: User name

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.UseSSL
member.summary: Use SSL encryption to connect to SQLBase.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnectionStringBuilder.UseLegacySearch
member.summary: Enables legacy behavior for automatically searching for a SQL.INI file.
member.remarks: Default value: false

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Transports
member.summary: Transport mechanism to connect to SQLBase
member.value: The transport method used to connect to the server.
member.remarks: When setting, it tells the .NET provider which method to use to connect. When getting, it returns the current method in use for the current connection. TCP - Use TCP/IP sockets (SQLWS32, Windows and Linux) NamedPipe - Use named pipes (SQLNPIPE, Windows only) Apipe - Use anonymous pipes (SQLAPIPE, Windows only)

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Transports.TCP
member.summary: Use TCP/IP sockets (SQLWS32, Windows and Linux)

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Transports.NamedPipe
member.summary: Use named pipes (SQLNPIPE, Windows only)

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Transports.APipe
member.summary: Use anonymous pipes (SQLAPIPE, Windows only)

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SSLOption
member.summary: Enable or disable connecting over SSL.
member.value: Always, Never, Negotiate
member.remarks: Always - Require SSL, connection fails if no server support Negotiate - Negotiate with the server. Will use if both server and client allow SSL. Never - Never use SSL, connection fails if server requires SSL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SSLOption.Always
member.summary: Require SSL, connection fails if no server support

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SSLOption.Negotiate
member.summary: Negotiate with the server. Will use if both server and client allow SSL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SSLOption.Never
member.summary: Never use SSL, connection fails if server requires SSL.

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.FloatOption
member.summary: Customize the type returned from GetValue on a SQLBase FLOAT column.
member.remarks: The FLOAT format as stored in SQLBase has more precision than IEEE 784 floating point numbers. The default in .NET is to fetch as a decimal (System.Decimal) value. However that type does not support the min and max range of a FLOAT column. To retrieve the full range of values from SQLBase, set the FloatFormat to Float or Double to return the value as the appropriate .NET type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.FloatOption.Decimal
member.summary: Retrieve FLOAT columns as .NET System.Decimal (default)

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.FloatOption.Float
member.summary: Retrieve FLOAT columns as .NET System.Single (Float)

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.FloatOption.Double
member.summary: Retrieve FLOAT columns as .NET System.Double

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.LongVarcharOption
member.summary: Customize the type returned from GetValue on a SQLBase LONG VARCHAR column.
member.remarks: The LONG VARCHAR type was originally the only LONG type, so some databases may have binary data stored there. The default in .NET is to fetch as a Char[]. However that doesn't return a nice readable value This can be used in the connection string to customize how LONG data should be read. This only affects LONG VARCHAR. LONG VARBINARY always returns byte[], and LONG NVARCHAR always returns Char[].

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.LongVarcharOption.Default
member.summary: Retrieve LONG VARCHAR columns using the default for the driver (Char[] for 12.1, String for 12.2+).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.LongVarcharOption.Bytes
member.summary: Retrieve LONG VARCHAR columns as .NET System.Bytes[]

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.LongVarcharOption.Chars
member.summary: Retrieve LONG VARCHAR columns as .NET System.Char[]

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.LongVarcharOption.String
member.summary: Retrieve LONG VARCHAR columns as .NET System.String

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError
member.summary: SQLBase error codes

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FETEEOF
member.summary: 00001 FET EOF End of Fetch
member.remarks:
Reason: A FETCH has attempted to fetch beyond the end of a result set.
Remedy: None, informational only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FETEUPD
member.summary: 00002 FET UPD Row has been updated
member.remarks:
Reason: A FETCH in result set mode returns this code if the row has been updated at least once some time in the past since the result set was formed, but cannot know when or how often.
Remedy: Add the ROWID to the select list. The ROWID retrieved will be the ROWID of the newly update row. The application should deal with rows that have been modified while part of a result set appropriately.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FETENF
member.summary: 00003 FET NF Row has not been found
member.remarks:
Reason: A FETCH in result set mode returns this code if the row has been deleted since the result set was formed.
Remedy: None. This error code is informational and lets the application know that the row has been deleted from the database since the current result set was formed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FETECOC
member.summary: 00004 FET COC INTERNAL USE ONLY -- Row was updated by CURRENT OF cursor
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLETNF
member.summary: 00101 SQL TNF Translation error not found
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program was attempting to convert an SQLBase error return code to another "resultant" error code and the original SQLBase return code could not be found in the translation file. This indicates that the translation table was found but the error within the translation table was not found.
Remedy: Add the SQLBase error code to the error translation file or add an asterisk as a global error catch-all. The translation table consists of x,y entries, where x is the SQLBase code to be converted to y. An entry of *,999, for example, will return a translated error code of 999 instead of this message. See the SQLBase configuration parameter ERRORFILE= for more information on the translation file and its usage.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLESTS
member.summary: 00102 SQL STS Select buffer <number> is too small
member.remarks:
Reason: One of the application's sqlssb function calls set up a fetch buffer that is insufficient to hold the data fetched.
Remedy: Determine which select buffer is too small and increase the size of that buffer. Checking the fetch status code for each column selected can help determine the column with the problem.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDNC
member.summary: 00103 SQL DNC OS/2 Operation did not cancel
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program running at a client workstation is attempting to perform a cancel API database request using the API function call sqlcan() and the cancel operation was not successful.
Remedy: Verify that you are using this function from an OS/2 client workstation communicating with a OS/2 SQLBase Server. Try the cancel operation again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDNN
member.summary: 00104 SQL DNN Attempt to fetch non-numeric data into numeric column <number>
member.remarks:
Reason: One of the application's sqlssb function calls set up a fetch buffer defined as numeric but the data fetched cannot be converted to a numeric value.
Remedy: Modify the program or data so that program will not attempt to fetch non-numeric data into a numeric format.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENOF
member.summary: 00105 SQL NOF Attempt to fetch into numeric column <number> that is too small
member.remarks:
Reason: One of the application's sqlssb function calls set up a fetch buffer that is defined as numeric but the buffer provided is not large enough to hold the numeric value.
Remedy: Modify the program so the select buffer is large enough to accommodate the fetched value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDTN
member.summary: 00106 SQL DTN Application Programming Error: Data type not supported
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to bind or set up a select buffer and is specifying a program data type that is not supported by SQLBase.
Remedy: Verify that the program data type specified in the sqlssb, sqlbnn, and sqlbnd calls are valid. Valid program data types can be found in SQLBASE.H file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLELNE
member.summary: 00107 SQL LNE Application Programming Error: Long operation not ended
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a non-long operation before ending the long operation that is in progress.
Remedy: Perform an end long operation (sqlelo) before proceeding with any other operations.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEAFE
member.summary: 00108 SQL AFE Row already fetched before enabling fetch backward
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform an enable fetch backwards (sqlefb) function call after already fetching forward.
Remedy: Correct the application program. The enable fetch backwards (sqlefb) function must be called before any fetch is performed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENOP
member.summary: 00109 SQL NOP MAIN database not open to the public
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot create, delete, install, or deinstall the MAIN database. Furthermore, you cannot shut down or set the default database name to the MAIN database.
Remedy: None. The MAIN database is not open to the public. The MAIN database cannot be created, deleted, installed, or deinstalled. The main database cannot be shut down by a user and a user cannot have the MAIN database as the default database name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLELNS
member.summary: 00110 SQL LNS Long columns cannot be accessed from this database
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEAPR
member.summary: 00111 SQL APR SQL Application Programming Interface (API) recursively entered
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is in error by re-entering the SQL Application Programming Interface (API). This can happen under Windows where the application's yield function is called and the application then re-enters the SQL API. This can also happen when multiple applications share a cursor and attempt to use the cursor simultaneously; that is, a second API request is made before a return code is received from the first API request.
Remedy: Modify the Windows application(s) to prevent re-entry into the SQL Application Programming Interface (API).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLELBS
member.summary: 00112 SQL LBS Application Programming Error: Long bind already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a bind long operation and one has already been performed.
Remedy: Correct the application program. Verify that the long data was only bound once.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLETMB
member.summary: 00113 SQL TMB Application Programming Error: Too many binds
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a bind operation and has exceeded the number of binds necessary.
Remedy: Correct the application program. The number of bind function calls should equal the number of bind variables.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIVC
member.summary: 00114 SQL IVC Application Programming Error: Invalid bind name or bind number
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a bind operation and it has not correctly specified the bind name or the bind number.
Remedy: Correct the application program. Verify that the bind name pointer or bind number is correctly specified.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEPDT
member.summary: 00115 SQL PDT Invalid program data type <pdt> for select buffer #<number>
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a set select buffer (sqlssb) function call and has specified an invalid program data type.
Remedy: Correct the set select buffer (sqlssb) function call in the application program. Verify that the program data type is one of the program data types defined in the file SQLBASE.H.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEMLB
member.summary: 00116 SQL MLB Programming Error: Missing long bind before write long
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a write long (sqlwlo) function call and no long data has been bound.
Remedy: Correct the application program. Long data must be bound to a write long operation before attempting to write it with either a bind long data by number (sqlbln) or bind long data by data name (sqlbld) function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIPB
member.summary: 00117 SQL IPB Invalid (null) parameter buffer pointer
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program has performed an sqlset API function call without providing a pointer to a buffer, that is, the third parameter, a pointer, is zero or null.
Remedy: Correct the sqlset API function call by providing a pointer to a buffer for the third parameter of the sqlset function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEMSC
member.summary: 00118 SQL MSC Must follow a successful compile of a SELECT statement
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to call sqldes, sqldsc, or sqlfqn without performing a successful compile of a SELECT statement.
Remedy: Correct the application program. Verify that a successful compile of a SELECT statement precedes the sqldes, sqldsc, or sqlfqn function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDND
member.summary: 00119 SQL DND Fetched data for column <number> is not in DATE-like or TIME-like format
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to fetch data into a buffer with a program data type of date (SQLPDAT) and the data in the database is not defined as a DATETIME, TIMESTAMP, DATE, or TIME field.
Remedy: Correct the set select buffer (sqlssb) function call so the field does not ask for a program data type of date.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIEV
member.summary: 00120 SQL IEV Found incorrect version of ERROR.SQL file
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase has located incompatible version of ERROR.SQL.
Remedy: Verify that the correct ERROR.SQL is in one of the following: your current directory, the root directory, the \SQLBASE subdirectory under the root directory, or in a directory specified by the PATH environment variable.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIVD
member.summary: 00121 SQL IVD Attempt to insert or update with an invalid date
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to insert or update a date that is invalid.
Remedy: Verify that the date is a valid date.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEMVC
member.summary: 00122 SQL MVC Number of SELECT columns & number of INSERT columns do not match
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a copy (sqlcpy) function call and the number of variables in the select list of the SELECT statement does not equal the number of variables being inserted by the INSERT statement.
Remedy: Correct the application program so that the number of variables in the select list of the SELECT statement match the number of variables in the INSERT statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECEX
member.summary: 00123 SQL CEX CURRENT OF cursor not allowed with sqlcex API function call
member.remarks:
Reason: A CURRENT OF cursorname clause is not permitted in an SQL statement that is compiled and executed with the sqlcex API function call.
Remedy: Separate the compile and execute (sqlcex) API function call into two distinct API function calls. First, compile the SQL statement using the sqlcom() API function call, and then execute the SQL statement using the sqlexe() API function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECBR
member.summary: 00124 SQL CBR Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL CBR)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENTL
member.summary: 00125 SQL NTL Name parameter is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a get number of rows (sqlgnr) function call and the table name specified is too large.
Remedy: Correct the application program so that the table conforms to the rules of USERID.TABLENAME where the USERID can be 8 characters and the TABLENAME can be any long identifier (18 characters or less).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENCC
member.summary: 00126 SQL NCC Named cursor does not exist or is not open
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to execute an SQL statement using the CURRENT OF cursorname or ADJUSTING cursorname and the named cursor does not exist or is not open.
Remedy: Correct the application program. Check for previous SQL return codes that may have closed or disconnected the cursor. Correct the logic of the application program to ensure that the specified cursor is open when this SQL statement is executed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENCR
member.summary: 00127 SQL NCR Cursor identified in the SQL command is not positioned on a row
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to execute an SQL statement using the CURRENT OF cursorname or ADJUSTING cursorname and the named cursor is not positioned at a row. The cursor must be positioned on the row that is to be updated, deleted, or adjusted by an insert. Note that the cursor is no longer positioned on a row if the row is deleted or an index column of the row is updated by another cursor in the same application program.
Remedy: Correct the logic of the application program to ensure that the cursor is correctly positioned on the intended row of the target table before the SQL statement is executed. Note that the cursor is not positioned on a row if FETCH returned an end of fetch return code.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECAE
member.summary: 00128 SQL CAE Cursor name already exists or is already open
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to name a cursor using the set cursor name (sqlscn) function call and the specified cursor name already exists.
Remedy: Correct the logic of the application program to ensure that it does not attempt to name or open a cursor that is already open.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECAI
member.summary: 00129 SQL CAI Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL CAI)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDNT
member.summary: 00130 SQL DNT Database/user/password is too large
member.remarks:
Reason: The database/user/password name specified at connect time or in the SQL.INI configuration file is too large.
Remedy: Correct the application program or the SQL.INI configuration file to conform to the maximums. The maximums are defined in the file SQLBASE.H. A constant SQLMDNM defines the maximum database name length as 16 and a constant SQLMSID defines the maximum username or password length as 8.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEOMS
member.summary: 00131 SQL OMS Output message size is too small
member.remarks:
Reason: The output message buffer is too small to hold the current output message.
Remedy: The output message buffer should never be too small to hold the current output message as it should be dynamically increased if necessary. Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIMS
member.summary: 00132 SQL IMS Input message size is too small
member.remarks:
Reason: The input message buffer is too small to hold the current input message.
Remedy: The input message buffer should never be too small for the current input message as it should be dynamically increased if necessary. Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIVE
member.summary: 00133 SQL IVE Invalid error return code
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase is attempting to find a error code in the error file ERROR.SQL that does not exist.
Remedy: Find out why the application program is looking up an error code that does not exist.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECNO
member.summary: 00134 SQL CNO Could not open file 'error.sql'
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase is trying to open the file ERROR.SQL but can't find it.
Remedy: Verify that ERROR.SQL is in either your current directory, the \SQLBASE subdirectory under the root directory, in the root directory, or in a directory specified by the PATH environment variable.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEICN
member.summary: 00135 SQL ICN Invalid cursor number
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to perform a function call and is using an invalid cursor number. Or, the application program may be using an old or mismatching version of a .DLL file. Also, if this is a shared cursor, it may be that the shared cursor is no longer valid because the owner application has been terminated.
Remedy: Correct the application program. Verify that the cursor is valid. To verify the cursor value, print the value of cursor after the connect and then before and after the function call that returned this error. Alternately, verify that the .DLL being used is the current version that matches the version of the database software being used. If using a shared cursor, verify that the owning application of the shared cursor has not been terminated.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECCS
member.summary: 00136 SQL CCS Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL CCS)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENFC
member.summary: 00137 SQL NFC No row fetched for current of cursor
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to execute an SQL statement using the CURRENT OF cursorname or ADJUSTING cursorname and the named cursor is not positioned at a row. The cursor must be positioned on the row that is to be updated, deleted, or adjusted by an insert. Note that the cursor is no longer positioned on a row if the row is deleted or an index column of the row is updated by another cursor in the same application program.
Remedy: Correct the logic of the application program to ensure that the cursor is correctly positioned on the intended row of the target table before the SQL statement is executed. Note that the cursor is not positioned on a row if FETCH returned an end of fetch return code.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIPI
member.summary: 00138 SQL IPI Application Programming Error: Invalid picture specified
member.remarks:
Reason: The picture specified in a number to picture (sqlxnp) function call does not conform to rules.
Remedy: Correct application program. Verify that the picture conforms to rules as documented in the number to picture (sqlxnp) function call. Also, check that the picture pointer accurately points at the specified picture string.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEOSP
member.summary: 00139 SQL OSP Application Programming Error: Output buffer too small
member.remarks:
Reason: The output buffer is too small to hold the formatted number in a number to picture (sqlxnp) function call.
Remedy: Correct application program. Verify that the output buffer is large enough to hold the specified picture.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDNI
member.summary: 00140 SQL DNI Database system not installed
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to communicate with a database and the database system is not installed.
Remedy: Verify that DBROUTER, DBXROUTR, DBXCOMBO, DBLOCAL, OR DBXLOCAL are started prior to running the application program.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECSS
member.summary: 00141 SQL CSS Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL CSS)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECBS
member.summary: 00142 SQL CBS Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL CBS)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIMT
member.summary: 00143 SQL IMT Invalid error message type specified
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to retrieve text associated with an error code but the specified error text type is invalid.
Remedy: Specify a valid error text type. The valid error text types are defined in SQLBASE.H as SQLXMSG(1), SQLXREA (2), or SQLXREM (4). Text types can be summed together so that multiple text types are retrieved simultaneously, but a valid text type must be greater than zero and less than or equal to seven (all text types).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIRN
member.summary: 00144 SQL IRN Invalid row number
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is trying to position (sqlprs) within a result set at a row outside the range of the result set.
Remedy: Verify that the row position is within the existing result set. Remember, rows are not considered a part of the result set until fetched. Row positioning within a result set is relative to zero, i.e., the first row in a result set is row zero.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEOOM
member.summary: 00145 SQL OOM Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEEMS
member.summary: 00146 SQL EMS Input message buffer set too small
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set a smaller input message buffer and the specified size is too small. The size may be smaller than the minimum required size or too small for the current operation currently in progress.
Remedy: None. Don't set the input message buffer size smaller than the necessary size.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEELE
member.summary: 00147 SQL ELE Got error looking up error message
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to look up an error in the error file ERROR.SQL and a problem occurred during the process.
Remedy: Check error that occurred during the lookup and address that problem.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDNO
member.summary: 00148 SQL DNO Specified database not on specified database server
member.remarks:
Reason: During an operation that requires both a SQLBase Server handle and a SQLBase database cursor it was determined that the database specified is not on the SQLBase Server specified.
Remedy: Correct application so the database cursor specified is for a database that resides on the specified SQLBase Server.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEBNE
member.summary: 00149 SQL BNE Online backup not properly ended
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting some other operation before ending an online backup operation.
Remedy: End online backup before doing any other operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLERNE
member.summary: 00150 SQL RNE Restore not properly ended
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting some other operation before ending an online restore operation.
Remedy: End the online restore before attempting any other operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEMTS
member.summary: 00151 SQL MTS Cannot set input message buffer smaller than current message length
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set the input message buffer size smaller than the current input message length.
Remedy: None. You cannot make the input message buffer length less than the current input message length.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDAE
member.summary: 00152 SQL DAE Database already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create or restore a database that already exists.
Remedy: None. Do not attempt to create or restore an existing database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLERAA
member.summary: 00153 SQL RAA Result set processing already active
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start (sqlsrs) or restart (sqlrrs) result set mode and result set mode is already active.
Remedy: None. Do not attempt to start or restart result set mode if result set mode is already active.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLERSM
member.summary: 00154 SQL RSM Result set processing must already be active
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is attempting to start restriction mode (sqlstr) or stop restriction mode (sqlspr) and result mode (sqlsrs) has not been started.
Remedy: Verify that the application program has previously started result set mode with an sqlsrs() function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECIA
member.summary: 00155 SQL CIA Named cursor must be performing a SELECT
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use the INSERT...ADJUSTING cursorname syntax but the named cursor is not performing a SELECT.
Remedy: Modify the application program so the named cursor is performing a SELECT.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECTC
member.summary: 00156 SQL CTC Command does not support CURRENT OF or ADJUSTING CURSOR
member.remarks:
Reason: Using the CURRENT OF cursorname or ADJUSTING cursorname syntax when the SQL verb does not support these clauses.
Remedy: Modify the SQL statement attempting to use the CURRENT OF cursorname clause or ADJUSTING cursorname clause.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENRM
member.summary: 00157 SQL NRM Named cursor is not in result set mode
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to do an INSERT ... ADJUSTING cursorname when the named cursor is not in result set mode.
Remedy: Make a change so that the named cursor is in result set mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENBS
member.summary: 00158 SQL NBS Application Programming Error: Database names buffer too small
member.remarks:
Reason: The output buffer is too small to hold the directory list of database names (sqldbn) function call.
Remedy: Correct application program. Verify that output buffer is large enough to hold the directory list of database names, or at least 10 characters long, to hold 1 name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEFNS
member.summary: 00159 SQL FNS Fetch backwards not allowed with result sets
member.remarks:
Reason: Using a fetch backwards (sqlfbk) when in result set mode.
Remedy: Remove the fetch backwards (sqlfbk). If you want to fetch the previous row you can position (sqlprs) to the desired row when in result set mode and then fetch it.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECSB
member.summary: 00160 SQL CSB Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL CSB)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEACL
member.summary: 00161 SQL ACL Out of memory at the client workstation (SQL ACL)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIDN
member.summary: 00162 SQL IDN Invalid database name
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database name is an invalid system identifier.
Remedy: A valid database identifier is a maximum of 16 characters, and starts with a letter followed by letters or numbers. System identifiers include usernames, database names, and database server names.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLERNA
member.summary: 00163 SQL RNA Result sets not active
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to get the number of rows in a result set with the sqlnrr() function, or attempting to set a position within a result with the sqlprs() function, and the application program is not in result set mode.
Remedy: Correct the application. The application must be in result set mode before attempting to get the number of rows in a result set, or before attempting to position within a result set.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENRS
member.summary: 00164 SQL NRS No result set
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to position within a front-end result set when the application is not in result set mode.
Remedy: Correct the application. The application must be in front-end result set mode before attempting to position within a result set.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLE065
member.summary: 00165 SQL 065 NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECRS
member.summary: 00166 SQL CRS Cannot create a front-end result set
member.remarks:
Reason: This error can occur because the client workstation is out of memory, or because a temporary file name could not be created, or because the temporary front-end result set file could not be opened.
Remedy: Verify that there is sufficient memory at the client workstation. Verify that the FILES configuration parameter of your operating system is set high enough to support multiple files.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENET
member.summary: 00167 SQL NET Network check error (front end)
member.remarks:
Reason: A network transmission problem has occurred while operating with NETCHECK=1. A network transmission error was detected at the client workstation. When the database server receives the bad network request an information message "Back end receives a NAK" is displayed. If the error is not recoverable, the message "Back end give up" is displayed on the server F2 screen and this error is returned to the client workstation.
Remedy: Try to reproduce the error. If error is reproducible, try the same scenario on another client workstation. If the problem is reproducible on the second (i.e., any) client workstation, then the network hardware problem may be at the database server computer. Switching database server machines may also help to diagnose the problem. Check for loose cabling.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEFMG
member.summary: 00168 SQL FMG Error in reading from temporary Front-End Result Set file
member.remarks:
Reason: A read error occurred reading from the front-end result set temporary file on the local client workstation.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk read failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLESAV
member.summary: 00169 SQL SAV Error in writing to temporary Front-End Result Set file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to write to a front-end result set file and a disk write failure has occurred at the local client workstation.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk write failure. Most commonly, it may be because you have run out of available disk space. If sufficient disk space is available, then run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEDSB
member.summary: 00170 SQL DSB Requested operation is disabled for foreign DBMS
member.remarks:
Reason: The requested operation is not valid for the current active database because front-end result sets are being employed.
Remedy: None. This operation cannot be performed when operating with front-end result sets.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLE071
member.summary: 00171 SQL 071 NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENSP
member.summary: 00172 SQL NSP API CANcel (sqlcan) is only supported under the OS/2 environment
member.remarks:
Reason: The API CANcel, sqlcan(), function call is not valid under the current operating system.
Remedy: None. The API function call sqlcan() is only valid from an OS/2 client workstation communicating with an OS/2 SQLBase Server.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLE073
member.summary: 00173 SQL 073 NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLE074
member.summary: 00174 SQL 074 NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEOLC
member.summary: 00175 SQL OLC Cannot open local client workstation file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to copy a file from an SQLBase Server to a client workstation; OR attempting to copy a file from the client workstation to the SQLBase Server AND the local file at the client workstation cannot be opened or created.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEWRI
member.summary: 00176 SQL WRI Cannot write to local client workstation file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to copy a file from a SQLBase Server to a client workstation and a disk write failure has occurred at the local client workstation.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk write failure. Most commonly, it may be because you have run out of available disk space. If sufficient disk space is available, then run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEREA
member.summary: 00177 SQL REA Cannot read from local client workstation file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to copy a file from the client workstation to an SQLBase Server and a disk read failure has occurred on the file at the local client workstation.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk read failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLESFW
member.summary: 00178 SQL SFW Cannot write to remote SQLBase Server file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to copy a file from the client workstation to an SQLBase Server and a disk write failure has occurred at the remote SQLBase Server machine.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk write failure. Most commonly, it may be because you have run out of available disk space. If sufficient disk space is available, then run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEISI
member.summary: 00179 SQL ISI NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEISH
member.summary: 00180 SQL ISH Invalid database server handle
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an SQLBase Server administrative operation and a connect to a valid Server handle has not been performed.
Remedy: Obtain a valid database server handle by connecting to an SQLBase Server. Use the SET SERVER command in SQLTalk or the API function call sqlcsv() to establish a Server connection.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEBFE
member.summary: 00181 SQL BFE Backup destination file already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Backing up the database or transaction log files and the backup destination file already exists.
Remedy: Backup database or transaction log files to another disk file name or remove or rename the existing file of the same name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECCB
member.summary: 00182 SQL CCB Cannot create backup file
member.remarks:
Reason: Backing up the database and the backup destination file cannot be created.
Remedy: Determine why the database could not create the backup destination file. Verify the existence of the backup directory. The BACKUP commands will not make the destination directory. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENED
member.summary: 00183 SQL NED Not enough disk space to complete Backup or Restore operation
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to Backup the database or transaction log files, or attempting to Restore the database or transaction log files and the system has run out of disk space.
Remedy: Provide for additional disk space.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEISN
member.summary: 00184 SQL ISN Invalid server name
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database server name is not valid.
Remedy: Correct the database server name. The maximum length of a server name is 8 characters and must begin with a letter and cannot contain special characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECNB
member.summary: 00185 SQL CNB Cannot open backup file on local (client) computer
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a local (client) restore database or restore snapshot and the system cannot open the backup file on the local (client) computer.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the open file failure. Verify that the specified file name was correctly specified and exists on the local (client) computer. Verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECAB
member.summary: 00186 SQL CAB Cannot allocate Backup or Restore memory buffer
member.remarks:
Reason: Out of memory at the remote SQLBase Server when using the ON SERVER clause, otherwise the system is out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLECNC
member.summary: 00187 SQL CNC Cannot connect to server
member.remarks:
Reason: Failure attempting to connect to the specified database server.
Remedy: Verify that the correct database server name is used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENV4
member.summary: 00188 SQL NV4 Specified operation is not valid for SQLBase 4.0 or later
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified operation is no longer valid for SQLBase 4.0 or later.
Remedy: The specified operation has been replaced with an alternative way of doing the same operation. Check the documentation to determine the alternate technique. The obsolete function are described in the SQLBase C API Reference Manual, Chapter 5: C/API Functions by Category.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEEAS
member.summary: 00189 SQL EAS Database already exists on another database server
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install or create a database and the named database already exists on another database server.
Remedy: Install or create the database with an alternate name or verify why a database already exists with the same database name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEFUP
member.summary: 00190 SQL FUP CURRENT OF cursor requires SELECT FOR UPDATE
member.remarks:
Reason: Performing an UPDATE or DELETE with the CURRENT OF cursorname clause and operating in DB2 compatibility mode where a SELECT FOR UPDATE is required to use the CURRENT OF cursorname clause.
Remedy: Modify SQL statements to either use the SELECT FOR UPDATE clause or don't use the CURRENT OF cursorname clause.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEFIP
member.summary: 00191 SQL FIP CURRENT OF cursor processing cannot be used; fetch in-progress
member.remarks:
Reason: Performing a DELETE or UPDATE with the CURRENT OF cursorname clause and the named cursor was named after the SELECT statement was already in progress.
Remedy: Name the cursor before beginning the SELECT statement and before calling the sqlexe function. Error is caused by naming the cursor with a sqlscn function call after the sqlexe function call. Thus SQLBase cannot properly prepare for the SQL command to allow for CURRENT OF cursorname processing.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLELAE
member.summary: 00192 SQL LAE Log files already exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to Restore transaction log files that already exist.
Remedy: None. Log files that already exist cannot be restored.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEFRT
member.summary: 00193 SQL FRT Local result set directory name string too big
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified directory name for the local result set directory is too large.
Remedy: Modify the directory name so it does not exceed 40 characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEMTT
member.summary: 00194 SQL MTT More than two slashes in connect
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to connect to a database and the specified database name, username, password string contains more than two forward slashes.
Remedy: Modify the connect string containing the database, username, and password. One forward slash separates database name from username, and one separates username from password in the form "databasename/username/password".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEISP
member.summary: 00195 SQL ISP Invalid SET parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set a database parameter, and the specified parameter is invalid. It may be the parameter is legal for multi-user servers, but illegal for single-user systems (an example is the SQLPCLN parameter).
Remedy: Verify and correct the specified parameter type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIGP
member.summary: 00196 SQL IGP Invalid GET parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to get a database parameter, and the specified parameter is invalid. It may be the parameter is legal for multi-user servers, but illegal for single-user systems (an example is the SQLPCLN parameter).
Remedy: Verify and correct the specified parameter type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEGNE
member.summary: 00197 SQL GNE Global cursor does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to retrieve the current global cursor, and a global cursor does not exist.
Remedy: To retrieve a global cursor it must first exist. A global cursor is established by calling the sqlset() function and using the SQLPGBC set parameter.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLEIPL
member.summary: 00198 SQL IPL Invalid SET parameter length
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a SET command with a numeric value, and the specified numeric value length is incorrectly specified.
Remedy: Specify the correct numeric value length. In general, the correct numeric length is the size of a field defined with data type SQLTDPV. A simple way to insure the correct length is to specify zero thus allowing SQLBase to calculate the correct length.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENBR
member.summary: 00199 SQL NBR Backend result sets not supported
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to turn off backend result sets when backend results do not exist.
Remedy: None. Cannot turn off backend result sets if they do not exist.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SQLENTT
member.summary: 00200 SQL NTT No error translation table found
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program was attempting to convert an SQLBase error return code to another "resultant" error code and the translation table cannot be found.
Remedy: Add the ERRORFILE keyword to the SQL.INI configuration file. This keyword specifies the name of the translation file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENCC
member.summary: 00201 DBO NCC No compiled command
member.remarks:
Reason: Application program is attempting to perform a read long (sqlrlo), write long (sqlwlo), long seek (sqllsk), store command (sqlsto), or execute (sqlexe) without first compiling an SQL statement.
Remedy: Revise application to compile a SQL statement prior to attempting the above operations.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENSE
member.summary: 00202 DBO NSE Not a SELECT command
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to fetch or position within a result set when the SQL statement is not a SELECT.
Remedy: Revise application to compile a SQL SELECT statement prior to attempting the above operations.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENEX
member.summary: 00203 DBO NEX Command has not been executed
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a fetch or position within a result set without a successful SQL SELECT statement.
Remedy: Revise application to compile a SQL SELECT statement prior to attempting the above operations.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENST
member.summary: 00204 DBO NST Fetch backward not allowed with this query
member.remarks:
Reason: Application program is attempting to enable fetch backwards (sqlefb) when the compiled SQL SELECT statement accesses more than one table. Backward fetch calls are restricted to queries on a single table.
Remedy: Revise application to comply with fetch backward restrictions.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEORD
member.summary: 00205 DBO ORD ORDER BY with fetch backward
member.remarks:
Reason: Application program is attempting to enable fetch backwards (sqlefb) when the compiled SQL SELECT statement contains an ORDER BY clause and the column or columns to be ordered on are not indexed.
Remedy: Revise application to comply with fetch backward restrictions.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERTL
member.summary: 00206 DBO RTL Row too long for fetch
member.remarks:
Reason: The data being fetched is too big to fit into the input message buffer which SQLBase increases dynamically but, the database router has run out of memory on the client workstation computer.
Remedy: If you are using DBROUTER.EXE, you can increase the size of the SQL.INI configuration parameter called HEAP or try using the extended memory version of this program called DBXROUTR.EXE if extended memory is available. If you are already using DBXROUTR.EXE then you can provide more extended memory. And finally, as a last resort, you could decrease the number of columns being fetched.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECNF
member.summary: 00207 DBO CNF Command not found for retrieval
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to retrieve (sqlret) a stored command from the database and the named stored command is not found.
Remedy: Store the command before attempting the retrieve or use the correct name when attempting the retrieve.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECIN
member.summary: 00208 DBO CIN Stored command has been invalidated
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to retrieve (sqlret) a stored command that has been invalidated by the system.
Remedy: A stored command becomes invalidated by SQLBase if an index or field is dropped that was available when the command was originally stored.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESTO
member.summary: 00209 DBO STO Command has been stored
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to seek a position in a long data column (sqllsk), read a long data column (sqlrlo), or write a long data column (sqlwlo) and the SQL command was previously stored and is not available.
Remedy: Compile the SQL statement before attempting any of the long data column operations mentioned above.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIFN
member.summary: 00210 DBO IFN Invalid long field number
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to read long data (sqlrlo) or seek a position within long data (sqllsk) and the column number specified is not a database data type of LONG VARCHAR.
Remedy: Modify the column number so that it corresponds to the long data in the select list. For a statement like SELECT EMPNO, DOB, HISTORY FROM PERSONAL the long data field HISTORY would be column three regardless of where it was defined when performing the CREATE TABLE PERSONAL (HISTORY LONG VARCHAR, DOB DATE, EMPNO SMALLINT).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENBK
member.summary: 00211 DBO NBK Online backup not allowed in read-only or read committed isolation level
member.remarks:
Reason: Online backup is not allowed while using the read-only isolation level.
Remedy: Change the isolation level to RR, CS, or RL and retry the backup.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESDD
member.summary: 00212 DBO SDD Cannot store a DDL command
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to store a data definition language command.
Remedy: None. SQLBase does not allow the storing of data definition language commands. Data definition language statements should only be executed once to establish tables, indexes, views, etc. Performing DDL operations in a production environment is discouraged as it can reduce user currency.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENTL
member.summary: 00213 DBO NTL Stored command name <name> is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to store (sqlsto), retrieve (sqlret), or drop (sqldst) a stored command and the specified name is too long.
Remedy: Correct the specified name so it is no greater than the maximum bind name length, SQLMBNL (36), found in SQLBASE.H.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENLB
member.summary: 00214 DBO NLB Not a long bind variable
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a write long data column operation and the SQL statement is not an UPDATE or INSERT statement. Or, the column you are attempting to update or insert is not a LONG VARCHAR data column.
Remedy: Do not perform a write long data operation with a SQL statement that is not an UPDATE or INSERT. If the SQL statement is an UPDATE or INSERT then verify that the column number used with the write long data (sqlwlo) operation is associated with a LONG VARCHAR data column in the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEGBY
member.summary: 00215 DBO GBY GROUP BY with fetch backward
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enable fetch backwards (sqlefb) and the SELECT statement contains a GROUP BY clause.
Remedy: Backward fetching is not allowed with a SELECT that contains a GROUP BY clause. Modify the application.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESFN
member.summary: 00216 DBO SFN Set functions with fetch backward
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a set function within a fetch backward operation.
Remedy: None. Set functions are not allowed with a fetch backward operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERNA
member.summary: 00217 DBO RNA Recovery not active
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a rollback and recovery is not active.
Remedy: Modify the application so the connection is made with recovery active. Use sqlcnc rather than sqlcnr.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESTD
member.summary: 00218 DBO STD Stored command <name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to drop a stored command that does not exist.
Remedy: Modify the drop store command so that it specifies a stored command name that exists.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEFBV
member.summary: 00219 DBO FBV Cannot fetch backward on this view
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enable a fetch backward (sqlefb) function call and the query is on a view.
Remedy: Modify the application program.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELSK
member.summary: 00220 DBO LSK Long seek past end of long data
member.remarks:
Reason: The application program is trying to position within long data and the position specified is beyond the end of the long data.
Remedy: Modify the application program so that it does not position beyond the end of the long data. Remember that the position is relative to zero, i.e., the first character is position zero. To determine the entire length of the long data, you can perform the get long data size (sqlgls) function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECNL
member.summary: 00221 DBO CNL Current command type is not Load/Unload
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database parameter type can be retrieved only if currently compiled command for this cursor is a Load/Unload command. In this case, the currently compiled command is neither a Load nor an Unload command.
Remedy: Get this parameter only after compiling a Load/Unload command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESCK
member.summary: 00222 DBO SCK Stored command name <name> is a keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: A stored command cannot have the same name as a keyword.
Remedy: Change the name and restore the command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECSD
member.summary: 00224 DBO CSD Cannot open start database
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is trying to initialize a new database (sqlins) and SQLBase cannot find the file START.DBS in the "home" database directory.
Remedy: Verify that the file START.DBS is available in the "home" database directory.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIRF
member.summary: 00225 DBO IRF Initialize read failure
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is trying to initialize a new database (sqlins) and a read error has been encountered on the file START.DBS.
Remedy: Try to determine why SQLBase cannot read the file START.DBS before contacting your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIWF
member.summary: 00226 DBO IWF Initialize write failure
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is trying to initialize a new database (sqlins) and a write error has been encountered. This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Try to determine why SQLBase cannot perform the write operation before contacting your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIIL
member.summary: 00227 DBO IIL Invalid isolation level <invalid setting>
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to set the isolation level (sqlsil) and specifying an invalid isolation level.
Remedy: The valid isolation levels are defined in the file SQLBASE.H which includes the following strings (or defined constants): "RR" (SQLILRR) - read repeatability "CS" (SQLILCS) - cursor stability "RO" (SQLILRO) - read only "RL" (SQLILRL) - release lock "RC" (SQLILRC) - read committed

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIDP
member.summary: 00228 DBO IDP INTERNAL ERROR ONLY - Invalid database parameter type
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESNL
member.summary: 00229 DBO SNL SELECT must be the last cmd in chained command
member.remarks:
Reason: SELECT commands are allowed in a chained command but only as the last command.
Remedy: Put the select command as the last command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIFD
member.summary: 00230 DBO IFD Invalid or non-existent directory name
member.remarks:
Reason: User specified a directory that is either invalid or the directory does not exist.
Remedy: Make sure that you have spelled the directory name correctly and it is the name of a valid, existing directory.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIVR
member.summary: 00231 DBO IVR Invalid version
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is using mismatching versions of software or the database version does not correspond to the software.
Remedy: Verify that the software and database are from the same release of SQLBase.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEDBA
member.summary: 00232 DBO DBA Must be a DBA for this operation
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an operation reserved for users with DBA authority.
Remedy: None. The statement cannot be executed. Operator must have DBA authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEILS
member.summary: 00233 DBO ILS Input message length too small
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase is attempting to set the input message buffer to a size smaller than the minimum size required.
Remedy: The input message buffer should never be set so small that it is smaller than the minimum size required. Contact your local Gupta technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECAI
member.summary: 00234 DBO CAI Out of memory on the database computer (DBO CAI)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENBI
member.summary: 00235 DBO NBI No on behave user information
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: Reason#18

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEISO
member.summary: 00236 DBO ISO Invalid security options
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEMBR
member.summary: 00239 DBO MBR Must be in result set mode to turn on restriction mode
member.remarks:
Reason: An application is attempting to stop restriction mode (sqlspr) or start restriction mode (sqlstr) and the application is not in result set mode.
Remedy: Modify the application so that it is in result set mode before attempting to start or stop restriction mode. Restriction set mode is a submode of result set mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERMA
member.summary: 00240 DBO RMA Restriction mode already on
member.remarks:
Reason: An application is attempting to start restriction mode (sqlstr) and the application is already in restriction mode.
Remedy: Modify the application so that it does not attempt to start restriction mode while already in restriction mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERAO
member.summary: 00241 DBO RAO Restriction mode already off
member.remarks:
Reason: An application is attempting to stop restriction mode (sqlspr) and the application is not in restriction mode.
Remedy: Modify the application so that it does not attempt to stop restriction mode while not in restriction mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERSN
member.summary: 00242 DBO RSN Result set processing not in effect
member.remarks:
Reason: An application is attempting to get the number of rows in a result set (sqlnrr) and the application is not in result set mode.
Remedy: Modify the application so that it does not attempt to get the number of rows in a result set (sqlnrr) while not in result set mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECIB
member.summary: 00243 DBO CIB Out of memory on the database computer (DBO CIB)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEDIU
member.summary: 00244 DBO DIU Deinstall with other users
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to deinstall a database while other users are connected to the database.
Remedy: Verify that everyone has logged off of the database before trying to deinstall the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESDC
member.summary: 00245 DBO SDC SELECT disallowed in chained commands
member.remarks:
Reason: SQL SELECT statements are not allowed in a sequence of chained commands.
Remedy: Eliminate any stored SELECT commands from the chained command sequence.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECDC
member.summary: 00246 DBO CDC CURRENT OF CURSOR in chained commands
member.remarks:
Reason: A DELETE or UPDATE is not allowed with the CURRENT OF cursorname clause within a chained command.
Remedy: Eliminate any stored DELETE or UPDATE statements that use the CURRENT OF cursorname clause from the chained command sequence.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEDAR
member.summary: 00247 DBO DAR DBA authority required for this operation
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to shut down a database without DBA authority.
Remedy: None. Only a user with DBA authority can shut down a database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECOF
member.summary: 00248 DBO COF Cannot open the remote file <filename> on the SQLBase Server
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open a remote file or create a directory on the remote SQLBase Server and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the open failure. Verify the specified file or directory path is valid.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESAR
member.summary: 00249 DBO SAR SYSADM authority required
member.remarks:
Reason: Only SYSADM can initialize a new database.
Remedy: None. Only SYSADM can initialize a new database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECDF
member.summary: 00250 DBO CDF Cannot delete the remote file <filename> on the SQLBase Server
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to delete a remote file or remove an existing directory on the remote SQLBase Server and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the delete failure. Verify the specified file exists.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEREA
member.summary: 00251 DBO REA Read failure on remote file at the SQLBase Server
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to read a file and a disk read failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk read failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEWRI
member.summary: 00252 DBO WRI Write failure to a remote file at the SQLBase Server
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to write to a file and a disk write failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk write failure. Most commonly, it may be because you have run out of available disk space. If sufficient disk space is available, then run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECSK
member.summary: 00253 DBO CSK Seek failure on remote file at the SQLBase Server
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to lseek within a file and an lseek failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk lseek failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESYS
member.summary: 00254 DBO SYS System command cannot be retrieved/executed/erased
member.remarks:
Reason: System commands are created and owned by the system.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEINC
member.summary: 00255 DBO INC Invalid cursor number
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEOOM
member.summary: 00256 DBO OOM Out of memory at the database computer (DBO OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECAL
member.summary: 00257 DBO CAL Out of memory at the database computer (DBO CAL)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERDO
member.summary: 00258 DBO RDO Read-only mode is disabled for this database
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to switch to read-only Locking isolation mode and the database is not prepared to handle read-only transactions.
Remedy: To use the read-only Locking isolation mode, the database must have the READONLY keyword enabled.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENV4
member.summary: 00259 DBO NV4 Specified operation is not valid for SQLBase 4.0 or later
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified operation is no longer valid for SQLBase 4.0 or later.
Remedy: The specified operation has been replaced with an alternative way of doing the same operation. Check the documentation to determine the alternate technique. The obsolete function are described in the SQLBase C API Reference Manual, Chapter 5: C/API Functions by Category.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEDNS
member.summary: 00260 DBO DNS Datetime not specified with ROLLFORWARD to specific datetime
member.remarks:
Reason: ROLLFORWARD TO TIME specified but datetime not specified.
Remedy: Specify the datetime when performing a ROLLFORWARD TO TIME.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIDS
member.summary: 00261 DBO IDS Invalid datetime <value> specified with ROLLFORWARD
member.remarks:
Reason: ROLLFORWARD to a specific datetime specified an invalid datetime.
Remedy: Specify the correct datetime format of "mm/dd/yy hh:mm:ss".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEICM
member.summary: 00262 DBO ICM INTERNAL USE ONLY - Invalid connect mode
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELFS
member.summary: 00263 DBO LFS Transaction Log file size <value> is too small
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set the transaction log file size too small.
