Remedy: Modify transaction log file size being set. Generally, the minimum size is 100K, unless you are using partitioned databases, in which case, the minimum size is 1MB (1000K).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIRM
member.summary: 00264 DBO IRM Illegal rollforward mode <value>
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified rollforward mode is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the rollforward mode. The following modes are the valid choices: (1) SQLMEOL Rollforward to end of all available logs. (2) SQLMEOB Rollforward to end of backup. (3) SQLMTIM Rollforward to a specified time.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECTI
member.summary: 00265 DBO CTI Checkpoint time interval of <value> minutes is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot set the checkpoint interval greater than 30 minutes.
Remedy: Use a valid checkpoint interval not greater than 30 minutes.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERFS
member.summary: 00266 DBO RFS Get Next Log is only valid after Rollforward has been initiated
member.remarks:
Reason: A Get Next Log command has been issued before beginning the Rollforward recovery process.
Remedy: Start Rollforward recovery before doing a Get Next Log.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENSD
member.summary: 00267 DBO NSD cannot connect to the same database
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEHSS
member.summary: 00268 DBO HSS History file size must be a positive value
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot set the History file size to zero or less than zero.
Remedy: Correct history file size setting to be a positive value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENSC
member.summary: 00269 DBO NSC Stored command cannot be found.
member.remarks:
Reason: Command is missing from SYSCOMMANDS.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERFI
member.summary: 00270 DBO RFI Rollforward interrupted - must restore database backup again
member.remarks:
Reason: The Rollforward operation has been interrupted.
Remedy: Restart the restore of database backup again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELNE
member.summary: 00271 DBO LNE Logging not enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a Backup and Recovery operation, Rollback operation, or attempting to set the logfilesize, nextlog, or spanlimit and transaction logging (recovery) is not enabled.
Remedy: Backup and Recovery, and transaction Rollbacks are not possible with transaction logging (recovery) turned off. Connect with recovery ON to perform Backup and Recovery, and transaction Rollbacks. Also, you cannot set the logfilesize, nextlog, or spanlimit with recovery turned off.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECAF
member.summary: 00272 DBO CAF Out of memory on the database computer (DBO CAF)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECOP
member.summary: 00273 DBO COP Database open copy file failure
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open an existing file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the open file failure. Verify that the specified file exists. Verify the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECCR
member.summary: 00274 DBO CCR Database create copy file failure
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENPW
member.summary: 00275 DBO NPW Failed to encrypt or decrypt database
member.remarks:
Reason: The server security password or export key is not correct for this operation.
Remedy: If a server password has not been set, set one before attempting this operation. Otherwise, set the exportkey using the SET EXPORTKEY statement to the correct value, then retry the operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEFCS
member.summary: 00276 DBO FCS Cannot generate connection string
member.remarks:
Reason: The system failed to construct a connection string.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELBD
member.summary: 00277 DBO LBD Log backup disabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to backup logs or get the next log or set the next log and transaction logging is disabled.
Remedy: Enabled logging before attempting to backup logs, get the next log, or set the next log.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELCU
member.summary: 00278 DBO LCU Long varchar column was updated or deleted
member.remarks:
Reason: The row from which you are fetching has been updated or deleted between the time you fetched the non-long varchar data and the time you issued the read long request.
Remedy: Re-fetch the row to get the most up-to-date data or to find out that the row has been deleted. If you receive this error frequently, review your application for possible data contention problems or poor sequencing of operations (SELECT/FETCH/DELETE/UPDATE). Try to prevent other applications, or cursors in the same transaction, from changing data while you are fetching it. For example, running the fetch operation in RR or CS isolation mode prevents other applications from updating or deleting data that you have accessed. Be aware that these isolation levels offer no such protection against a cursor from the same transaction.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOESLS
member.summary: 00279 DBO SLS Transaction span limit too small
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to set the transaction span limit to less than zero.
Remedy: Set the transaction span limit using a valid number. The transaction span limit is the number of log files an active transaction is allowed to span. Any transaction that violates the limit is rolled back. A span limit of zero indicates that transaction span limit checking is disabled.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEITO
member.summary: 00280 DBO ITO Invalid timeout value
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to set an invalid database lock timeout value.
Remedy: Set the lock wait timeout value using a valid number. The number represents seconds to wait for a database lock to be acquired. After the specified time has elapsed, the transaction is rolled back. The default setting is 300 seconds. Valid timeout values are: 1 to 1800 Seconds to wait for a lock (1 second to 30 minutes) -1 Wait forever for a lock held by another transaction 0 Never wait for a lock and immediately return a timeout error (nowait locking).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIVS
member.summary: 00281 DBO IVS Invalid version string
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set an invalid version number.
Remedy: Set the version number with a valid version number string. For example, "6.0.0".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERNS
member.summary: 00282 DBO RNS INTERNAL USE ONLY - Request not supported
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELFL
member.summary: 00283 DBO LFL Transaction Log file size <value> is too large
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set the transaction log file size too large.
Remedy: Modify transaction log file size being set. The maximum size is 2,097,152K.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOELBM
member.summary: 00284 DBO LBM LOGBACKUP must be ON for BACKUP DATABASE; try BACKUP SNAPSHOT
member.remarks:
Reason: Transaction log backup must be ON for a BACKUP DATABASE
Remedy: Try doing a BACKUP SNAPSHOT.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENSR
member.summary: 00285 DBO NSR Cannot store SELECT commands or procedures in restriction mode
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot store a SELECT statement or procedures while operating in restriction mode.
Remedy: Store the SELECT command or procedure while not operating in restriction mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECBL
member.summary: 00286 DBO CBL Next Log# <value> less than the Next Log# <value> that should be backed up
member.remarks:
Reason: Specifying log files in an incorrect fashion. Subsequent log files should always have the next higher transaction log file numbers.
Remedy: Specify the correct next transaction log file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECBG
member.summary: 00287 DBO CBG Next Log# <value> greater than current active log # <value>
member.remarks:
Reason: Specifying log files in an incorrect fashion. A subsequent log file can never be greater than the current active log file.
Remedy: Specify the correct next transaction log file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIFE
member.summary: 00288 DBO IFE Database file size extension too small
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database file size extension is too small.
Remedy: Correct database file size extension. If you are using partitioned databases, the minimal size is 1024, otherwise the size can be any positive value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOERSR
member.summary: 00289 DBO RSR Cannot retrieve SELECT stored command/procedure <user>.<name> in restriction mode
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL SELECT statement or stored procedure cannot be retrieved when operating in restriction mode.
Remedy: Retrieve the stored SELECT statement or procedure while NOT in restriction mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENDB
member.summary: 00290 DBO NDB Invalid NEWDB value
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEBME
member.summary: 00291 DBO BME LOGBACKUP mode already enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to set LOGBACKUP mode ON and the mode is already ON.
Remedy: None. Informational only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEBMD
member.summary: 00292 DBO BMD LOGBACKUP mode already disabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to set LOGBACKUP mode OFF and the mode is already OFF.
Remedy: None. Informational only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEFEV
member.summary: 00293 DBO FEV (Incompatible) client cannot invoke attempted function
member.remarks:
Reason: Client and server do not have compatible versions for launching the attempted function/feature.
Remedy: Use a configuration consisting of compatible client and server.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENOL
member.summary: 00294 DBO NOL RECOVERY is OFF, there is no log
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOENSS
member.summary: 00295 DBO NSS Not a server session
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to compile or execute a server command in a non-server session.
Remedy: Use a server session to compile or execute a server command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIVC
member.summary: 00296 DBO IVC Backend code page is not same, check SQL.INI file and country.sql
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECSC
member.summary: 00297 DBO CSC Cannot store the command, <command name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to store a server command.
Remedy: Run the command directly instead of storing the command and executing it later.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOECRM
member.summary: 00298 DBO CRM Cannot restore/rollforward MAIN while partitioned db enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: While partitioned databases are enabled, the MAIN database must be available to SQLBase to access partitioned databases. The availability of the MAIN database prevents it from being restored from a backup.
Remedy: Disconnect all clients accessing partitioned databases and disable partitioned databases.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEIOL
member.summary: 00299 DBO IOL Invalid optimizer level <value>
member.remarks:
Reason: Optimizer level must be 1 or 2.
Remedy: Use correct optimizer level, 1 or 2.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBOEITV
member.summary: 00300 DBO ITV Invalid command timeout value
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to set an invalid command timeout value.
Remedy: Set the command timeout value using a valid number. The number represents the maximum seconds allowed to perform a compile and execute for a command. After the specified time has elapsed, the command is aborted. The default setting is 0 seconds which disables the command timeout check. Valid timeout values are: 1 to 43,200 Seconds before timing out (1 second to 12 hours) 0 Never timeout.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENCH
member.summary: 00301 EXE NCH Can only modify CHAR datatype
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to alter the size of an existing column and the column is not defined as CHAR or VARCHAR.
Remedy: Do not attempt to change to size of a column that is not defined as CHAR or VARCHAR.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENAV
member.summary: 00302 EXE NAV ALTER privilege not allowed on views
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot grant ALTER privileges on a VIEW.
Remedy: None. Views cannot be altered, only tables can be altered. Therefore the granting of ALTER on a VIEW is not allowed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECRI
member.summary: 00303 EXE CRI Cannot create a VIEW using ROWID column
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to use the ROWID column in a VIEW.
Remedy: None. The ROWID is not allowed as a column within a VIEW.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDT
member.summary: 00304 EXE CDT Cannot drop another's table
member.remarks:
Reason: A user is attempting to drop a table that s/he did not create and s/he does not have DBA authority.
Remedy: None. Do not attempt to drop someone else's table unless you have DBA authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDI
member.summary: 00305 EXE CDI Cannot drop indexed column <column name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to drop a column that has an index on it.
Remedy: Drop all indexes associated with the column before dropping the column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDS
member.summary: 00306 EXE CDS Cannot drop system information <column, index, or table name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to drop a column, index, or table that is considered system information.
Remedy: None. Do not attempt to drop columns, indexes, or tables that are considered system catalog information.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEESTO
member.summary: 00307 EXE STO Cannot execute after store
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a command that was just previously stored. You cannot execute a command that was just stored.
Remedy: You must retrieve the stored command and then execute it or compile the command after storing and execute it. A stored command is stored in the database and is not available for immediate execution until it is retrieved.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECIL
member.summary: 00308 EXE CIL Cannot index long data
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create an index on a column that is defined as long data.
Remedy: None. You cannot create an index on a long data column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEMSC
member.summary: 00309 EXE MSC Cannot modify system column <column name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to modify a system column.
Remedy: None. You cannot modify a system column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERSC
member.summary: 00310 EXE RSC Cannot rename system column <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to rename a system column.
Remedy: None. You cannot rename a system column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERST
member.summary: 00311 EXE RST Cannot rename system table <table name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to rename a system table.
Remedy: None. You cannot rename a system table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERCD
member.summary: 00312 EXE RCD Cannot revoke connect from a DBA <user name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to revoke connect from a user with DBA authority.
Remedy: None. SYSADM must revoke DBA authority before being able to revoke connect authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERND
member.summary: 00313 EXE RND Cannot revoke DBA from a non-DBA <user name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to revoke DBA authority from a user that does not have DBA authority.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke an authority a user does not hold.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERRD
member.summary: 00314 EXE RRD Cannot revoke resource from a DBA <user name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to revoke RESOURCE authority from a user that has DBA authority.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke RESOURCE authority from a user who has DBA authority. Having DBA authority automatically means that s/he has all privileges on any table in the database, including the right to grant, modify, or revoke the privileges of any other user in the database. A DBA may not, however, create new users, nor may a DBA change the passwords or authority levels of existing users. These privileges are restricted to SYSADM. Having DBA authority means you also have RESOURCE authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECAE
member.summary: 00315 EXE CAE Column <column name> already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to add or rename a column and the column name already exists.
Remedy: Use a different column name from the one currently being used in the ALTER TABLE statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECST
member.summary: 00316 EXE CST Column <name> specified twice
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified a column with a duplicate column name.
Remedy: Do not use the column name that has already been used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEDND
member.summary: 00317 EXE DND Data is not a date
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to insert or update a column defined as DATE, TIME, DATETIME, or TIMESTAMP and the data attempting to be inserted or updated is not a date.
Remedy: Check data to verify that the data being inserted or updated is a date.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEDNN
member.summary: 00318 EXE DNN Data is not numeric
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to insert or update a column defined as SMALLINT, INTEGER, DECIMAL, FLOAT, or NUMBER and the data attempting to be inserted or updated is nonnumeric.
Remedy: Check data to verify that the data being inserted or updated is numeric.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIAE
member.summary: 00319 EXE IAE Index <index name> already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: The CREATE INDEX statement sought to create an index when there is already an index with the same name defined.
Remedy: The CREATE INDEX statement cannot be executed. No new index was created, and the existing index was not altered or modified. Either the existing index must be dropped or another name must be chosen for the new index.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIDE
member.summary: 00320 EXE IDE Index <index name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a DROP INDEX, UPDATE STATISTICS ON INDEX or CHECK INDEX and the specified index name does not exist.
Remedy: Find correct index name and retry. All current index names can be determined by querying the SYSINDEXES tables.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEVTL
member.summary: 00321 EXE VTL Insert/update value is too large
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is attempting to execute an UPDATE, INSERT, or COMMENT ON and the update or insert value, or the comment is too big for the column as it was defined at CREATE TABLE time.
Remedy: Identify which column exceeds the defined length and correct the application program. When binding data, be sure the specified bind variable lengths does not exceed the defined length in the database. If using a program data type of string (SQLPSTR), be sure that you have provided the null terminating character so that SQLBase can calculate the data length accurately. Check the length of the object column, and correct the program or SQL statement so that the length of the UPDATE, INSERT, or COMMENT ON string does not exceed the maximum.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIDV
member.summary: 00322 EXE IDV Invalid data for this view
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to insert or update through a view and the view definition rejects the data because it does not conform to the view definition. View checking is provided if the optional WITH CHECK OPTION clause is used when creating the view.
Remedy: Examine the view definition to determine why the requested INSERT or UPDATE was rejected. Note that this may be a data-dependent condition.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIVN
member.summary: 00323 EXE IVN Invalid number
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to convert character data to numeric data and the conversion fails.
Remedy: Verify that numeric data is being provided for conversion.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIBV
member.summary: 00324 EXE IBV Invalid program bind variable
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is attempting to use a bind variable that was not bound with a sqlbnn or sqlbnd function call.
Remedy: Bind all bind variables with either a sqlbnn or sqlbnd function call before attempting to execute the statement (sqlexe).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEESSF
member.summary: 00325 EXE SSF INTERNAL USE ONLY - expected next row but did not find one
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENGA
member.summary: 00326 EXE NGA No grant authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant or revoke connect authority, or grant table privileges and the user does not have the authority. Only SYSADM can grant or revoke connect authority. Table privileges can only be granted by users who have the authority to do so. A user with DBA authority may grant privileges on any tables or views in the database. A user with RESOURCE authority may grant privileges only on tables created by him or on views based completely on tables created by him. A user with only CONNECT authority may not grant privileges. Nor does user possess privileges to any tables or views unless the user is explicitly granted such privileges via a GRANT statement.
Remedy: None. You cannot grant or revoke connect authority, or grant table privileges when the user does not have the authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERSP
member.summary: 00327 EXE RSP Result set not allowed with a procedure
member.remarks:
Reason: A result set is not allowed with a procedure
Remedy: Do not use a result set with a procedure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENRE
member.summary: 00328 EXE NRE No resource authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a table and the user does not possess resource authority to create tables.
Remedy: None. A user must possess resource authority to create tables, to drop those tables, and to grant, modify or revoke privileges to those tables for valid users of the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENRA
member.summary: 00329 EXE NRA No revoke authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to revoke RESOURCE authority, table privileges, or DBA authority and the user does not have the authority. Only SYSADM can revoke DBA or RESOURCE authority. Table privileges can only be revoked by users who have the authority to do so. A user with DBA authority may revoke privileges on any tables or views in the database. A user with RESOURCE authority may revoke privileges only on tables created by him or on views that are based completely on tables created by him. A user with only CONNECT authority may not revoke privileges.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke RESOURCE authority, table privileges, or DBA authority when the user does not have the authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENCN
member.summary: 00330 EXE NCN Not a column
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a view and a named column does not exist in the target table or view.
Remedy: Modify the CREATE VIEW statement so that all named columns correspond to columns in the base table or base view.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENEV
member.summary: 00331 EXE NEV Not enough non-null values
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute an INSERT statement and there exist columns defined as NOT NULL which have not been provided values.
Remedy: Modify the INSERT statement so that a value exists for each column defined in the CREATE TABLE statement as NOT NULL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEPEU
member.summary: 00332 EXE PEU Privileges exist for user <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a REVOKE CONNECT FROM a specific user and the named user has been granted table privileges.
Remedy: Revoke the user's privileges before attempting to revoke the user's connect authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEESNI
member.summary: 00333 EXE SNI Size of CHAR not increased
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a ALTER TABLE with a MODIFY clause and the length of a character column is attempting to be decreased.
Remedy: Modify the ALTER TABLE statement. The length of a character column may be increased but not decreased.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERUN
member.summary: 00334 EXE RUN Command not allowed in this version of SQLBase
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified command is not allowed.
Remedy: This SQLBase version does not allow certain commands. An unconstrained version of the software must be acquired to execute this command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEESYT
member.summary: 00335 EXE SYT Table, view, or synonym, <name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CHECK TABLE, CREATE SYNONYM or DROP SYNONYM and the specified table name or view name does not exist.
Remedy: Modify the CHECK TABLE, CREATE SYNONYM or DROP SYNONYM statement by specifying an existing table name or view name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENEP
member.summary: 00336 EXE NEP No execute privilege on <object> <name> for user <username>.
member.remarks:
Reason: User does not have execute privilege.
Remedy: Get execute privilege from DBA or owner and re-issue the command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEETEU
member.summary: 00337 EXE TEU Table(s) exist for specified user <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a REVOKE CONNECT FROM a specific user and the tables exist for the name user.
Remedy: Drop the tables for the name user before attempting to revoke the user's connect authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEETVS
member.summary: 00338 EXE TVS Table, view, or synonym <name> already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE VIEW or ALTER TABLE with a RENAME TABLE clause and the table name or view name already exists.
Remedy: Modify the CREATE VIEW or ALTER TABLE statement to use a unique name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEETMC
member.summary: 00339 EXE TMC Too many columns
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE VIEW and the number of columns exceeds the maximum number of columns allowed for any table or view.
Remedy: Modify the CREATE VIEW statement so it does not exceed the maximum number of columns allowed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEUNE
member.summary: 00340 EXE UNE User <name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE TABLE, CREATE VIEW, GRANT table privilege, or REVOKE and the name user does not exist.
Remedy: Modify the statement to use an existing user.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEVIN
member.summary: 00341 EXE VIN INSERT/UPDATE value is NULL & target column cannot contain nulls
member.remarks:
Reason: The update or insert value was NULL, but the target column was declared as NOT NULL in the table definition. Consequently, null values cannot be inserted into that column, and values in that column cannot be set to NULL with an update.
Remedy: The statement cannot be execute. Examine the definition of the target table to determine which columns of the table have the NOT NULL attribute, and correct the SQL statement accordingly. DB2 treats "empty" strings and NULL strings as different whereas SQLBase does not distinguish between an "empty" string and a NULL string. This problem may be occurring because a CHAR or VARCHAR column has been defined as NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT and SQLBase uses a one-character space for the DEFAULT. For DB2 compatibility, you may want to consider NOT using the NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT characteristic for CHAR or VARCHAR columns.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEWPS
member.summary: 00342 EXE WPS INTERNAL USE ONLY - Wait/post
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEICR
member.summary: 00343 EXE ICR Invalid ROWID
member.remarks:
Reason: Application has submitted an invalid rowid while using the ROWID=[rowid] constraint in the WHERE clause. SQLBase has determined this rowid cannot be matched with any row within the database. Valid rowid's are retrieved using SELECT ROWID.
Remedy: Correct the rowid by retrieving the correct rowid using SELECT ROWID.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECAS
member.summary: 00344 EXE CAS Out of memory at the database computer (EXE CAS)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIOP
member.summary: 00345 EXE IOP Please ensure you have a valid security password set
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute an ALTER PASSWORD and the old password is not valid.
Remedy: Modify the ALTER PASSWORD statement to use a valid old password.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENVL
member.summary: 00346 EXE NVL NULL value encountered in column <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a ALTER TABLE with a MODIFY clause. The statement attempts to change a column which contains NULL values to a column with a definition of NOT NULL.
Remedy: Modify the ATLER TABLE statement or modify the data. If a column contains NULL values, you will not be able to redefine the column as NOT NULL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEEFS
member.summary: 00347 EXE EFS External function <name> already exists as a stored command or stored procedure
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified external function name already exists as a stored command name or as a stored procedure.
Remedy: Use a different external function name. External function names cannot be the same as an existing stored command, stored procedure, or external function.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECNA
member.summary: 00348 EXE CNA Current of cursor not allowed with this query
member.remarks:
Reason: The CURRENT OF cursorname clause is not allow with this query.
Remedy: None. CURRENT OF cursorname cannot be used with this SELECT statement. The CURRENT OF cursorname clause is not allowed under certain conditions, including a query which contains a join, GROUP BY, DISTINCT, aggregate functions, or a UNION.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDD
member.summary: 00349 EXE CDD Current cursor is on a different database
member.remarks:
Reason: A CURRENT OF cursorname clause is referring to a cursor which is currently referencing the same table name but in a different database. For example: With a first cursor named C1 connected to the PAYROLL database, it is performing a select like: SELECT * FROM EMP and with a second cursor connected to the PERSONNEL database, it is attempting to perform an update or delete similar to: UPDATE EMP SET BONUS = 100 WHERE CURRENT OF C1
Remedy: Revise SQL statements so that both statements refer to a table named in the same database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEDBA
member.summary: 00350 EXE DBA DBA authority required for this operation
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE or DROP a public table/external function SYNONYM synonym or UPDATE STATISTICS on DATABASE and the user does not have DBA authority.
Remedy: None. A user cannot CREATE or DROP a public SYNONYM\external function synonym or UPDATE STATISTICS on DATABASE without DBA authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDA
member.summary: 00351 EXE CDA Cannot drop all columns
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute an ALTER TABLE with a DROP column clause and the column is the lone remaining column in the table.
Remedy: None. You cannot drop the last column of a table. Each table must have at least one column. If necessary, drop the entire table with a DROP TABLE statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEKTL
member.summary: 00352 EXE KTL Index key size too large
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE INDEX and the key size exceeds the maximum key size allowed.
Remedy: Modify the index attempting to be created. The maximum size of an index is limited according to a formula documented in the SQL Language Reference manual under the CREATE INDEX statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENSY
member.summary: 00353 EXE NSY Object <name> specified in DROP SYNONYM is not a synonym
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a DROP SYNONYM and the named synonym is not a synonym but a table, view or external function name.
Remedy: Modify the DROP SYNONYM statement to use a synonym name or if you really want to drop a table or external function then use a DROP TABLE or DROP EXTERNAL FUNCTION statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENVW
member.summary: 00354 EXE NVW Object <name> specified in DROP VIEW is not a view
member.remarks:
Reason: The name specified in the DROP VIEW statement identifies a table, rather than a view. The DROP VIEW statement can only have a view as its target. The DROP TABLE statement must be used to drop a table.
Remedy: Correct the DROP VIEW statement so the view name is correctly specified (with the proper qualifier). If the intent is to drop a table, then the DROP TABLE statement must be used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENTB
member.summary: 00355 EXE NTB The object <name> specified in DROP TABLE is a view name.
member.remarks:
Reason: The name specified in the DROP TABLE statement identifies a view, rather than a table. The DROP TABLE statement can only have a table as its target. The DROP VIEW statement must be used to drop a view.
Remedy: Correct the DROP TABLE statement so that the table name is specified correctly (with the proper qualifier). If the intent is to drop the specified view, then the DROP VIEW statement must be used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEMBC
member.summary: 00356 EXE MBC Function parameters must be constants for index <index name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE INDEX statement the index is using @Functions that are not constants.
Remedy: Modify the CREATE INDEX statement so that all function parameters are constants.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEPTL
member.summary: 00357 EXE PTL Function parameter too large for column <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE INDEX statement and the index is using @Functions that are too large.
Remedy: Modify the CREATE INDEX statement so that all function parameters are not larger than the maximum data value length of 900 characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENIR
member.summary: 00358 EXE NIR Numeric date value not in range
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to convert either a character string or a number to a data format and the converted date is not within an acceptable date range.
Remedy: Verify that the dates being put in the database are between January 1, 0001 and December 31, 9999.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEOCT
member.summary: 00359 EXE OCT Table referenced by other cursor
member.remarks:
Reason: One cursor is attempted to modify or drop a table when another offending cursor is currently using that table.
Remedy: Commit, disconnect or have the offending cursor compile a statement using a different table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERSD
member.summary: 00360 EXE RSD Cannot revoke DBA from SYSADM
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a REVOKE DBA authority from a specific user and the user happens to be SYSADM.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke DBA authority from SYSADM.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEACI
member.summary: 00361 EXE ACI ADJUSTING CURSOR not allowed with embedded SELECT
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute an INSERT using ADJUSTING cursor name when the INSERT statement has an embedded SELECT statement.
Remedy: None. You cannot use the ADJUSTING cursor clause with an INSERT statement that uses an embedded SELECT statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEDHR
member.summary: 00362 EXE DHR User <user name> does not have RESOURCE authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a REVOKE RESOURCE authority statement from a user that does not have resource authority.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke an authority from a user when the user does not have that authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEETVC
member.summary: 00363 EXE TVC Too many view columns defined
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE VIEW and the number of columns defined in the new target view exceed the number of column selected from the source table or view.
Remedy: Correct the SQL CREATE VIEW statement. The number of columns selected to form the view must match the number of columns defined in the new view.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEETSE
member.summary: 00364 EXE TSE Too many view select expressions
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE VIEW and the number columns selected from the source table or view exceed the number of columns defined in the new target view.
Remedy: Correct the SQL CREATE VIEW statement. The number of columns select to formed the view must match the number of columns defined in the new view.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEPNO
member.summary: 00365 EXE PNO Privileges not owned for this user <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a REVOKE table privilege from a specific user and the user does not have the name privileges.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke a table privilege that does not exist.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIIF
member.summary: 00366 EXE IIF @function not supported as an index
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to specify an @function in the creation of an index and this particular @function is not supported by SQLBase as a possible index.
Remedy: None. This @function is not supported as an index.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEESNR
member.summary: 00367 EXE SNR Small integer value not in range
member.remarks:
Reason: A small integer value is not within the acceptable range of SMALLINT values.
Remedy: Correct the small integer value so that it is within the range of acceptable SMALLINT values. A SMALLINT value can have up to 5 digits of precision: -32,768 to +32,767.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEINR
member.summary: 00368 EXE INR Integer value not in range
member.remarks:
Reason: An integer value is not within the acceptable range of INTEGER values.
Remedy: Correct integer value so that it is within the range of acceptable INTEGER values. An INTEGER value can have up to 10 digits of precision: -2,147,483,648 to +2,147,483,647.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECCD
member.summary: 00369 EXE CCD Current cursor is on a different table
member.remarks:
Reason: A CURRENT OF cursorname clause is referring to a cursor which is currently referencing a different table. For example: With one cursor named C1 connected to the PAYROLL database, it is performing a select like: SELECT * FROM SALARY and with a second cursor connected to the PAYROLL database, it is attempting to perform an update or delete similar to: UPDATE EMP SET BONUS = 100 WHERE CURRENT OF C1
Remedy: Revise SQL statements so that both statements refer to the same table named in the same database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEOOC
member.summary: 00370 EXE OOC Table can have only one clustered hashed index
member.remarks:
Reason: A table can only have one CLUSTERED HASHED index.
Remedy: None. Only one CLUSTERED HASHED index can be created for any one table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEETNE
member.summary: 00371 EXE TNE Clustered index can only be created on an empty table
member.remarks:
Reason: A clustered hashed index can only be created on an empty table.
Remedy: Unload the target table. Recreate the table and create the clustered hashed index before inserting any data back into the table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIPD
member.summary: 00372 EXE IPD A clustered index was previously defined on this table
member.remarks:
Reason: A table can only have one CLUSTERED HASHED index.
Remedy: None. Only one CLUSTERED HASHED index can be created for any one table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENIV
member.summary: 00373 EXE NIV INDEX privilege not allowed on views
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENNE
member.summary: 00374 EXE NNE NOT NULL column <name> must be added only to an empty table
member.remarks:
Reason: A NOT NULL column cannot be added to a table that already has existing rows because if it could, then those columns of the existing rows would have NULL values in columns defined as NOT NULL, which would violate the definition.
Remedy: Add the column without defining the column as NOT NULL. Update the existing rows by putting data in the newly created column and then ALTER the column to NOT NULL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEEFE
member.summary: 00375 EXE EFE External function <name> already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified external function name already exists as an external function or external function synonym.
Remedy: Use a different external function name. External function names cannot be the same as an existing stored command, stored procedure, external function or external function synonym.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEBEF
member.summary: 00376 EXE BEF External function <name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified external function name does not exist.
Remedy: None, or use the correct name. The external function name may be misspelled or incorrect.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECUI
member.summary: 00377 EXE CUI Cannot update statistics of a CLUSTERED HASHED INDEX
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot update the index statistics on a CLUSTERED HASHED INDEX.
Remedy: None. The statistics of a CLUSTERED HASHED INDEX cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERCN
member.summary: 00378 EXE RCN ROWCOUNT not supported for read-only transactions
member.remarks:
Reason: The ROWCOUNT command is not supported for read-only transactions.
Remedy: None. The ROWCOUNT operation is not supported for read-only transactions.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEBRL
member.summary: 00379 EXE BRL Invalid ROWID
member.remarks:
Reason: Application has submitted an invalid rowid while using the ROWID=[rowid] constraint in the WHERE clause. SQLBase has determined this rowid cannot be matched with any row within the database. Valid rowid's are retrieved using SELECT ROWID.
Remedy: Correct the rowid by retrieving the correct rowid using SELECT ROWID.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECEF
member.summary: 00380 EXE CEF CHECK EXISTS failure
member.remarks:
Reason: An UPDATE statement was successful but no rows were updated.
Remedy: None. Informational only. The CHECK EXIST clause on the SQL UPDATE statement specifies to return this error if at least one row is NOT updated.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECAN
member.summary: 00381 EXE CAN NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEUFV
member.summary: 00382 EXE UFV Unmatched foreign key values
member.remarks:
Reason: Insert of a new row into a dependent table violates a referential integrity constraint because there was no parent row in the parent table.
Remedy: None. Informational only. This insert violates an existing referential integrity constraint, therefore to maintain the integrity of the data this insert is not allowed. For more information on how to enhance or customize this SQLBase error message, see the SQLBase Language Reference Manual, Chapter 6: Referential Integrity, in the section entitled "Enhancing SQLBase Error Messages".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDR
member.summary: 00383 EXE CDR Cannot delete row until all the dependent rows are deleted
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to delete a row from a parent table when there are dependent rows in a dependent table.
Remedy: None. Informational only. This delete violates an existing referential integrity constraint. Therefore, to maintain the integrity of the data, this delete is not allowed. For more information on how to enhance or customize this SQLBase error message, see the SQLBase SQL Language Reference Manual, Chapter 6: Referential Integrity, in the section entitled "Customizing SQLBase Error Messages".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEAMO
member.summary: 00384 EXE AMO Self-referencing table only allows one row from INSERT... SELECT
member.remarks:
Reason: The target table of the INSERT has foreign keys defined and one of them is self-referencing and the INSERT statement involves an INSERT with a nested subSELECT which returns multiple rows, so the INSERT operation is not permitted.
Remedy: None. Informational only. The INSERT with a nested subSELECT may violate an existing referential integrity constraint, therefore to maintain the integrity of the data this INSERT is not allowed. For more information on how to enhance or customize this SQLBase error message, see the SQLBase SQL Language Reference Manual, Chapter 6: Referential Integrity, in the section entitled "Customizing SQLBase Error Messages".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEUPO
member.summary: 00385 EXE UPO UPDATE involving primary key cannot update more than one row
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified UPDATE statement involves the updating of the primary key and the updating of multiple rows at one time.
Remedy: Update of a primary key must be done one row at a time.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECUR
member.summary: 00386 EXE CUR Cannot update the row until all dependent rows are deleted
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to update rows in a parent table when there are dependent rows in a dependent table.
Remedy: None. Informational only. You must delete all dependent rows before you can update the target row otherwise you will be violating an existing referential integrity constraint. For more information on how to enhance or customize this SQLBase error message, see the SQLBase SQL Language Reference Manual, Chapter 6: Referential Integrity, in the section entitled "Customizing SQLBase Error Messages".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENUI
member.summary: 00387 EXE NUI A suitable unique index must exist before adding primary key
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to add a primary key and no suitable unique index has been found to use after the system scanned all available indexes.
Remedy: Create an unique index on the column or columns to be included in the primary key. The column or columns making up the key must be unique and defined as NOT NULL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEAFU
member.summary: 00388 EXE AFU Adding a foreign key causes unmatched foreign key values
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to add a foreign key and the addition of this foreign key will cause unmatched foreign key values which would violate the referential integrity constraints.
Remedy: A foreign key references a primary key in the same table or another table. To add the foreign key, verify and correct the values in the foreign key column or columns so that their values match the values in the primary key column or columns.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEIND
member.summary: 00389 EXE IND NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECCL
member.summary: 00390 EXE CCL Cannot compare long data
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a comparison on a LONG VARCHAR data element or attempting to use a LIKE clause with a LONG VARCHAR datatype.
Remedy: Correct SQL statement and retry.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEFUP
member.summary: 00391 EXE FUP Select for update requires RR or CS isolation
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to perform a SQL SELECT statement using the FOR UPDATE OF clause and the transaction is not in the DB2 compatible locking modes of Read Repeatability (RR) or Cursor Stability (CS).
Remedy: Use the lock isolation modes of Read Repeatability (RR) or Cursor Stability (CS) when using the FOR UPDATE OF clause in the SQL SELECT statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENDR
member.summary: 00392 EXE NDR No DDL statement in read-only database
member.remarks:
Reason: SQL Data Definition Language statements are not allowed when operating with a read-only database.
Remedy: None. Informational only. To perform DDL statements on this database, you need to restart the database so read-only database is disabled.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEUEE
member.summary: 00393 EXE UEE User error already exists for the specified error class
member.remarks:
Reason: Performing an ALTER TABLE and trying to ADD a new user error for the specified error class and a user error already exists.
Remedy: Perform an ALTER TABLE and MODIFY the existing user error for the specified error class rather than attempting to create a new user error when one already exists.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEUEN
member.summary: 00394 EXE UEN User error not defined for the specified error class
member.remarks:
Reason: Performing an ALTER TABLE and trying to DROP or MODIFY an existing user error for a specific error class and the user error does not exist.
Remedy: None. Informational only. You cannot drop or modify a user error that does not exist. Verify that you have specified the correct user error number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECDK
member.summary: 00395 EXE CDK Cannot drop primary or foreign key column <column name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an ALTER TABLE to drop a column having either a primary or foreign key defined on the column.
Remedy: None, other than removing the column as a primary or foreign key before attempting to drop the column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEENUV
member.summary: 00396 EXE NUV UPDATE privilege not allowed on views
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEECIR
member.summary: 00397 EXE CIR Cannot index ROWID
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create an index on a table's ROWID.
Remedy: None. You cannot create an index on a table's ROWID.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEISH
member.summary: 00398 EXE ISH Invalid statistics column for a hashed index
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to force the statistics on columns that are meaningful for pure index (B-Tree) organization only.
Remedy: Correct the command and retry.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEEISI
member.summary: 00399 EXE ISI Invalid statistics columns for a B-Tree index
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to force the statistics on columns that are meaningful for hashed index organization only.
Remedy: Correct the command and retry.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXEERNO
member.summary: 00400 EXE RNO Cannot revoke non-granted execute privilege from user <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a REVOKE execute privilege from a user and the user does not have the specific named privilege granted.
Remedy: None. You cannot revoke an execute privilege from a user who does not have the specific named privilege.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECOD
member.summary: 00401 DBA COD Cannot open database
member.remarks:
Reason: FOR SQLBASE: The specified database cannot be found. SQLBase cannot find the file named "x:\dbdir\dbname\dbname.DBS" where x:\dbdir is either the default, c:\SQLBASE, or modified with the DBDIR SQL.INI configuration keyword. In a multiuser network configuration, this error indicates that your network is working correctly, but the database system was unable to locate the specified database filename. FOR NON-SQLBASE DATABASES: This problem can also occur with a SQLGateway when leaving out the protocol type in the SERVERNAME parameter that the client uses to communicate with the gateway (like SQLNBIOS). For example, SERVERNAME=SERVER33,SQLQUEUE DBNAME=DB2DBMS, SQLQUEUE, SQLNBIOS will nott allow a remote client process (using SQLNBIOS on the LAN to communicate with the SQLGateway machine) to connect to the SQLGateway machine. For SPX connectivity from DOS or MS Windows to a Unixware SQLBase Server check for the omission of the "serverpath=..." parameter in the SQL.INI file under the client section.
Remedy: Verify the database file exists. The default drive letter and dbdirname is c:\SQLBASE unless overridden with a DBDIR SQL.INI configuration keyword parameter. Verify the DBDIR keyword is not missing or pointing to a wrong database directory. Verify the DBNAME keyword is specified for the named database. Verify the SERVER keyword is not missing or conflicting with other network server names. In your CONFIG.SYS file, verify at least 40 files set with the FILES=40 parameter. If the server was being initialized while the connection was tried, retry the connection after the server has initialized. If all of the above fails, try using a different database name or try connecting to the database in single user mode at the same machine. If you can connect with a local engine it probably indicates a network configuration error exists. If you can connect with a new database name it probably indicates a previously named database was never properly initialized.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEWDB
member.summary: 00402 DBA WDB Wait for DBA structure
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEOFF
member.summary: 00403 DBA OFF Database found; but the file can't be opened
member.remarks:
Reason: The database has been successfully located but, the system could not open the file.
Remedy: Determine why the database file could not be opened by the database management system. Check at least 40 files are set with the FILES=40 parameter.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIPW
member.summary: 00404 DBA IPW Invalid password
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to connect to the database with a bad password.
Remedy: Use a valid database name, user name, and password.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIUN
member.summary: 00405 DBA IUN Invalid user name
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to connect to the database with an invalid user name.
Remedy: Use a valid database name, user name, and password.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDNP
member.summary: 00406 DBA DNP Escape sequence connect not supported
member.remarks:
Reason: Escape sequence connect not supported.
Remedy: None. Only standard connect to database/userid/password sequence supported.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECAD
member.summary: 00407 DBA CAD Out of memory at the database computer (DBA CAD)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDON
member.summary: 00408 DBA DON Database already opened with no recovery
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to connect to the database with recovery ON and the database server has already been connected to with recovery OFF.
Remedy: None. It is recommended that recovery is always ON.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDOR
member.summary: 00409 DBA DOR Database already opened with recovery
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to connect to the database with recovery OFF and the database server has already been connected to with recovery ON.
Remedy: None. It is recommended that recovery is always ON.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIDF
member.summary: 00410 DBA IDF Invalid database file
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database cannot be opened. The version number of the specified database conflicts with the version of SQLBase software being used.
Remedy: Verify that the version of the database file (.DBS) corresponds to the software version number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIDB
member.summary: 00411 DBA IDB Invalid database name
member.remarks:
Reason: A specified database name has been determined to be invalid.
Remedy: A valid database file name must consist of one to sixteen characters. The file name is not allowed to have any invalid characters such as: . " / \ [ ] : | + = ; , and ASCII characters less than 20 hexadecimal. Additionally, the character "space" is consider invalid.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDNA
member.summary: 00412 DBA DNA Unused - Error DBA COD is used for consistency
member.remarks:
Reason: This error occurs only for certain communication protocols (TCP/IP, specifically). Other protocols return DBA COD for similar errors.
Remedy: See DBAECOD.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAENLS
member.summary: 00413 DBA NLS NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAERIP
member.summary: 00414 DBA RIP Connects not allowed until restore is complete
member.remarks:
Reason: Online restore is in progress, other connections to the database are not allowed until the restore operation is complete.
Remedy: Wait until restore operation is complete.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEREC
member.summary: 00415 DBA REC Recovery operation in-progress
member.remarks:
Reason: Recovery operation is in progress, other connection to the database are not allowed until the recovery operation is complete.
Remedy: Wait until the recovery operation is complete.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEOUC
member.summary: 00416 DBA OUC Operation not allowed while other users are connected
member.remarks:
Reason: The operation attempting to be performed is not allowed while other users are connected to the SQLBase Server.
Remedy: Try again later or have everyone disconnect from the SQLBase Server so that you can perform your operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECCD
member.summary: 00417 DBA CCD Cannot create database file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAESDN
member.summary: 00418 DBA SDN Shutdown in progress
member.remarks:
Reason: The database is being shut down. Therefore, no new users are allowed to connect to the SQLBase Server.
Remedy: Try again later, the SQLBase Server is coming down.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEICM
member.summary: 00419 DBA ICM Incompatible connect mode
member.remarks:
Reason: When connecting to a database, a check is made to see if the requested connect mode is compatible with other users' connect modes to the database. This error occurs because the requested connect mode conflicts with another user already connected to the database.
Remedy: Wait and connect later or verify how other users are connected and attempt to connect in mode that is compatible with the existing users connected to the database. Possible conflicts could be: Current User Connect Modes Requested connect mode -------------------------- ---------------------- No recovery connect Server connect Normal connect Server connect Read-only database connect Server connect Read-only database connect Recovery connect

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECRD
member.summary: 00420 DBA CRD Cannot convert read-only database to current version
member.remarks:
Reason: The database you are attempting to connect to requires conversion to be compatible with the current server version. The database is read-only.
Remedy: Change the database to other than read-only, and back up the database with the prior version of the server. Then connect again with the current server version.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEISC
member.summary: 00421 DBA ISC Invalid server connect
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database server name is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the database server name and retry.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEISL
member.summary: 00422 DBA ISL Invalid servername length
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified servername length is invalid.
Remedy: Use a valid servername.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAENRS
member.summary: 00423 DBA NRS Not remote server
member.remarks:
Reason: A server name has been specified for a local single user database engine.
Remedy: Correct the server name specification. Server names are not necessary to communicate with a local database. If you are using the API, specify a pointer to a null terminator to indicate a null server name for a local database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEUCE
member.summary: 00424 DBA UCE Unexpected SQLBase condition
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEROE
member.summary: 00425 DBA ROE Read-only mode already enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enable read-only mode and the database is already in read-only mode.
Remedy: None. The database is already a read-only database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEROD
member.summary: 00426 DBA ROD Read-only mode already disabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to disable read-only mode and the database is not a read-only mode database.
Remedy: None. The database is not a read-only mode database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECCH
member.summary: 00427 DBA CCH Could not create history file on database computer
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIRS
member.summary: 00428 DBA IRS Invalid parameter setting for READONLY transaction value
member.remarks:
Reason: Setting whether read-only transactions are allowed and the setting is something other than OFF (0), ON (1), or DEFAULT (2).
Remedy: Use a proper read-only transaction option and resubmit.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDNB
member.summary: 00429 DBA DNB Database name is too big
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified database name exceeds sixteen characters.
Remedy: Correct specified database name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAENFS
member.summary: 00430 DBA NFS No free cursor slot while trying to close database
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECLF
member.summary: 00431 DBA CLF Clean up log files failed during restore from snapshot
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQLBase system is trying to read the log files to be deleted from the log file directory and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Verify that the log file directory as specified by the SQL.INI configuration parameter LOGDIR exists and try again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEISI
member.summary: 00432 DBA ISI Sort information in database does not match COUNTRY.SQL file
member.remarks:
Reason: Information found in the file COUNTRY.SQL does not properly correspond to information found in the database. Most likely, the database file was created with a different COUNTRY.SQL file other than the one currently being used.
Remedy: Verify the proper COUNTRY.SQL file is used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAERDE
member.summary: 00433 DBA RDE Read-only database already enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enable a read-only database and the database is already a read-only database.
Remedy: None. The database is already a read-only database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAERDD
member.summary: 00434 DBA RDD Read-only database already disabled
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to disable a read-only database and the database is not a read-only database.
Remedy: None. The database is not a read-only database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAETDM
member.summary: 00435 DBA TDM TEMPDIR must be specified to access read-only databases
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start or enable a read-only database and no TEMPDIR environment variable is set.
Remedy: Enter the following line in the AUTOEXEC.BAT file: TEMPDIR=C:\SQLBASE\databasename All the temporary files associated with a read-only database will then be stored in the TEMPDIR\databasename directory.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECTF
member.summary: 00436 DBA CTF Unable to create temporary file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEICP
member.summary: 00437 DBA ICP Code page in database does not match COUNTRY.SQL file
member.remarks:
Reason: Information found in the file COUNTRY.SQL does not properly correspond to information found in the database. Most likely, the database file was created with a different COUNTRY.SQL file other than the one currently being used.
Remedy: Verify the proper COUNTRY.SQL file is used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECCT
member.summary: 00438 DBA CCT Cannot create temporary file "<filename>" on server (error <num>)
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase could not create a temporary file, possibly to perform a sort.
Remedy: Create a TEMPDIR statement in SQL.INI that specifies a directory that exists, is writable, and has adequate free space.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEILW
member.summary: 00439 DBA ILW Lowercase table in database does not match COUNTRY.SQL file
member.remarks:
Reason: Information found in the file COUNTRY.SQL does not properly correspond to information found in the database. Most likely, the database file was created with a different COUNTRY.SQL file other than the one currently being used.
Remedy: Verify the proper COUNTRY.SQL file is used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIUP
member.summary: 00440 DBA IUP Uppercase table in database does not match COUNTRY.SQL file
member.remarks:
Reason: Information found in the file COUNTRY.SQL does not properly correspond to information found in the database. Most likely, the database file was created with a different COUNTRY.SQL file other than the one currently being used.
Remedy: Verify the proper COUNTRY.SQL file is used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAENDB
member.summary: 00441 DBA NDB SQLBase internal database connect failed
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase is attempting an internal "under-the-covers" connect to some database and a failure has occurred. Most likely, SQLBase was attempting to connect to the MAIN database for a partitioned database operation.
Remedy: Verify that the MAIN database exists. If necessary create the partitioned database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECOF
member.summary: 00442 DBA COF Cannot open database; file handles exceeded
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database cannot be opened because the number of file handles needed to complete the open would exceed the number of file handles available. The file handles are provided by the operating environment, i.e., DOS, Windows, OS/2.
Remedy: Investigate why so many databases were previously being connected by your application(s). Reduce these connections to a minimum. Deinstalling one or more databases will also make more file handles available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECAC
member.summary: 00443 DBA CAC Out of memory at the database computer (DBA CAC)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDUW
member.summary: 00444 DBA DUW Attempt to disconnect with uncommitted work (DBA DUW)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is trying to disconnect from a database without committing or rolling back the work done in the most recent transaction. This is disallowed if the transaction was started as a distributed transaction. WARNING: If you ignore this error and exit your application, the uncommitted work will be rolled back!
Remedy: Commit the transaction and issue the disconnect again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDTP
member.summary: 00445 DBA DTP Attempt to turn off recovery with pending distributed transactions.
member.remarks:
Reason: The user tried to connect to a database without recovery turned on; but the database still has distributed transactions pending recovery. If the no recovery connect is allowed, it will not be possible to resolve such transactions.
Remedy: Resolve the pending distributed transactions. Normally this will happen automatically when you connect to the database in the "normal" mode, if the commit-server(s) for the transactions is still accessible and the information is not lost. If this is not true or you don't care about how the transactions are resolved, you can manually resolve the transactions (see the manual), and then connect with recovery turned off.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAESDS
member.summary: 00446 DBA SDS Server shutdown in progress
member.remarks:
Reason: The server is being shutdown, therefore no new users are allowed to connect to the SQLBase Server.
Remedy: Try again later, the SQLBase Server is coming down.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEXDL
member.summary: 00447 DBA XDL Cannot open database; exclusively locked by another user.
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database cannot be opened because another user has locked the database for exclusive use with the LOCK DATABASE command.
Remedy: New connections to the database will be disallowed until the user who locked the database either issues an UNLOCK DATABASE command, or disconnects. When either of these actions occur, you should be able to access the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIVD
member.summary: 00448 DBA IVD DBS version (<version>), incompatible with software (<version>)
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified database cannot be opened. The version number of the specified database conflicts with the version of the SQLBase software being used. For example, the database file format is from a previous release version of SQLBase.
Remedy: Verify that the version of the database file (.DBS) is a compatible current software version. If the file version is incompatible, UNLOAD that database file with a compatible version of SQLBase software, then use the current version of SQLBase to LOAD that file into a compatible database format.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEDBN
member.summary: 00449 DBA DBN Cannot connect to database; number limit exceeded
member.remarks:
Reason: User cannot connect to the database because the number of current database connections has reached the maximum value.
Remedy: Disconnect unused databases and connect to it again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEANC
member.summary: 00450 DBA ANC Attributes not compatible
member.remarks:
Reason: The attribute of the database file is not compatible with the attribute of the database. Possibly the database is read-write but recorded on read-only media.
Remedy: Change the database file to read-write if possible. If the media is inherently read-only, such as CD-ROM, re-record the database after setting it to read-only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEFRO
member.summary: 00451 DBA FRO Database file is read-only
member.remarks:
Reason: The attribute of the database file is marked read-only. Possibly the database is on a read-only media or the write attribute of the file is turned off.
Remedy: Change the database file to read-write if possible. If the media is inherently read-only, such as CD-ROM, re-record the database after setting it to read-only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEUPG
member.summary: 00452 DBA UPG Cannot convert this database - Database has been shut down
member.remarks:
Reason: The database to which connection is being attempted requires conversion to be compatible with the current server version. An error occurred during the attempt to do the conversion. Fail.sql contains the original error as part of the debugging information
Remedy: Attempt to correct the problem documented in the Fail.sql file. When the error is corrected, start the database and attempt to connect again. A possible alternative is to LOAD the unloaded version of the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAERAS
member.summary: 00453 DBA RAS Operation not supported while running as a service
member.remarks:
Reason: The operation being attempted is not supported by SQLBase when it is running as a service.
Remedy: Run SQLBase as an application, or use another method of accomplishing this operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECDR
member.summary: 00454 DBA CDR Cannot disable Read Only Transactions while in this isolation level
member.remarks:
Reason: Disabling Read Only Transactions cannot be done while in a transaction with an isolation level of RO or RC.
Remedy: Set the isolation level to RL, RR or CS before disabling Read Only Transactions.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAETIP
member.summary: 00455 DBA TIP Cannot enable READONLYDATABASE with modifications pending
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot enable READONLYDATABASE while in a transaction where data is being modified.
Remedy: Commit or Rollback transaction and try again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEPAR
member.summary: 00456 DBA PAR Cannot open partitioned databases with external cache manager enabled.
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot open a partitioned database if the external cache manager is enabled.
Remedy: Use a non-partitioned database or disable the cache manager by setting the USECMCACHE parameter in sql.ini to 0.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEIRF
member.summary: 00457 DBA IRF Invalid SQL.INI remotedbname format
member.remarks:
