Reason: The remotedbname section in the SQL.INI in not correctly formatted.
Remedy: Check the Team Developer Documentation for the correct remotedbname syntax for the database being connected to.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECVL
member.summary: 00458 DBA CVL Database is locked during a conversion upgrade.
member.remarks:
Reason: The database file is marked as being in the process of performing an upgrade from an older version. For a large database, this can take minutes of time.
Remedy: Wait for the conversion to complete. If it doesn't complete, cause the server to exit and inspect the database directory containing the database files.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEADN
member.summary: 00459 DBA ADN Automatic database conversion is not allowed for active databases.
member.remarks:
Reason: The database file has an attribute set that indicates it is active. This may mean that there are active log files associated with it. It's safer to automatically convert databases that are self contained in a single file.
Remedy: The database should be deinstalled in the version of the server it was used with. If that isn't possible, the manual migration step can be used instead of the automatic migration method. Please see the migration utility.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEMUL
member.summary: 00460 DBA MUL The SQLBase unloader utility is not available for the automatic conversion
member.remarks:
of database.
Reason: During the automatic conversion, the unloader utility is invoked for the version of the database file that requires conversion. SBHELPER<unloader version> has been searched for and not found.
Remedy: Contact customer support about obtaining a copy of the unload utility needed and copy it into the executable directory.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECTD
member.summary: 00461 DBA CTD Cannot create a directory for conversion and access it.
member.remarks:
Reason: In order to prevent loss of data, the database being converted is copied to a temporary conversion subdirectory of the database directory.
Remedy: If the temporary database directory from a previous attempt exists, delete it so that the conversion can retry. Otherwise, correct permission problems creating directories and writing files to the database directory being converted.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECTP
member.summary: 00462 DBA CTP Cannot create or access a file or directory for database conversion.
member.remarks:
Reason: In order to prevent loss of data, the database being converted is copied to a temporary conversion subdirectory, underneath the database directory. Files are created and destroyed during the conversion process.
Remedy: Correct permission problems creating directories and writing files to the database directory being converted. Make sure there is enough space to duplicate the original database and create an unload file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECLC
member.summary: 00463 DBA CLC Cannot locate COUNTRY.SQL for database conversion.
member.remarks:
Reason: The COUNTRY setting is set in the server, so there is an assumption that the country.sql setting is the same for the database being converted. The second assumption is that the file is the same for the older version of the database being converted and for the current version. Because the format of the file hasn't changed, we attempt to locate the file for the current version of the server.
Remedy: Make sure the server has access to the COUNTRY.SQL file needed for the conversion.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEUFL
member.summary: 00464 DBA UFL The database conversion unload step failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: The database requires conversion and the conversion unload step failed.
Remedy: Check the database directory for a unload status text file that might provide some information about what error occured.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECLN
member.summary: 00465 DBA CLN Error cleaning up conversion files
member.remarks:
Reason: The database conversion conversion process creates a conversion directory that it also cleans up and reuses. There is an error managing this process.
Remedy: Manually navigate to the database conversion directory and clean it up. Then retry the operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAESDB
member.summary: 00466 DBA SDB Cannot locate START.DBS or use it to create a new database
member.remarks:
Reason: The database conversion conversion process requires a START.DBS for a starting database to create the newly converted database from.
Remedy: Make sure that START.DBS is available for use by the server.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEMLD
member.summary: 00467 DBA MLD The SQLBase loader utility, sbhelper, is not available for the automatic conversion
member.remarks:
of database.
Reason: During the automatic conversion, the loader utility is invoked to create a new database for use by the server. It's missing.
Remedy: Make sure the sbhelper utility is available in the same executable directory as the database server. If this is not feasible, there will be <dbname>.unl in the database directory that can be used to manually load a new database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAELFL
member.summary: 00468 DBA LFL Load step failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: The conversion load step failed.
Remedy: Check the database directory for a load status text file that might provide some information about what error occured. The unload file is also present so that a manual load can be performed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAEMOV
member.summary: 00469 DBA MOV Moving converted database into position failed
member.remarks:
Reason: The conversion failed to replace the old database filel with the newly converted database file.
Remedy: Check the database and manually clean it up.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBAECLR
member.summary: 00470 DBA CLR Cursor limit exceeded on a connection
member.remarks:
Reason: User cannot create another cursor on this connection because the limit has been reached.
Remedy: The server allows 250 cursors on a connection. Find a way to limit the number of cursors need on a single connection

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.WSPEISP
member.summary: 00501 WSP ISP NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.WSPECNA
member.summary: 00502 WSP CNA Out of memory at the database computer (WSP CNA)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.WSPETMC
member.summary: 00503 WSP TMC NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.WSPECRP
member.summary: 00504 WSP CRP Cannot relocate pointer
member.remarks:
Reason: A pointer which is part of a view or stored command cannot be relocated. This relocation happens when a view is referenced in a subsequent command or when a stored command is retrieved. The object being retrieved (either a view or a stored command) may be bad. A pointer stored in the view or stored command is no longer valid and therefore cannot be relocated. Also, the pointer might be good but the data structure used to relocate the pointer may be bad.
Remedy: The problem can be resolved by dropping the view or restoring the stored command. Run a CHECK DATABASE to verify the integrity of the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.WSPEWLE
member.summary: 00505 WSP WLE Work space limit exceeded
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICEITN
member.summary: 00601 DIC ITN Table <table name> has not been created
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified table name does not exist.
Remedy: Submit the SQL statement with a correct (existing) table name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICETAE
member.summary: 00602 DIC TAE NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICEICN
member.summary: 00603 DIC ICN Invalid column number
member.remarks:
Reason: A column has been specified by column number and the column number specified cannot be translated to an appropriate column name.
Remedy: Specify a valid column number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICEIIN
member.summary: 00604 DIC IIN Invalid index number
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to execute a SQL EXPLAIN statement and SQLBase cannot find a particular index looking it up by index number.
Remedy: If the EXPLAIN was based on a STORED command, drop the stored command, restore it, and try the EXPLAIN again. If the EXPLAIN was following a compile of a SQL statement, run a CHECK DATABASE to verify the consistency of the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICESYN
member.summary: 00605 DIC SYN Synonym <synonym name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to drop a synonym and the specified synonym name does not exist.
Remedy: Specify a correct (existing) synonym name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICEIVN
member.summary: 00606 DIC IVN Event does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified event name does not exist.
Remedy: Submit the SQL statement with a correct (existing) event name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICESTN
member.summary: 00607 DIC STN A system table definition in the dictionary could not be found.
member.remarks:
Reason: While creating the external dictionary, SQLBase was unable to successfully retrieve a system table definition from the internal dictionary.
Remedy: The database may be corrupt, or an internal SQLBase error may have occurred. Try to drop and recreate the database, or contact SQLBase Technical Services.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICESTC
member.summary: 00608 DIC STC Security initialization in the external dictionary has failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: While initializing security settings in the external dictionary, SQLBase was unable to successfully retrieve a system table definition from the internal dictionary.
Remedy: The database may be corrupt, or an internal SQLBase error may have occurred. Try to drop and recreate the database, or contact SQLBase Technical Services.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICENSO
member.summary: 00609 DIC NSO <name1> is not a synonym for <name2>
member.remarks:
Reason: The DROP SYNONYM has been used with the FOR clause. When this clause is used, a check is made that the synonym being dropped is actually a synonym for the object named in the FOR clause.
Remedy: Check the synonym and object names to make sure that the synonym name is actually a synonym for the object name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DICECVT
member.summary: 00610 DIC CVT Conversion of internal trigger dictionary failed - Entry not found
member.remarks:
Reason: The attempt to convert trigger entries from Version 6.0 format to the current version failed. The internal definition of the trigger was not found.
Remedy: Restore the database with the backup under version 6.0.x. Execute a check database command. If the problem persists, unload the database under Version 6.0, and reload under the current version, or contact SQLBase Technical Services.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEOCP
member.summary: 00701 VIO OCP Out of cache pages
member.remarks:
Reason: Database cache is page buffers which can hold the most recently referenced database pages. The number of cache pages is specified by the CACHE configuration parameter in the SQL.INI file. Whenever a database page is accessed, SQLBase first locates a cache page for it. Sometimes the database page is already in cache. If the page is not already in the cache, SQLBase locates a free cache page and reads the database page into the cache page and then uses the cache page buffer to perform the desired operation. While SQLBase is performing operations on the cache page it refers to them as "inuse". Once SQLBase is done with the cache page, it is marked as "free". To locate free cache pages, SQLBase searches a LRU (least recently used) chain. If SQLBase goes through the entire LRU chain and all pages are inuse, it waits and then gives this error message. If some user frees up a page while SQLBase is waiting, SQLBase uses that page.
Remedy: There are various alternatives to avoiding this problem. One quick solution is to increase the number of CACHE pages. Another solution is to reduce the number of "inuse" cache pages by reducing the span of the active transactions. That is, COMMIT the transaction more often in the application programs. Also, try eliminating any unnecessary drivers at the database computer such as DOS16M settings, HIMEM.SYS, etc.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEPNO
member.summary: 00702 VIO PNO Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO PNO)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEIPN
member.summary: 00703 VIO IPN Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO IPN)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEDUN
member.summary: 00704 VIO DUN Crashed with recovery off, database unrecoverable
member.remarks:
Reason: The database has crashed with recovery turned OFF.
Remedy: The database is unrecoverable. Restore the database to the most recent backup copy of the database. All transactions since the most recent backup will be lost.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOENFT
member.summary: 00705 VIO NFT NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOECPO
member.summary: 00706 VIO CPO Out of memory at the database computer (VIO CPO)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOETBO
member.summary: 00707 VIO TBO Out of memory at the database computer (VIO TBO)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOENUR
member.summary: 00708 VIO NUR No updates with read only isolation
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE while in Read Only (RO) Locking Isolation Mode.
Remedy: Change isolation mode setting to either Read Repeatability (RR), Cursor Stability (CS), or Release Lock (RL) locking isolation mode before attempting to do an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEBVC
member.summary: 00709 VIO BVC Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO BVC)

Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOERFI
member.summary: 00715 VIO RFI Rollforward interrupted - must restore database backup again
member.remarks:
Reason: A ROLLFORWARD operation was unexpectedly interrupted.
Remedy: To restore the database, the RESTORE operation must be restarted again, from the beginning.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEMOR
member.summary: 00716 VIO MOR NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOETHR
member.summary: 00717 VIO THR NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEBKF
member.summary: 00718 VIO BKF Restored backup file requires media recovery: use ROLLFORWARD command
member.remarks:
Reason: A restore of a backup file has failed.
Remedy: The failed restore should be treated as if a media failure has occurred. Use media recovery techniques. Use the ROLLFORWARD command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOERFS
member.summary: 00719 VIO RFS Cannot connect until rollforward completed, use ROLLFORWARD END command
member.remarks:
Reason: A ROLLFORWARD operation has not been completed and a user is attempting to connect to the database.
Remedy: Issue a ROLLFORWARD END command to complete the rollforward operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEUCO
member.summary: 00720 VIO UCO Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO UCO)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEDMO
member.summary: 00721 VIO DMO Cannot access or extend database beyond licensed constraint
member.remarks:
Reason: The RDBMS you are using has a license constraint on database size
Remedy: Reduce the size of the database or acquire an unconstrained version of the software.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEMIP
member.summary: 00722 VIO MIP Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO MIP)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOENRD
member.summary: 00723 VIO NRD No updates against read only database
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot perform INSERTs, UPDATEs, DELETEs, or any other operations that change the database when operating with a Read Only database.
Remedy: None. Informational Only. Read Only databases do not allow changes. Query access only is allowed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEPMC
member.summary: 00724 VIO PMC Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO PMC)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEITP
member.summary: 00725 VIO ITP Fatal SQLBase System Failure (VIO ITP)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEDNL
member.summary: 00726 VIO DNL Cannot have distributed transaction with logging disabled.
member.remarks:
Reason: The user attempted to start a distributed transaction in a database with logging disabled -- perhaps due to connecting to the database with RECOVERY OFF.
Remedy: Either connect to the database with RECOVERY ON, or turn off distributed transactions.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOECAL
member.summary: 00727 VIO CAL Out of memory at the database computer (VIO CAT)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEDTN
member.summary: 00728 VIO DTN Distributed transaction not supported
member.remarks:
Reason: The user attempted to start a distributed transaction in a database server which does not support two-phase commit.
Remedy: Turn off distributed transactions before connecting to this database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOECPG
member.summary: 00729 VIO CPG A corrupted page is found (VIO CPG)
member.remarks:
Reason: A page is in a corrupted state after it is retrieved from the database. The data on the page is not consistent with the expected value and format.
Remedy: Recover the database from a backup database and logs. A page is corrupted and should be treated as a media failure in the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEBPN
member.summary: 00730 VIO BPN A bad page number is found (VIO BPN)
member.remarks:
Reason: A bad page number is found in the database. The page which contains this page number is corrupted.
Remedy: Recover the database from a backup database and logs. A page is corrupted and should be treated as a media failure in the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOECNS
member.summary: 00731 VIO CNS Cannot start any more transactions
member.remarks:
Reason: You have reached the maximum number of allowed transactions.
Remedy: Reduce the number of active connections and retry the application.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOEMZU
member.summary: 00732 VIO MZU Page being modified has a zero use count (VIO MZU)
member.remarks:
Reason: The use count is 1) maintained incorrectly or 2) corrupted.
Remedy: None. Report incident to Gupta technical support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOERZU
member.summary: 00733 VIO RZU Page being released has a zero use count (VIO RZU)
member.remarks:
Reason: The use count is 1) maintained incorrectly or 2) corrupted.
Remedy: None. Report incident to Gupta technical support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOESTL
member.summary: 00734 VIO STL Data has been modified by a different transaction.
member.remarks:
Reason: The data that you are trying to update has been modified by another transaction. Your transaction has been rolled back.
Remedy: Attempt the update again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOECMI
member.summary: 00735 VIO CMI Failed to initialize the external cache manager
member.remarks:
Reason: The external cache manager failed to initialize. The two most likely causes are an incomplete installation of SQLBase (missing cache daemon), or the CACHE size exceeds the amount of available memory.
Remedy: Check the message in fail.sql to determine cause of failure

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.VIOECMT
member.summary: 00736 VIO CMT Cannot initialize external cache manager with encryption enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: The external cache manager is not currently supported with SQLBase Treasury.
Remedy: Disable the external Cache Manager in SQL.INI (usecmcache=0).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEEND
member.summary: 00801 ROW END INTERNAL USE ONLY - End of fetch
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEISA
member.summary: 00802 ROW ISA Insufficient data page space available to update column(s)
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to update a row where the size of the row has grown to exceed the maximum space available for this row in the data page and its extent pages.
Remedy: Unload the table, drop the table, and recreate the table with a larger PCTFREE value, and then reload the table. A larger PCTFREE will allow more space on each data page for the growth of rows such as the one attempting to be updated.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEUEP
member.summary: 00803 ROW UEP Fatal SQLBase System Failure (ROW UEP)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEKTL
member.summary: 00804 ROW KTL Key value is too large
member.remarks:
Reason: The row key value exceeds 255 characters.
Remedy: Modify the index being used or modify the ORDER BY or GROUP BY clause being used so the key does not exceed 255 characters. See the formula for computing the size of an index in the CREATE INDEX documentation of the SQL Language Reference Manual.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWENUD
member.summary: 00805 ROW NUD Insert/update of unique constrained columns with duplicate data
member.remarks:
Reason: The target table of an INSERT or UPDATE operation is constrained (by a CREATE UNIQUE INDEX statement) to have unique values in certain columns. Completion of the requested INSERT or UPDATE would result in duplicate values occurring in the row. If a view is the object of the INSERT or UPDATE statement, the table that defines the view is constrained. The update might also be caused by a DELETE operation of a parent row that cascades to a dependent row with a delete rule of SET NULL.
Remedy: Examine the definitions for any UNIQUE INDEX indexes to determine the uniqueness constraints imposed. For an UPDATE statement, verify that the specified operation is consistent with the uniqueness constraint. If this does not indicate the error, examine the target table to determine the cause of the problem. For an INSERT statement, examine the target table to determine which values violate the uniqueness constraint. If the INSERT statement contains a subquery, match the contents of the table addressed by the subquery and the contents of the target table to determine the cause of the problem. For a DELETE statement, examine the index key columns in the table that defines the index. These columns contain a foreign key, which when set NULL on a cascade delete from the target table, causes the duplicate values.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEIRI
member.summary: 00806 ROW IRI Invalid ROWID
member.remarks:
Reason: Application has submitted an invalid ROWID while using the ROWID=[rowid] constraint in the where clause. SQLBase has determined that this ROWID cannot be matched with any row within the database. Valid ROWIDs are retrieved using SELECT ROWID.
Remedy: Correct the ROWID by retrieving the correct ROWID using SELECT ROWID.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEIIC
member.summary: 00807 ROW IIC Index is corrupt
member.remarks:
Reason: The current operation is attempting to use an index that has been found to be corrupt.
Remedy: Try to determine which index is corrupt. The EXPLAIN command may help diagnose which indexes were being used. Running a CHECK DATABASE may also flush out the corrupt index. Once you have identified the corrupt index, drop the index, and recreate it. Run CHECK DATABASE to verify the consistency of the database. And, finally, rerun the operation that was causing the corrupt index problem to occur.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEUFA
member.summary: 00808 ROW UFA Fatal SQLBase System Failure (ROW UFA)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEBPT
member.summary: 00809 ROW BPT CHECK Failure (ROW BPT): <data page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWERIF
member.summary: 00833 ROW RIF Fatal SQLBase System Failure (ROW RIF)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWECKU
member.summary: 00834 ROW CKU Cannot UPDATE the key of a CLUSTERED HASHED index
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot UPDATE any columns used in a clustered hash index.
Remedy: Delete the row and re-insert the row with the new clustered hashed index values.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEMHV
member.summary: 00835 ROW MHV CHECK Failure (ROW MHV): <data page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWETNN
member.summary: 00836 ROW TNN CLUSTERED HASHED index must be created on a freshly created table
member.remarks:
Reason: A CREATE INDEX statement that specifies a clustered hashed index must be given after the CREATE TABLE statement and before any data is inserted into the table.
Remedy: Unload the table data. DROP and re-CREATE the table. Create the CLUSTERED HASHED index. Reload the data.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEIVF
member.summary: 00837 ROW IVF INTERNAL USE ONLY - Invalid function
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWERTL
member.summary: 00838 ROW RTL Initial row size is too large
member.remarks:
Reason: Row attempting to be insert is too large for the system. The number of columns and width of each column exceeds the maximum size available. The row length for a table cannot exceed the page size of the table space in which that table resides (or is to reside).
Remedy: Re-evaluate the structure of table and determine if it is possible to create multiple tables for the single table currently being used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWECNL
member.summary: 00839 ROW CNL Fatal SQLBase System Failure (ROW CNL)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWECND

member.remarks:

Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.summary: 00843 ROW PEB CHECK Failure (ROW PEB): <data page corrupted>
member.remarks:

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEBLP
member.summary: 00845 ROW BLP CHECK Failure (ROW BLP): <long data page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEBLS
member.summary: 00846 ROW BLS CHECK Failure (ROW BLS): <long data page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEIRS
member.summary: 00847 ROW IRS Row size is too big for a temporary table
member.remarks:
Reason: (This error is now obsolete.) The system has detected an excessively large row size exceeding the useable space of a single row page violating the temporary- table constraint that no extension pages are allowed, a known problem requiring future enhancement to correct.
Remedy: Modify the query to avoid causing the system to use temporary table(s) or generating large (result) row size(s).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEPRM
member.summary: 00848 ROW PRM Row being processed for a DELETE/UPDATE was modified by triggered actions
member.remarks:
Reason: A DELETE/UPDATE operation was in progress and it was detected that a row being deleted/updated was modified by a triggered action such as a BEFORE DELETE or a BEFORE UPDATE trigger that fires FOR EACH ROW. Such a trigger MUST NOT attempt to issue DML (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE) either directly or indirectly against the table on which the trigger is defined. An indirect DML action may occur for example if the trigger issues DML that causes other triggers to fire or causes referential triggered actions (such as DELETE CASCADE, DELETE SET NULL) to occur.
Remedy: Modify the trigger so that it does not issue INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE actions directly or indirectly against the table on which the trigger is defined.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWEIVP
member.summary: 00849 ROW IVP Fatal SQLBase System Failure (ROW IVP)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.ROWELRP
member.summary: 00850 ROW LRP CHECK Failure (ROW LRP): <data page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: A database page was accessed and it is of a different type than expected.
Remedy: One possible cause for this is that a row is requested with a ROW ID that specifies a row that is not a valid table row.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSECNE
member.summary: 00901 PRS CNE Command not properly ended
member.remarks:
Reason: The end of a SQL statement was unexpectedly determined.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL statement syntax is correct and that the statement was not somehow truncated.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMFC
member.summary: 00902 PRS MFC Missing FROM clause
member.remarks:
Reason: The FROM clause is missing from a SELECT statement.
Remedy: Verify that the FROM clause exists and that it is correctly entered after the select list, for example: SELECT columnnames FROM tablename ...

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICC
member.summary: 00903 PRS ICC Invalid CREATE command
member.remarks:
Reason: Keyword immediately following the CREATE verb is not invalid.
Remedy: Verify the keyword immediately following the CREATE verb keyword is either TABLE, INDEX, UNIQUE (index), SYNONYM, PUBLIC (synonym), VIEW, DBAREA, STOGROUP, DATABASE, or EXTERNAL.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMLP
member.summary: 00904 PRS MLP Missing left parenthesis
member.remarks:
Reason: A missing left parenthesis has been determined.
Remedy: Check the syntax of the SQL statement to determine the missing left parenthesis.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMRP
member.summary: 00905 PRS MRP Missing right parenthesis
member.remarks:
Reason: A missing right parenthesis has been determined.
Remedy: Check the syntax of the SQL statement to determine the missing right parenthesis.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEITN
member.summary: 00906 PRS ITN Invalid table name
member.remarks:
Reason: The table name is invalid.
Remedy: Verify that the specified table name is valid.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICN
member.summary: 00907 PRS ICN Invalid column name
member.remarks:
Reason: The column name is invalid.
Remedy: Verify that the specified column names are valid.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICS
member.summary: 00908 PRS ICS Invalid CHAR or VARCHAR size
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create or modify a column and the specified size exceeds 900 characters.
Remedy: Modify statement so CHAR or VARCHAR size does not exceed 900 characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEINC
member.summary: 00909 PRS INC Invalid character
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQL parser has determined an invalid character while searching for quoted strings, numbers, keywords, and identifiers.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL statement is correctly stated and that no invalid characters are present.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEITL
member.summary: 00910 PRS ITL Identifier too long
member.remarks:
Reason: An identifier exceeds 36 characters.
Remedy: Correct the identifier that exceeds 36 characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMIK
member.summary: 00911 PRS MIK Missing INTO keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: INTO keyword is missing from an INSERT statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. All INSERT statements begin "INSERT INTO tablename...".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMVK
member.summary: 00912 PRS MVK Missing VALUES keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: VALUES keyword is missing from an INSERT statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSENEV
member.summary: 00913 PRS NEV Number of INSERT values not equal to number of target columns
member.remarks:
Reason: The number of columns specified in the INSERT statement does not match the number of values specified in the VALUES clause.
Remedy: Correct the the SQL statement. The number of columns exceeds the number of values. Specify one and only one value for each of the specified object columns.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIBV
member.summary: 00914 PRS IBV Invalid bind variable
member.remarks:
Reason: A bind variable, identified because it follows a colon, has been determined as invalid.
Remedy: Check that each bind variable is either a number or valid identifier.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIVC
member.summary: 00915 PRS IVC Invalid constant
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid constant has been determined.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEQNE
member.summary: 00916 PRS QNE Quoted string not ended properly
member.remarks:
Reason: A quoted string has not been properly terminated.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEISC
member.summary: 00917 PRS ISC Invalid SQL statement
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQL statement verb is invalid.
Remedy: Verify that the first keyword is a valid SQL statement verb.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSETMV
member.summary: 00918 PRS TMV Number of INSERT values exceeds number of target columns
member.remarks:
Reason: The number of columns specified in the INSERT statement does not match the number of values specified in the VALUES clause.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The number of values exceeds the number of columns. Specify one and only one value for each of the specified object columns.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEQTL
member.summary: 00919 PRS QTL Quoted string too long
member.remarks:
Reason: A quoted string is longer than 900 characters.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMES
member.summary: 00920 PRS MES Missing equal sign
member.remarks:
Reason: An equal sign is missing in an UPDATE statement.
Remedy: Correct the UPDATE statement. The SET clause within an UPDATE statement has the general form of: SET column-name = expression

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIVO
member.summary: 00921 PRS IVO Invalid operator
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid operator has been determined. The SQL parser was attempting to parse a boolean factor when it discovered this invalid operator.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMCP
member.summary: 00922 PRS MCP Missing comma or parenthesis
member.remarks:
Reason: A missing comma or parenthesis has been determined in an INSERT statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMSE
member.summary: 00923 PRS MSE Missing SET keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: A SET keyword is missing in an UPDATE statement.
Remedy: Correct the UPDATE statement. The SET clause within an UPDATE statement has the general form of: SET column-name = expression

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSECST
member.summary: 00924 PRS CST Column <name> specified more than once

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMFK
member.summary: 00925 PRS MFK Missing FROM keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL statement is attempting to revoke user privileges FROM a specific table, revoke connect, DBA, or resource authority from users, or is deleting rows from a specified table and has failed to properly specify the FROM keyword.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMNK
member.summary: 00926 PRS MNK Missing NULL keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: The keyword NULL is missing.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMOK
member.summary: 00927 PRS MOK Missing ON keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL statement is attempting to grant user privileges on a table, create an index on a table, or comment on a table or column and has failed to properly specify the ON keyword.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMBK
member.summary: 00928 PRS MBK Missing BY keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL statement is using the ORDER BY clause, GROUP BY clause, or granting connect authority to users identified by passwords and the BY keyword was not properly specified.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIDC
member.summary: 00929 PRS IDC Invalid DROP command
member.remarks:
Reason: The next keyword immediately following a DROP verb is invalid.
Remedy: Verify the keyword immediately following the DROP verb keyword is either TABLE, SYNONYM, PUBLIC (synonym), VIEW, INDEX, DATABASE, DBAREA, STOGROUP, TRIGGER, EVENT, or EXTERNAL (function).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIIN
member.summary: 00930 PRS IIN Invalid index name
member.remarks:
Reason: The index name specified in a CREATE [UNIQUE] INDEX, DROP INDEX, UPDATE STATISTICS, or CHECK INDEX is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. An index name can be a qualified or unqualified long identifier. The qualified form is an userID followed by a period and a long identifier. An unqualified index name in a SQL statement is implicitly qualified by the userID of the user who issued the statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIVD
member.summary: 00931 PRS IVD Invalid date and/or time
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid date was determined in the SQL statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSETMC
member.summary: 00932 PRS TMC Too many columns defined
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to execute a CREATE TABLE, CREATE VIEW, or ALTER TABLE to add columns and the number of columns exceeds the maximum (253) number of columns allowed for any table or view.
Remedy: Modify the SQL statement so it does not exceed the maximum (253) number of columns allowed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICL
member.summary: 00933 PRS ICL Invalid CLIENT LIMIT value
member.remarks:
Reason: An attempt was made to set the CLIENT LIMIT out of bounds of the legal limits. The CLIENT LIMIT may be set to a number between 1 and 255.
Remedy: Modify the Server statement so the CLIENT LIMIT is between 1 and 255.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIVN
member.summary: 00934 PRS IVN Invalid number
member.remarks:
Reason: The database is attempting to parse a number in a SQL statement and is finding the number to be invalid.
Remedy: Correct SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSECLX
member.summary: 00935 PRS CLX CLIENT LIMIT exceeds the number of clients allowed by this server
member.remarks:
Reason: This server is licensed to support a limited number of clients and an attempt was made to set the CLIENT LIMIT above the licensed limit.
Remedy: Reduce the CLIENT LIMIT to be less than or equal to the number of licensed clients for this server.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIAO
member.summary: 00936 PRS IAO Invalid ALTER option
member.remarks:
Reason: An unexpected or missing keyword found immediately after the ALTER verb keyword.
Remedy: Correct the ALTER SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSESFN
member.summary: 00937 PRS SFN Set function not allowed here
member.remarks:
Reason: A set function was found that is not allowed in conjunction with the current nesting level and various set function rules.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICD
member.summary: 00938 PRS ICD Invalid CLIENT DBA option
member.remarks:
Reason: The option specified for DBA was not ON or OFF. These are the only allowable options for SET CLIENT DBA.
Remedy: Correct the SET CLIENT DBA option to be either ON or OFF

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIAS
member.summary: 00939 PRS IAS Invalid asterisk
member.remarks:
Reason: While parsing a SELECT statement the system has determined an invalid asterisk.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEITA
member.summary: 00940 PRS ITA Invalid tablename.*
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid tablename.* has been determined.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMAK
member.summary: 00941 PRS MAK Missing AND keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: The AND keyword is missing from a BETWEEN predicate clause.
Remedy: Correct SQL statement. The BETWEEN predicate clause has the general syntax of: expression [NOT] BETWEEN expression AND expression

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEAWC
member.summary: 00942 PRS AWC Asterisk allowed only with COUNT
member.remarks:
Reason: An asterisk has been found in a function and the function is not the COUNT(*) function.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMTK
member.summary: 00943 PRS MTK Missing TO keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to GRANT authority TO a user or attempting to ALTER an old password TO a new password and the TO keyword is missing.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEUST
member.summary: 00944 PRS UST Duplicate user name <name> in list
member.remarks:
Reason: While parsing the list a users, the same user name has been found to appear more than once.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIPW
member.summary: 00945 PRS IPW Invalid password
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant connect authority to a user or attempting to change a password and the one of the specified passwords has been found to be invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIWI
member.summary: 00946 PRS IWI Invalid WITHOUT INDEXES clause
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CHECK TABLE command with the WITHOUT INDEXES clause but the keywords WITHOUT and/or INDEXES are either missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIUN
member.summary: 00947 PRS IUN Invalid user name
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant connect authority to any number of users and one of the specified user names has been found to be invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIPR
member.summary: 00948 PRS IPR Invalid privilege specified
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant table privileges and one of the specified privileges is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Valid privileges are ALL, SELECT, INSERT, DELETE, INDEX, ALTER, or UPDATE columname.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMID
member.summary: 00949 PRS MID Missing IDENTIFIED keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant connect authority to a user or users and the keyword IDENTIFIED is missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct SQL statement. The grant connect authority syntax is: GRANT CONNECT TO authorization-id IDENTIFIED BY password

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMIS
member.summary: 00950 PRS MIS Missing IS keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a COMMENT ON statement and the keyword IS is missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.The COMMENT ON syntax is: COMMENT ON TABLE tablename IS string-constant or COMMENT ON COLUMN columnname IS string-constant

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSECOM
member.summary: 00951 PRS COM Invalid COMMENT command
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a COMMENT ON statement and the COMMENT ON TABLE keywords are not immediately followed by a table name or view name, or the COMMENT ON COLUMN is not immediately followed by a column name.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMDK
member.summary: 00952 PRS MDK Missing datatype keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE TABLE or ALTER TABLE to add or modify a column and the data type specified is misspelled or missing.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Check valid data types in the SQL Language Reference Guide.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMTN
member.summary: 00953 PRS MTN Missing table name
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a COMMENT ON COLUMN tablename.columnname or viewname.columnname and the tablename or viewname is missing.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEGBE
member.summary: 00954 PRS GBE GROUP BY under EXISTS
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a GROUP BY clause under an EXISTS predicate clause.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The EXISTS predicate tests for the existence of certain rows in a table. The testing of existence cannot be grouped.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMSC
member.summary: 00955 PRS MSC SELECT clause of a subquery specifies multiple columns
member.remarks:
Reason: In the context in which it was used in the SQL statement, the subquery can have only one column specified in its SELECT clause because this is not an EXISTS subselect and because it uses multiple columns.
Remedy: Correct the syntax of the SQL statement. Refer to the SQL Language Reference Manual for information about restrictions on the syntax for subqueries.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEISO
member.summary: 00956 PRS ISO Invalid SYSTEM ONLY clause
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CHECK DATABASE command with the SYSTEM ONLY clause but the keywords SYSTEM and/or ONLY are either missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIUI
member.summary: 00957 PRS IUI Invalid UNION
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a UNION of two SELECT statements and the second SELECT statement is missing.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSESSR
member.summary: 00958 PRS SSR Subselect required
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a subselect but the first keyword after the left parenthesis is not a SELECT keyword. It may be missing or just misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIWC
member.summary: 00959 PRS IWC Invalid wait code
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a WAIT or POST command and the event number specified is invalid or missing.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The WAIT or POST command has the general form of WAIT n or POST n where n is some valid integer.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMFO
member.summary: 00960 PRS MFO Missing FOR keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE SYNONYM statement or a ALTER TABLE statement for user specified referential integrity errors and the FOR keyword is either missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. See the SQL Language Reference Manual for information on the syntax of the CREATE SYNONYM statement and the ALTER TABLE statement for user specified referential integrity errors.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEISN
member.summary: 00961 PRS ISN Invalid SYNONYM name
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create or drop a synonym and the specified synonym name is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. A synonym name can be any long identifier that designates a table or view. A synonym name can be used wherever a table name or view name could be used to reference a table or view.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMSL
member.summary: 00962 PRS MSL Missing SELECT keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE VIEW and the SELECT keyword is missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The create view has a general form of: CREATE VIEW viewname (colnames) AS SELECT...

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEBNV
member.summary: 00963 PRS BNV Bind variable not allowed in view
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a view and the select statement has bind variables.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Bind variables are not allowed in a select statement when creating a view.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEAUD
member.summary: 00964 PRS AUD AUDIT keyword missing or misspelled
member.remarks:
Reason: The keyword AUDIT is either missing or misspelled in the specified START AUDIT or STOP AUDIT command.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The keyword AUDIT is required immediately after the START or STOP keywords.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSETMP
member.summary: 00965 PRS TMP Number of passwords exceeds number of user names
member.remarks:
Reason: The number of passwords exceeds the number user names.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The number of user names and passwords must be equal.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEDIN
member.summary: 00966 PRS DIN Delimited identifier not ended
member.remarks:
Reason: A delimited string is not properly ended.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEDIL
member.summary: 00967 PRS DIL Delimited identifier is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: A delimited string is too long.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSETMO
member.summary: 00968 PRS TMO Too many operands
member.remarks:
Reason: Too many operands have been found in an expression.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSENEO
member.summary: 00969 PRS NEO Not enough operands
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough operands have been found in an expression.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSECCN
member.summary: 00970 PRS CCN CURRENT OF cursor not allowed
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use a CURRENT OF cursorname clause in a WHERE clause and it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The CURRENT OF cursorname clause is only allowed in a DELETE and an UPDATE statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMOF
member.summary: 00971 PRS MOF Missing OF keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CURRENT OF cursorname clause and the OF keyword immediately following the CURRENT keyword is either missing or misspelled. Or, attempting an ALTER TABLE statement for referential integrity user errors and the mandatory OF keyword is either missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICU
member.summary: 00972 PRS ICU Invalid CURRENT OF cursor name
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an UPDATE or DELETE with a CURRENT OF cursorname clause and the cursor name is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEOCU
member.summary: 00973 PRS OCU ORDER BY on column not allowed with union
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an ORDER BY clause in a UNION and the order by column has been specified by column name rather than by integer.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. An ORDER BY clause may be used to sort the final result of rows from the UNION of two (or more) tables. When an ORDER BY clause is used with a UNION, you must use an integer specifying the sequence number of the column in the select list. Refer to the section on the SELECT statement in the SQL Language Reference Guide for further information on the ORDER BY clause.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMBR
member.summary: 00974 PRS MBR Missing bar
member.remarks:
Reason: A missing bar (|) has been determined while parsing an expression.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIPE
member.summary: 00975 PRS IPE Invalid decimal precision
member.remarks:
Reason: The precision for the datatype of DECIMAL or DEC is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Columns declared as DECIMAL or DEC are always associated with a particular precision and scale. Precision is the total number of digits and scale is the number of fractional decimal digits. If the precision and scale are not specified, SQLBase uses a default precision of 5 and a default scale of 0.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEISA
member.summary: 00976 PRS ISA Invalid decimal scale
member.remarks:
Reason: The scale for the data type of DECIMAL or DEC is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Columns declared as DECIMAL or DEC are always associated with a particular precision and scale. Precision is the total number of digits and scale is the number of fractional decimal digits. If precision and scale are not specified, SQLBase uses a default precision of 5 and a default scale of 0.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMKK
member.summary: 00977 PRS MKK Missing CHECK keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE VIEW viewname AS select WITH CHECK OPTION and the keyword CHECK immediately following the keyword WITH is either missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL CREATE VIEW statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMSK
member.summary: 00978 PRS MSK Missing AS keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting either a CREATE VIEW or a CREATE DBAREA and the AS keyword is missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEPSR
member.summary: 00979 PRS PSR Plus sign required for outer join
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use the outer join syntax in a select statement and a plus sign (+) should immediately follow a column name.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIOJ
member.summary: 00980 PRS IOJ Illegal outer join specification
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an outer join in a select statement and there are not exactly two operands, or not both column operands, or there is not a relational operator causing this to be an illegal outer join specification.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEASC
member.summary: 00981 PRS ASC Invalid audit string constant
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified audit string constant is not correctly enclosed in single quotes or exceeds 254 characters.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSECUM
member.summary: 00982 PRS CUM User names for index and table must be the same
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to create an index and the user name qualifying the index name does not match the user name qualifying the table name.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Verify that the user names qualifying both the index name and user name are the same and not misspelled. An unqualified user name defaults to the user name attempting to create the index.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEFNA
member.summary: 00983 PRS FNA Function not allowed in create index
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create an index and the specified function is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Not all @functions may be used to create an index. For the complete list of @functions allowed, see CREATE INDEX in the SQL Language Reference Guide.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMBF
member.summary: 00984 PRS MBF Must be a function on column
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create an index and using a function that is not being applied to a column.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. An index can be created for a set of column values resulting from applying an @function to the column. Functions in a create index cannot be nested. The @function used for the index may have only one argument that is a database column. Not all @functions may be used to create an index. For the complete list of @functions allowed, see CREATE INDEX in the SQL Language Reference Guide.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMPK
member.summary: 00985 PRS MPK Missing PRECISION keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create or modify a column with a datatype of DOUBLE PRECISION and the keyword PRECISION is missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIFN
member.summary: 00986 PRS IFN Invalid FLOAT number
member.remarks:
Reason: Trying to create or modify a column with a datatype of FLOAT and the format has been specified but with an invalid number.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The datatype for float can have the form of FLOAT or FLOAT(integer). A FLOAT number can be an integer between 1 and 21 inclusive if specifying a single precision floating point number. A number between 22 and 53 inclusive means that the format is double precision floating point. If the integer is omitted, double precision is assumed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIVW
member.summary: 00987 PRS IVW Invalid view name
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a view and the view name is not a valid long identifier.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. A qualified or unqualified name that can designate a view. The unqualified form of a view name is a long identifier. The qualified form is an authorization-id followed by a period and a long identifier. An unqualified view name in a SQL statement is implicitly qualified by the authorization-id of the user who issues the statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEPMB
member.summary: 00988 PRS PMB PCTFREE must be an integer between 0 and 99
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE INDEX or CREATE TABLE and the specified PCTFREE parameter is either not a valid integer or specifies an integer less than zero or greater than 99 percent.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIAN
member.summary: 00989 PRS IAN Invalid audit identifier: <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified audit name is not a valid short identifier. The length should not be more than 8 characters long and all the characters should be valid identifier characters.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The specified audit name must be a short identifier which identifies the name of the audit for later reference by either the STOP AUDIT command or by the AUDIT command to direct a comment to an audit file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEILC
member.summary: 00990 PRS ILC Invalid LABEL ON statement
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a SQL LABEL ON statement has incorrect syntax.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Check the SQL Language Reference Manual for information on the LABEL ON statement. Possible problems include an invalid keyword or identifier after the LABEL ON keywords, or specifying conflicting usernames, conflicting tablenames, or an asterisk instead of fully specifying the column names, or the string-constant specified after the IS keyword is invalid.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEILP
member.summary: 00991 PRS ILP Invalid LIKE predicate
member.remarks:
Reason: Odd number of backslash (\) escape characters at the end of the LIKE predicate.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEIRE
member.summary: 00992 PRS IRE INTERNAL USE ONLY - Invalid repair type
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSESIM
member.summary: 00993 PRS SIM Missing SAVEPOINT identifier
member.remarks:
Reason: A long identifier is required immediately after a SAVEPOINT statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEICQ
member.summary: 00994 PRS ICQ Invalid qualifier(s) for object
member.remarks:
Reason: UNIQUE, CLUSTERED, and/or HASHED have been specified on a CREATE statement that is NOT a CREATE INDEX statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. UNIQUE, CLUSTERED, and/or HASHED can only be specified on a CREATE INDEX statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEBSZ
member.summary: 00995 PRS BSZ Bad SIZE specification
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE DBAREA, ALTER DBAREA, or CREATE INDEX and the SIZE specification is either not a valid numeric integer or less than zero.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSESZD
member.summary: 00996 PRS SZD SIZE allowed only for HASHED indexes
member.remarks:
Reason: The SIZE clause is only relevant for clustered hashed indexes in the CREATE INDEX statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSESZN
member.summary: 00997 PRS SZN SIZE clause required for CLUSTERED HASHED indexes
member.remarks:
Reason: The SIZE clause is required for CLUSTERED HASHED indexes.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. The SIZE clause controls the anticipated size of the index and is specified as a number of rows. If the size is too small, overflow pages are used and performance degrades. If the size is too large, but disk space is wasted. This clause is only relevant and required when the CLUSTERED HASHED clause is specified.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEONA
member.summary: 00998 PRS ONA ASC/DESC not allowed in creation of HASHED CLUSTERED index
member.remarks:
Reason: The ASCending or DESCending options are not allowed when creating a HASHED CLUSTERED index. The ASC/DESC option is only relevant for B-tree type indexes and not hashed indexes.
Remedy: Correct the SQL CREATE INDEX statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSENCH
member.summary: 00999 PRS NCH A HASHED index must be CLUSTERED
member.remarks:
Reason: A HASHED index must also be defined as CLUSTERED.
Remedy: Correct the SQL CREATE INDEX statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.PRSEMOP
member.summary: 01000 PRS MOP Missing OPTION keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a CREATE VIEW viewname AS select WITH CHECK OPTION and the keyword OPTION immediately following the keyword CHECK is either missing or misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the SQL CREATE VIEW statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTENSG
member.summary: 01001 EDT NSG Nested set function with no GROUP BY
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQL statement contains a nested set function in the SELECT clause, but no GROUP BY clause.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Refer to the SQL Language Reference Manual for information about the use of GROUP BY clauses in SQL statements.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTENGC
member.summary: 01002 EDT NGC Not a GROUP BY column
member.remarks:
Reason: A column in the SELECT column list that is not an aggregate set function is not in the GROUP BY list. Or, a column in the SELECT column list that is an aggregate set function that yields a single value is in the GROUP BY list and cannot be grouped.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. If the column by which a grouping occurs is an expression (but not an aggregate function), you must specify a number that indicates its relative position in the SELECT column list. Aggregate functions, since they yield one value, cannot be GROUP BY columns. If using a GROUP BY clause, each column in the SELECT list must be listed in the GROUP BY clause or each column in the SELECT list must be used in an aggregate set function that yields a single value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTENSS
member.summary: 01003 EDT NSS Not a single value set function
member.remarks:
Reason: A SELECT statement with no GROUP BY clause contains a column name and a function in the select list clause. Or, a column name is contained in the select list clause but not in the GROUP BY clause.
Remedy: Correct the SQL SELECT statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTEICN
member.summary: 01004 EDT ICN Integer in ORDER BY/GROUP BY does not identify a valid column
member.remarks:
Reason: A GROUP BY or ORDER BY clause specifies the columns to GROUP BY or ORDER BY by number. The number specified does not correspond to a column in the select list. The ORDER BY or GROUP BY clause in the SQL statement contains a column number that is either less than one, or greater than the number of columns of the result table (the number of items in the SELECT clause).
Remedy: Correct the syntax of the ORDER BY or GROUP BY clause so each column identifier properly denotes a column of the result table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTEVCU
member.summary: 01005 EDT VCU Non-updateable view column <column name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to INSERT or UPDATE via a view and a column has been determined to be non-updateable.
Remedy: Correct the SQL INSERT or UPDATE statement. See CREATE VIEW in the SQL Language Reference Manual for a complete explanation of what can make a column non-updateable.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTEMNE
member.summary: 01006 EDT MNE Operands of a UNION do not have the same number of columns
member.remarks:
Reason: The operands of a UNION or UNION ALL must have the same number of columns.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement so that there are exactly the same number of columns in each operand.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTEMTE
member.summary: 01007 EDT MTE Mismatch in types of SELECT expressions
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a SQL SELECT statement with a UNION and corresponding columns of the two SELECTs have different data types, different lengths (if not numeric), or the NOT NULL attributes of two fields are not consistent.
Remedy: Correct the SQL SELECT statement so that each column of the SELECT statements have the same data type with the same lengths and so that each column defined as NOT NULL in one SELECT statement corresponds to another NOT NULL column in the other SELECT statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTELNA
member.summary: 01008 EDT LNA Long not allowed here
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to order or sort a LONG VARCHAR column.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. LONG VARCHAR columns cannot be ordered or sorted.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTEDKL
member.summary: 01009 EDT DKL DISTINCT key is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: The resulting DISTINCT key is too long. The DISTINCT key length is computed by summing the maximum length plus one of each column forming the key.
Remedy: Modify the SQL statement so that the DISTINCT does not exceed the maximum length of 255 characters. Columns used in the DISTINCT key length computation include not only columns in the SELECT list but also columns mentioned in the ORDER BY clause that are not present in the SELECT list.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTEMTF
member.summary: 01010 EDT MTF Object table/view <name> of INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE also in FROM clause
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement is illegally self-referencing. The object table being modified is also the source table in the FROM clause.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EDTETMS
member.summary: 01011 EDT TMS Too many items are being selected
member.remarks:
Reason: A SELECT statement is attempting to select too many items. There is an upper limit of 255 on the number of items that can be selected in a SELECT statement.
Remedy: Reduce the number of items being selected in the SELECT statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEUAE
member.summary: 01101 SEC UAE User already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant connect authority to a new user and the user name already exists.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Verify the existence of established users by looking at the SYSUSERAUTH table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECESVI
member.summary: 01102 SEC SVI Security violation attempting to access <object name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to access an object when authority has not been granted to use the specified object.
Remedy: Obtain proper authority before attempting to access the specified object.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECENGA
member.summary: 01103 SEC NGA No grant authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant DBA or resource authority when the user does not have the authority to perform these grants.
Remedy: None. Only SYSADM cannot perform the granting of DBA or resource authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEUNE
member.summary: 01104 SEC UNE User <name> does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to alter a user's password or grant DBA or resource authority to a user that does not exist.
Remedy: Verify that the user exists and that the user name is not misspelled. Verify that the user exists by looking at the SYSUSERAUTH table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEUAD
member.summary: 01105 SEC UAD User <name> already has DBA authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant DBA authority to a user and the user already has DBA authority.
Remedy: None. No need to grant DBA authority to a user that already has DBA authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEUAR
member.summary: 01106 SEC UAR User <name> already has resource authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant resource authority to a user and the user already has resource authority.
Remedy: None. No need to grant resource authority to a user that already has resource authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEDCU
member.summary: 01107 SEC DCU DBA authority required to create table/view for another user
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a table or view for another user and the user attempting this operation does not have DBA authority.
Remedy: None. A user cannot create a table or view for another user unless he or she has DBA authority to do so.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEIOP
member.summary: 01108 SEC IOP Invalid old password
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an ALTER PASSWORD and the old password specified is not the current old password.
Remedy: Please ensure you have a server security password set. You must know the correct old password in order to modify the password.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECETGR
member.summary: 01109 SEC TGR Trigger security violation
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a trigger on a subject table without DBA authority.
