Remedy: Obtain proper authority before attempting to create triggers on the subject table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEVNT
member.summary: 01110 SEC VNT Event security violation
member.remarks:
Reason: Events can be created only by users with DBA authority.
Remedy: Obtain DBA authority before attempting to create events.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEMSO
member.summary: 01111 SEC MSO Stored object <creator>.<name> cannot be found
member.remarks:
Reason: The stored object is missing.
Remedy: Check spelling of object name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECESTO
member.summary: 01112 SEC STO System command or procedure <creator>.<name> security violation
member.remarks:
Reason: EXECUTE privilege cannot be granted on system objects.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEXDL
member.summary: 01113 SEC XDL Lock Database security violation
member.remarks:
Reason: The LOCK DATABASE and UNLOCK DATABASE commands can only be issued by users with DBA or SYSADM authority.
Remedy: Obtain DBA or SYSADM authority before attempting to lock or unlock a database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECEEXF
member.summary: 01114 SEC EXF External Function security violation
member.remarks:
Reason: Only users with DBA or SYSADM authority are allowed to create or drop external functions.
Remedy: None. A user cannot create or drop an external function unless they have DBA or SYSADM authority to do so.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECERAD
member.summary: 01115 SEC RAD Role <name> already has DBA authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant DBA authority to a role and the role already has DBA authority.
Remedy: None. No need to grant DBA authority to a role that already has DBA authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SECERAR
member.summary: 01116 SEC RAR Role <name> already has resource authority
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to grant resource authority to a role and the role already has resource authority.
Remedy: None. No need to grant resource authority to a role that already has resource authority.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEICS
member.summary: 01201 API ICS Invalid column <number> specified
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid column number was specified in an sqlssb, sqldes, sqlfqn, sqlgfi, sqllab, or sqlgls function call. Compare the column number specified with the SELECT statement. Note that column numbers are relative to the position of the columns in the select list clause and are not in any way related to the position in the CREATE TABLE statement. For example, if a table is created with the following statement: CREATE TABLE X (A CHAR(5), B CHAR(5), C CHAR(5)) and a select is compiled like: SELECT C FROM X then one set select buffer call is needed to set up a buffer using a column number of 1 for the column named C.
Remedy: Modify function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEMOO
member.summary: 01202 API MOO Fatal SQLBase System Failure (API MOO) - Message Output Overflow
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error. But, it may have been caused because the client workstation application is running under an environment like OS/2 and it used multiple threads that submitted multiple API requests when the API is a single threaded operation. That is, the API expects a message to be sent and an answer received before another message is sent. This error may have occurred because the application sent a second message to the database computer without receiving an answer from the first message.
Remedy: Stop all database activity and run a CHECK DATABASE. If a FAIL.SQL file is found, save it. If your application has submitted multiple requests to the application without waiting for replies from the database computer, correct this problem. Otherwise, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIECSM
member.summary: 01203 API CSM Out of memory at the client (API CSM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot allocate system message
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIECEX
member.summary: 01204 API CEX Bind variables not allowed with sqlcex API function call
member.remarks:
Reason: Bind variables are not permitted in a SQL statement that is compiled and executed with the sqlcex API function call.
Remedy: Separate the compile and execute (sqlcex) API function call into two distinct API function calls. First, compile the SQL statement using the sqlcom() API function call, bind the variables appropriately, and then execute the SQL statement using the sqlexe() API function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEITL
member.summary: 01205 API ITL Bind Variable Name <name> is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: One of the bind variable names is greater than 36 characters.
Remedy: Correct the bind variable name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEIRW
member.summary: 01206 API IRW NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEIID
member.summary: 01207 API IID Invalid or missing identifier
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an INSERT with an ADJUSTING CURSOR cursor name clause and the cursor name is too big or invalid.
Remedy: Correct SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEWFO
member.summary: 01208 API WFO WaitForSingleObject failed
member.remarks:
Reason: A call to the Windows API function WaitForSingleObject failed.
Remedy: Call Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEBDR
member.summary: 01209 API BDR Backup directory is too long, or incorrectly specified
member.remarks:
Reason: A backup directory specified during a backup, recovery, or restore has been specified incorrectly. The backup directory must include a fully-qualified path name and cannot exceed 115 bytes.
Remedy: Specify backup directory with a fully-qualified path name. For example, if the backup directory is in C:\SQLBASE\BACKUP then the specified directory must be either "C:\SQLBASE\BACKUP" or "\SQLBASE\BACKUP". The directory name of "SQLBASE\BACKUP" or "BACKUP" would not be sufficient.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEDBN
member.summary: 01210 API DBN Database name must be specified
member.remarks:
Reason: The database name has not been specified attempting to perform an INSTALL DATABASE.
Remedy: Specify a valid database name when doing an INSTALL DATABASE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEBIF
member.summary: 01211 API BIF INTERNAL USE ONLY - Bulk insert buffer full
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEIDV
member.summary: 01212 API IDV Invalid database version
member.remarks:
Reason: The application is using mismatching versions of software or the database version does not correspond to the software.
Remedy: Verify that the software and database are from the same release of SQLBase.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEBAC
member.summary: 01213 API BAC Bulk execute mode and autocommit mode cannot both be ON
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot enable bulk execute mode and autocommit mode simultaneously.
Remedy: Disable autocommit mode before trying to enable bulk execute mode OR disable bulk execute mode before trying to enable autocommit mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIECMF
member.summary: 01214 API CMF CreateMutex failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: A call to the Windows API function CreateMutex failed.
Remedy: Call Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIETIO
member.summary: 01215 API TIO Timeout waiting for connection handle.
member.remarks:
Reason: The connection handle on which the C/API call was made is currently being used by another thread. This thread timed out waiting for the other thread to relinquish control of the connection handle.
Remedy: Either increase the timeout value, use a different connection handle or handle the error in the application.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIERMF
member.summary: 01216 API RMF ReleaseMutex failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: A call to the Windows API function ReleaseMutex failed.
Remedy: Call Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEMXS
member.summary: 01217 API MXS Maximum number of sessions exceeded.
member.remarks:
Reason: The maximum number of sessions (connections) for this process have been exceeded.
Remedy: Ensure your application does not have more connections open simultaneously than it needs.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.APIEMXC
member.summary: 01218 API MXC Maximum number of cursors exceeded.
member.remarks:
Reason: The maximum number of cursors for this session have been exceeded. The max is 250 per session.
Remedy: Ensure your application does not have more cursors open simultaneously than it needs.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEIMO
member.summary: 01301 MFE IMO Client input message buffer overflow (MFE IMO)
member.remarks:
Reason: The server has detected a condition where the minimum amount of data to send to a client exceeds the buffer size for that data. The server sends this error code back to the client, but does not send any of the data that caused the overflow. The router at the client detects the condition and automatically attempts to correct for it by allocating a larger input message buffer. The router will automatically re-request the data be sent again using the new buffer size. The router and the server will continue to negotiate the buffer size until one of the following occurs: 1. The server is successfully able to transmit the data to the client, or 2. The server or the client router run out of available memory at their respective machines. This error message should only appear at the server. It should not be seen at the client. The server and the client router perform the buffer size negotiation without the client's knowledge or participation. If the client app sees this error, it should be treated as a fatal error.
Remedy: None. This message should only appear on the server. It should not be seen by the client application.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEIVC
member.summary: 01302 MFE IVC Invalid cursor number
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid cursor number has been used in the current API function call.
Remedy: Verify that the cursor being used has already been connected to successfully. A frequent mistake is to call a common error routine in the application program when a failure occurs on the connect operation. The common error routine then performs an error lookup using the get return code (sqlrcd) function call which uses a cursor number that has not yet been connected to.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEENCO
member.summary: 01303 MFE NCO Not connected
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use a cursor that has not been successfully connected to the database.
Remedy: Use a cursor only after it has been successfully connected to the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEESCR
member.summary: 01304 MFE SCR Server connection required
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an operation that requires a server connection.
Remedy: Use a server connection instead of a database connection.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEDCR
member.summary: 01305 MFE DCR Database connection required
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an operation that requires a database connection.
Remedy: Use a database connection instead of a server connection.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEECAM
member.summary: 01306 MFE CAM Out of memory at the client (MFE CAM)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEIFC
member.summary: 01307 MFE IFC Invalid function code
member.remarks:
Reason: The function code received by the database system is not valid.
Remedy: Verify Gupta software does not consist of mismatching version numbers. Check that your application is not clobbering the memory destroying the message sent to the database system.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEOLS
member.summary: 01308 MFE OLS Fatal SQLBase System Failure (MFE OLS)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEECAO
member.summary: 01309 MFE CAO Out of memory at the client (MFE CAO)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEERWF
member.summary: 01310 MFE RWF INTERNAL USE ONLY - Row will not fit in message buffer
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEECAN
member.summary: 01311 MFE CAN Transaction cancelled
member.remarks:
Reason: The transaction was cancelled asynchronously from a different thread which performed a cancel operation.
Remedy: Determine why the cancel operation was performed by the other transaction.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEETRM
member.summary: 01312 MFE TRM Transaction terminated
member.remarks:
Reason: The transaction was terminated because the database server program was instructed to terminate.
Remedy: Determine why the database server has been brought down.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEOOM
member.summary: 01313 MFE OOM Out of memory at the client (MFE OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEBLK
member.summary: 01314 MFE BLK Bulk insert error
member.remarks:
Reason: An insert error has occurred operating in Bulk Execute Mode. One or more rows have not been inserted because of an error attempting to insert the rows.
Remedy: In bulk execute mode, inserts are done repeatedly until the bulk execute buffer is filled and then all of the inserts are sent to the database simultaneously. If this error occurs, the client application needs to check each bulk execute return code with the API function call sqlber to determine which rows were not inserted.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEDBD
member.summary: 01315 MFE DBD Database has been shut down (please disconnect)
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to connect to the database but the database server is being or has been shutdown.
Remedy: None. Try connecting later when the database server is back up.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEENET
member.summary: 01316 MFE NET Network check error (back end)
member.remarks:
Reason: A network transmission problem has occurred while operating with NETCHECK=1. A network transmission error was detected at the database server. When the database server detects the network transmission problem, it will try to recover from the error. An informational message, "Back end sends NAK" is displayed. For an unrecoverable message, an error message "Back end detects mismatched checksum" is displayed on the F2 screen and this error is return to the client workstation if the message can be sent to the client.
Remedy: Try again to see if the error is reproducible. If reproducible, try the same scenario on another client workstation computer to double check if the problem is reproducible regardless of client workstations. If the problem is reproducible on any client workstation, then the network hardware problem may be at the database server computer. Switching database server machines may also help to diagnose the problem. Check for loose cabling.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEECNV
member.summary: 01317 MFE CNV Conversion Error - server field doesn't fit in front end message.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to convert a current level message into the level that the front end supports. The data value can't fit in the older message structure.
Remedy: Obtain the front end build level that matches the server's level.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEENMS
member.summary: 01318 MFE NMS Invalid function code - MTS message received at the server.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to join a transaction, but the message is received by the server (DBNTSRV) instead of the resource manager (SQLBrm). Probable incorrect SQL.INI communication path specified. Ensure that the client is using SQLWS32 with the correct listenport to communicate with the resource managerand that the server is using SQLMPIPE to communicate witht the resource manager.
Remedy: Correct the SQL.INI inconsistencies.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.MFEEEOM
member.summary: 01319 MFE EOM Premature end of input message on server
member.remarks:
Reason: The server is reading its input message buffer and the message is shorter than expected.
Remedy: Contact Gupta customer support. It's possible that certain messages between different versions of the clients haven't been converted properly.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEICN
member.summary: 01401 DLU ICN Invalid column name <column name>
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid column has been used in the select list.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEACR
member.summary: 01402 DLU ACR Ambiguous column <column name> reference
member.remarks:
Reason: Column is already defined.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEITN
member.summary: 01403 DLU ITN Invalid table name <table name>
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid table name has been determined while attempting to lookup the columns for the specified table.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEMNV
member.summary: 01404 DLU MNV Mismatch in number of values
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an INSERT with a nested subselect and the number of columns in the select statement does not correspond to the number of columns in the insert statement.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUERWV
member.summary: 01405 DLU RWV NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEVNA
member.summary: 01406 DLU VNA View <view name> not allowed here
member.remarks:
Reason: A view is not allowed here.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUECUV
member.summary: 01407 DLU CUV Cannot update view <view name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to update through a view that is a read-only view.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUERNA
member.summary: 01408 DLU RNA NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEARV
member.summary: 01409 DLU ARV Ambiguous use of ROWID with a view
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use a ROWID with a view and a table.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEOOJ
member.summary: 01410 DLU OOJ Only one outer join table allowed
member.remarks:
Reason: Only one outer join is allowed per SELECT.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEICF
member.summary: 01411 DLU ICF Insert columns must contain all the foreign key columns
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to INSERT a row and columns participating in the foreign key are not among the columns being inserted.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. All foreign key columns must be inserted.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEICP
member.summary: 01412 DLU ICP Insert columns must contain all the primary key columns
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to INSERT a row and columns participating in the primary key are not among the columns being inserted.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. All primary key columns must be inserted.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEPTI
member.summary: 01413 DLU PTI Parent table <username>.<tablename> in incomplete state
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a foreign key on an incomplete table.
Remedy: Create the unique index on the primary key so that the table is considered complete before trying to create any foreign keys.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEDCS
member.summary: 01414 DLU DCS Invalid DELETE with WHERE CURRENT OF
member.remarks:
Reason: A DELETE operation with a WHERE CURRENT OF cursorname attempted to delete from a self-referencing table.
Remedy: Do not attempt to delete from a self-referencing table with WHERE CURRENT OF cursorname in the DELETE statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEDMR
member.summary: 01415 DLU DMR Dependent table in subquery must have RESTRICT delete rule
member.remarks:
Reason: A dependent table is in a subquery where the relationship between parent table and the dependent table does not have the RESTRICT delete rule.
Remedy: None. A dependent table in a subquery must have the RESTRICT delete rule.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEUCP
member.summary: 01416 DLU UCP Invalid UPDATE with WHERE CURRENT OF
member.remarks:
Reason: An UPDATE operation with WHERE CURRENT OF attempted to update a primary key of the object table.
Remedy: Do not attempt to update a primary key with WHERE CURRENT OF in the UPDATE statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUETIC
member.summary: 01417 DLU TIC Table <tablename> in incomplete state
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE on an incomplete table.
Remedy: Create the unique index on the primary key so that the table is considered complete before attempting to INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE any data in the incomplete table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUETAP
member.summary: 01418 DLU TAP Table <tablename> already has a primary key
member.remarks:
Reason: A primary key cannot be defined because the target table already has a primary key.
Remedy: None. A table cannot have more than one primary key.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEPCN
member.summary: 01419 DLU PCN Primary key column must be NOT NULL or NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT
member.remarks:
Reason: The primary key cannot be defined because one or more of the columns forming this primary key are not defined as either NOT NULL or NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT.
Remedy: Correct definition of primary key or modify the columns forming the primary key so each column is defined as either NOT NULL or NOT NULL WITH DEFAULT.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUETCK
member.summary: 01420 DLU TCK INTERNAL USE ONLY - Table in check pending state
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEFND
member.summary: 01421 DLU FND Foreign key not found in dictionary
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to drop a foreign key or attempting to add, drop, or modify a referential integrity user error and the specified foreign key does not exist.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Verify that the foreign key exists and check the spelling of the foreign key name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEPND
member.summary: 01422 DLU PND Primary key not defined yet
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to drop a primary key and the specified primary key does not exist.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. Verify that the primary key exists and check the spelling of the primary key name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUECPS
member.summary: 01423 DLU CPS Cannot add primary key to system table <tablename>
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot add a primary key to a system catalog table.
Remedy: None. A primary key cannot be added to a system catalog table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUECFS
member.summary: 01424 DLU CFS Cannot add foreign key to system table <tablename>
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot add a foreign key to a system catalog table.
Remedy: None. A foreign key cannot be added to a system catalog table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEMSC
member.summary: 01425 DLU MSC Must be single column subselect
member.remarks:
Reason: Query not allowed because the results could be ambiguous, that is, the subselect which is the target of the WHERE clause can produce multiple values.
Remedy: None. A subselect cannot produce multiple values. The subselect must produce a single column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUENUS
member.summary: 01426 DLU NUS No user error for system table <tablename>
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot add referential integrity user errors for system tables.
Remedy: None. Referential integrity user errors cannot be added to a system catalog table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUERIV
member.summary: 01427 DLU RIV ROWID not allowed on this view <username>.<viewname>
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEDIC
member.summary: 01428 DLU DIC Dependent table <tablename> in incomplete state
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot delete or update rows in parent table when the dependent table is in an incomplete state.
Remedy: Lift dependent table from incomplete state by creating a primary key for the dependent table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUENUC
member.summary: 01429 DLU NUC Update column does not exist in subject table
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to create a trigger on a non-existent column of subject table.
Remedy: Correct CREATE TRIGGER statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUENPC
member.summary: 01430 DLU NPC Column specified as parameter does not exist in subject table
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to create a trigger by specifying a non-existent column of the subject table as procedure parameter.
Remedy: Correct CREATE TRIGGER statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUETMU
member.summary: 01431 DLU TMU Update column does not exist in subject table
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to create a trigger on a non-existent column of subject table.
Remedy: Correct CREATE TRIGGER statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEDTC
member.summary: 01432 DLU DTC Dependent table in incomplete state
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot delete or update rows in parent table when the dependent table is in an incomplete state.
Remedy: Lift dependent table from an incomplete state by creating a primary index for it.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEIDE
member.summary: 01433 DLU IDE Index does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Updating statistics for an index that does not exist.
Remedy: Find correct index name and retry. All current index names can be determined by querying the SYSINDEXES tables.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUECMM
member.summary: 01434 DLU CMM Stored command does not exist.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to alter a non-existent stored command.
Remedy: Correct misspelled or supply proper command name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEUNT
member.summary: 01435 DLU UNT Cannot unload non-existent table
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to unload a table that does not exist.
Remedy: Correct the table name(s).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUESEC
member.summary: 01436 DLU SEC Cannot unload inaccessible table
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempt to unload a table without proper privileges.
Remedy: Obtain the required privileges from the table owner(s).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUENUP
member.summary: 01437 DLU NUP Column <view name>.<column name> is not updateable
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot update a column created with aggregate function or expression in a view.
Remedy: Remove the column from the FOR UPDATE OF clause.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEFNF
member.summary: 01438 DLU FNF Function <name> has not been created.
member.remarks:
Reason: A reference has been made to an external function that is not known to the database.
Remedy: Use an already defined function or add the definition of this function to the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUESTN
member.summary: 01439 DLU STN Cannot define trigger on system table
member.remarks:
Reason: Triggers are not allowed on system tables.
Remedy: Do not define triggers on system tables.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEEFE
member.summary: 01440 DLU EFE External function or synonym <name> already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified external function name already exists as an external function or external function synonym.
Remedy: Use a different external function name. External function names cannot be the same as an existing stored command, stored procedure, stored command synonym, stored procedure synonym, external function or external function synonym.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUESPE
member.summary: 01441 DLU SPE Procedure or procedure synonym <name> already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified name already exists as a procedure/command or synonym.
Remedy: Use a different name. Procedure names cannot be the same as an existing stored command, stored procedure, stored command synonym, stored procedure synonym, external function or external function synonym.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEITR
member.summary: 01442 DLU ITR Column <column name> references undefined table
member.remarks:
Reason: A column reference was found for a table that hasn't been defined yet. For instance: SELECT A.col1, B.col2 FROM A JOIN B ON B.col2 = C.col2 NATURAL JOIN C; The problem is that C.col2 is used before the table C is defined.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEIUT
member.summary: 01443 DLU IUT USING (<table name>.column) name isn't permitted.
member.remarks:
Reason: Table prefixes are not allowed in the USING clause. Only column names are permitted.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement by removing the table prefix.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DLUEINT
member.summary: 01444 DLU INT Constraint <name> isn't defined.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use a non-existant constraint.
Remedy: Find correct constraint name and retry. All constraint names are kept in the SYSTABCONSTRAINTS table.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRTECCR
member.summary: 01501 SRT CCR Cannot create sort file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRTEQST
member.summary: 01502 SRT QST Fatal SQLBase System Failure (SRT QST)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRTEWTS
member.summary: 01503 SRT WTS Out of memory at the database computer (SRT WTS)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRTEEOF
member.summary: 01504 SRT EOF Fatal SQLBase System Failure (SRT EOF)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRTERWF
member.summary: 01505 SRT RWF Disk Write Failure (SRT RWF)
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to write to a file and a disk write failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk write failure. Most commonly, it may be because you have run out of available disk space. If sufficient disk space is available, then run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRTECSS
member.summary: 01506 SRT CSS Out of memory at the database computer (SRT CSS)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEIDT
member.summary: 01601 TYP IDT Invalid data type
member.remarks:
Reason: An operand cannot be coerced into a valid data type. Or, a LONG VARCHAR data type was expected and was not provided, or a LONG VARCHAR data type was specified when it is not expected.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement by providing valid data types.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEMBB
member.summary: 01602 TYP MBB Long must be set to bind variable
member.remarks:
Reason: LONG VARCHAR data must be bound to a set variable.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEOLO
member.summary: 01603 TYP OLO Cannot order long data
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a GROUP BY or ORDER BY on a LONG VARCHAR column.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. SQL cannot GROUP BY or ORDER BY a LONG VARCHAR column.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPECUR
member.summary: 01604 TYP CUR Cannot update or insert a ROWID column
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to update or insert a ROWID column.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. ROWIDs are unique and assigned by the SQLBase system.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPECMS
member.summary: 01605 TYP CMS Cannot modify system data in system table <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to insert or delete rows of data from a system table. Or, attempting to insert or update data in a system table.
Remedy: None. Systems tables are maintained by the database system.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEIDA
member.summary: 01606 TYP IDA Invalid date arithmetic
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to perform an arithmetic operation on a date and the operation is considered invalid.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEIET
member.summary: 01607 TYP IET Invalid external data type
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid external data type has been specified.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEIIS
member.summary: 01608 TYP IIS Date/time interval only expressions not allowed in select list
member.remarks:
Reason: A date/time interval with only a year, a month, a day, or a time interval is not allowed in the select list.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEINC
member.summary: 01609 TYP INC Date/time interval comparisons are not allowed
member.remarks:
Reason: A date/time interval with only a year, a month, a day, or a time interval is not allowed in the comparison.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPECCL
member.summary: 01610 TYP CCL Cannot compare Long VARCHAR data
member.remarks:
Reason: LONG VARCHAR data cannot be specified in a comparison.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEMBC
member.summary: 01611 TYP MBC Must be a column to perform this function
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEDNC
member.summary: 01612 TYP DNC Must be character data type to perform this function
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPENVL
member.summary: 01613 TYP NVL @NULLVALUE column must be replaced by same data type value
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to use the @NULLVALUE function replacing a column with a replacement value that is not of the same data type.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. A column in an @NULLVALUE function can only be replaced by a value of the same data type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPETFP
member.summary: 01614 TYP TFP Too many procedure function parameters
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEPNN
member.summary: 01615 TYP PNN Number of parameters does not match
member.remarks:
Reason: The number of parameters in function call does not match the number of parameters supposed to be.
Remedy: Check the parameters and change the parameters used in the function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEMVC
member.summary: 01616 TYP MVC Must be a variable or a constant
member.remarks:
Reason: The parameter must be a variable or a constant to get data from database
Remedy: Check the parameters and change the parameters used in the function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPETPO
member.summary: 01617 TYP TPO Output parameter in procedure cannot be supported
member.remarks:
Reason: Trigger cannot process output from a procedure.
Remedy: Correct the procedure or use an appropriate substitute.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPETPT
member.summary: 01618 TYP TPT Invalid parameter type for procedure/external function
member.remarks:
Reason: Parameter type does not match corresponding procedure or external function requirement.
Remedy: Correct the parameter.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPETPC
member.summary: 01619 TYP TPC Too few/many parameters for procedure
member.remarks:
Reason: Number of parameters must match procedure requirement.
Remedy: Provide the correct number of procedure parameters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEMPR
member.summary: 01620 TYP MPR Specified procedure does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Procedure does not exist or its name is misspelled.
Remedy: Correct the procedure name or create the intended procedure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEVSC
member.summary: 01621 TYP VSC Stored command not allowed
member.remarks:
Reason: Only stored or inline procedure is allowed.
Remedy: Correct the CREATE TRIGGER or CREATE EVENT command to use a procedure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEUFC
member.summary: 01622 TYP UFC Undefined procedure function call
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBOO
member.summary: 01623 TYP BOO Invalid data type (boolean expected)
member.remarks:
Reason: A boolean value is expected.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPENUM
member.summary: 01624 TYP NUM Invalid data type (number expected)
member.remarks:
Reason: A numeric value is expected.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPESTR
member.summary: 01625 TYP STR Invalid data type (string expected)
member.remarks:
Reason: A string value is expected.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEDTM
member.summary: 01626 TYP DTM Invalid data type (date/time expected)
member.remarks:
Reason: A date/time value is expected.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPELON
member.summary: 01627 TYP LON Invalid data type (long expected)
member.remarks:
Reason: A long value is expected.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBBO
member.summary: 01628 TYP BBO Invalid Boolean type detected
member.remarks:
Reason: A Boolean value occurs where it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBNU
member.summary: 01629 TYP BNU Invalid number type detected
member.remarks:
Reason: A numeric value occurs where it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBST
member.summary: 01630 TYP BST Invalid string type detected
member.remarks:
Reason: A string value occurs where it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBDT
member.summary: 01631 TYP BDT Invalid date/time type detected
member.remarks:
Reason: A date/time value occurs where it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBLO
member.summary: 01632 TYP BLO Invalid long type detected
member.remarks:
Reason: A long value occurs where it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEMBS
member.summary: 01633 TYP MBS Triggered stored procedure <procedure name> must be static.
member.remarks:
Reason: A trigger can execute only static stored procedures..
Remedy: Call a static procedure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEDNA
member.summary: 01634 TYP DNA Delete triggers can not use receive parameters.
member.remarks:
Reason: A delete trigger is not allowed to use receive parameters to modify data passed into the triggered stored procedure.
Remedy: Use only non-receive parameters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEATR
member.summary: 01635 TYP ATR AFTER triggers can not use receive parameters.
member.remarks:
Reason: An AFTER trigger is not allowed to use receive parameters to modify data passed into the triggered stored procedure.
Remedy: Use only non-receive parameters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEMBV
member.summary: 01636 TYP MBV Only variables can be passed as receive parameters.
member.remarks:
Reason: Expressions or constants cannot be passed as receive parameters to external functions.
Remedy: Change the parameter to be a procedure variable.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEFNS
member.summary: 01637 TYP FNS External function support not available in this SQLBase version.
member.remarks:
Reason: The ability to call out to external functions residing in DLLs is not available in this version of SQLBase.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEPMC
member.summary: 01638 TYP PMC Parameter must be a column type.
member.remarks:
Reason: Only columns can be passed as receive parameters to triggered stored procedures.
Remedy: Use only columns for receive parameters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEONA
member.summary: 01639 TYP ONA Old column values cannot be modified by a trigger.
member.remarks:
Reason: Only new column values can be modified by passing as a receive parameters to triggered stored procedures.
Remedy: Use only new column values for receive parameters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEEXC
member.summary: 01640 TYP EXC Cannot combine different explicit collations
member.remarks:
Reason: Two explicity specified collations can not be combined unless they both specify the same collation.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEIMP
member.summary: 01641 TYP IMP Cannot combine different implicit collations
member.remarks:
Reason: Two implicitly specified collations can not be combined unless they both specify the same collation.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.TYPEBIN
member.summary: 01642 TYP BIN Invalid Binary type detected
member.remarks:
Reason: A Binary value occurs where it is not allowed.
Remedy: Correct the construct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEINF
member.summary: 01701 GPI INF Invalid function call
member.remarks:
Reason: The general programming interface has dispatched an invalid function call.
Remedy: If using the standard Microsoft C 5.1 compiler, the Micro Focus COBOL interface, or the Realia COBOL interface then contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance. If using the general programming interface with another programming language or compiler, then verify the general programming interface program is passing a valid function call number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEDNI
member.summary: 01702 GPI DNI NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEIPL
member.summary: 01703 GPI IPL Incorrect parameter length
member.remarks:
Reason: The general programming interface has dispatched a message and the parameter length is incorrect.
Remedy: If using the standard MicroSoft C 5.1 compiler, the Micro Focus COBOL interface, or the Realia COBOL interface then contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance. If using the general programming interface with another programming language or compiler, then verify the general programming interface program is passing a valid message.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEIDT
member.summary: 01704 GPI IDT Invalid dispatch table
member.remarks:
Reason: The dispatch table in the general programming interface has been determined to be invalid.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEIPM
member.summary: 01705 GPI IPM Invalid parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: A Windows application has called SQLDON accidentally.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEOUD
member.summary: 01706 GPI OUD Out of memory at the client (GPI OUD)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIERMD
member.summary: 01707 GPI RMD Real mode database
member.remarks:
Reason: The database code is running in real mode and the application program is running in protected mode. The database code cannot access the application's data. The database code cannot convert a protected mode descriptor into a real mode address.
Remedy: Run the database and application program in the same mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.GPIEOOM
member.summary: 01708 GPI OOM Out of memory at the client (GPI OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: The application has run out of memory at the client workstation.
Remedy: Check available memory at the client workstation. Attempt to make more memory available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEDLK
member.summary: 01801 LKM DLK Application deadlock
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system has detected a user deadlock situation. A deadlock situation is an occurrence such that two or more transactions are in a simultaneous wait state, each one waiting for the other to release a lock before it can proceed. SQLBase detects deadlocks immediately; that is, without waiting the duration of the timeout period. If SQLBase detects a deadlock, it will break the deadlock by rolling back the transaction that detected the deadlock and return this error message to the detector. The other transaction will continue not even knowing a deadlock situation was detected.
Remedy: Determine what transactions are becoming deadlocked and attempt to make changes so that the deadlock situation does not occur frequently. A COMMIT as often as possible helps to avoid deadlocks.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEILE
member.summary: 01802 LKM ILE Insufficient lock entries
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server has exceeded the number of possible locks.
Remedy: Increase the number of database server locks by changing the configuration parameter in the SQL.INI file associated with the database server. The parameter is LOCKS=nnn. This parameter sets the maximum number of lock entries that will be allocated. Lock entries are dynamically allocated as they are needed in groups of 100. If the LOCKS= parameter is not used, locks will be allocated as needed until there is not enough memory left. The only time you need to specify this keyword is when you are trying to protect against a runaway application that is accessing too much data in one transaction. If you are getting this error, then chances are good that you have a runaway application on your hands.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEITC
member.summary: 01803 LKM ITC Fatal SQLBase System Failure (LKM ITC)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEILC
member.summary: 01804 LKM ILC Fatal SQLBase System Failure (LKM ILC)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMETMO
member.summary: 01805 LKM TMO Time out
member.remarks:
Reason: The transaction is waiting for a resource currently locked by another transaction. The transaction will wait by default 275 seconds unless otherwise specified.
Remedy: Determine what transaction is locking the resources and attempt to make changes so that the wait situation does not occur frequently. A COMMIT as often as possible helps to avoid these timeout conditions. To reduce the time wait period, you can use the set timeout function call (sqltio) or in SQLTalk you can SET TIMEOUT n, where n is the number of seconds. The number of seconds can range from 1 to 1800 seconds (30 minutes).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEOLE
member.summary: 01806 LKM OLE Fatal SQLBase System Failure (LKM OLE)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMETMP
member.summary: 01807 LKM TMP Fatal SQLBase System Failure (LKM TMP)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMECAL
member.summary: 01808 LKM CAL Out of memory at the database computer (LKM CAL)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMELPB
member.summary: 01809 LKM LPB Out of memory at the database computer (LKM LPB)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEWST
member.summary: 01810 LKM WST NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEFDU
member.summary: 01811 LKM FDU Fatal SQLBase System Failure (LKM FDU)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEIWS
member.summary: 01812 LKM IWS Out of memory at the database computer (LKM IWS)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEUND
member.summary: 01813 LKM UND Lock held by undecided transaction.
member.remarks:
Reason: The user tried to lock a database page that is owned by an undecided distributed transaction. Such a lock may be held for an indefinite amount of time -- until the distributed transaction is resolved. Until the transaction is resolved, the user will not be able to access the page in question.
Remedy: Either make sure that the distributed transaction gets resolved (see the manual) or if that is not possible, do not access the page.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEROD
member.summary: 01814 LKM ROD NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMENXL
member.summary: 01815 LKM NXL The database is not exclusively locked
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot perform an UNLOCK DATABASE command, since the database is currently not exclusively locked.
Remedy: If multiple LOCK DATABASE commands are issued, only the first instance causes the database to be exclusively locked. If multiple (matching) UNLOCK DATABASE commands are issued, the first instance will release the exclusive database lock; therefore, additional UNLOCK DATABASE requests will find the database already unlocked. Remove extraneous UNLOCK DATABASE commands to eliminate this error.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEIXL
member.summary: 01816 LKM IXL The database is already exclusively locked
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot perform a LOCK DATABASE command, since the database is already exclusively locked.
Remedy: If multiple LOCK DATABASE commands are issued, only the first instance causes the database to be exclusively locked. If multiple (matching) UNLOCK DATABASE commands are issued, the first instance will release the exclusive database lock. Remove extraneous LOCK DATABASE commands to eliminate this error.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEISL
member.summary: 01817 LKM ISL Database could not be locked because other connections exist
member.remarks:
Reason: The first connection by any transaction acquires a shared database lock, which is released upon the last disconnect for the transaction. Your attempt to exclusively lock the database, using the LOCK DATABASE command, failed because you are waiting for a resource currently locked (in shared mode) by another transaction. Your LOCK DATABASE request will succeed when all shared database locks by other transactions have been released.
Remedy: Determine what other transactions are connected to the same database. Your Lock Database request will only succeed after all other connected transactions have disconnected.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMEFDX
member.summary: 01818 LKM FDX Fatal SQLBase System Failure (LKM FDX)
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.LKMELTB
member.summary: 01819 LKM LTB Table could not be locked for exclusive access
member.remarks:
Reason: A table lock locks all the data rows of a table for exclusive access.
Remedy: Determine what other transactions are connected to the same table. The table lock can only succeed if other transactions have released their locks on the table.

member.summary: 01908 SYS NMF No more files
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code indicates that the last file name has been read indicating an end of the directory has been reached.
Remedy: None. Informational only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SYSEPNF
member.summary: 01909 SYS PNF Path not found or name exceeds maximum range
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open a directory or read files from a directory and the directory path has not been found or the directory name exceeds the maximum range.
Remedy: If the directory is not open, then open it. If the directory cannot be opened, verify that the specified directory exists.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SYSEOCN
member.summary: 01910 SYS OCN Unable to obtain local computer name from the registry
member.remarks:
Reason: An attempt to obtain the local computer name from the operating system failed.
Remedy: Verify that the local computer name exists in the operating system registry. If it is not present, have the system administrator research and fix the problem.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SYSESCN
member.summary: 01911 SYS SCN Unable to set local computer name into the registry
member.remarks:
Reason: An attempt by the server to set a special registry entry to allow access by Windows 3.1 applications has failed. Since the server is a local-user-only server, failing to set the special registry entry is a fatal error.
Remedy: This error should not occur. If it does occur, have the system administrator research and fix the problem.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SYSEACC
member.summary: 01912 SYS ACC Access violation on opening file
member.remarks:
Reason: UNIX file access violation attempting to open a file.
Remedy: Verify that the file name was correctly specified and that you have access to the specified file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SYSEBOM

member.remarks:

Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.summary: 01915 SYS OOM Out of memory when encrypting/decrypting data
member.remarks:
Reason: The OS has refused a necessary memory allocation.
Remedy: A secure encryption/decryption operation could not proceed.

member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.
