member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILECLO
member.summary: 02101 FIL CLO Cannot close file
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to close a file and is getting an operating system error. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Try to determine why the operating system cannot close the file. Contact your local Gupta technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEDEL
member.summary: 02102 FIL DEL Cannot delete file
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to delete a file and is getting an operating system error. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Try to determine why the operating system cannot delete the file. Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILELSK
member.summary: 02103 FIL LSK Cannot perform lseek
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to seek into a file and is getting an operating system error. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Try to determine why the operating system cannot seek into the file. Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILERWF
member.summary: 02104 FIL RWF Read or write failure
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to read or write to a file and is getting an operating system error. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Try to determine why the operating system cannot read or write to a file. Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILECWT
member.summary: 02105 FIL CWT Cannot set write-through
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to make sure that a file is set for write-through mode. This means that when data is written, it is actually written to disk and not simply buffered.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system will not allow the setting for write-through mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEOOM
member.summary: 02106 FIL OOM Out of memory at the database computer (FIL OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEAID
member.summary: 02107 FIL AID Asynchronous I/O did not start
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to initiate an asynchronous read or write from a file and asynchronous I/O did not start. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why asynchronous I/O did not start.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEAIF
member.summary: 02108 FIL AIF Asynchronous I/O failure
member.remarks:
Reason: An asynchronous read/write failure has occurred. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system could not perform the asynchronous I/O operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEAPF
member.summary: 02109 FIL APF Asynchronous I/O position failure
member.remarks:
Reason: An asynchronous positioning within a file failed. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system could not perform the asynchronous I/O operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILECSF
member.summary: 02110 FIL CSF Cannot get file descriptor status
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to get a file descriptor status and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system could not get the file descriptor status.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEPSE
member.summary: 02111 FIL PSE Partition size error
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to get the partition size and a failure has occurred. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system could not get the partition file size.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEOOS
member.summary: 02112 FIL OOS Out of disk space
member.remarks:
Reason: There is not enough disk space to perform this operation.
Remedy: Terminate program and remove files to free up disk space.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILESAR
member.summary: 02113 FIL SAR Asynchronous short read error
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to read from a file. The operating system asynchronous disk read request read fewer bytes than requested. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system did not return either an error condition or the exact number of bytes requested.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILESAW
member.summary: 02114 FIL SAW Asynchronous short write error
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to write to a file. The operating system asynchronous disk write request wrote fewer bytes than requested. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system did not return either an error condition or write the exact number of bytes requested.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEARE
member.summary: 02115 FIL ARE Asynchronous read error
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to read from a file. The operating system asynchronous disk read request returned an error. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system returned an error.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEAWE
member.summary: 02116 FIL AWE Asynchronous write error
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system is attempting to write to a file. The operating system asynchronous disk write request returned an error. This is a fatal error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system returned an error.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEIFO
member.summary: 02117 FIL IFO FIFO file types are not allowed in this context
member.remarks:
Reason: A file was specified that has been found to be a FIFO. These are not allowed in this context.
Remedy: Re-specify a suitable file type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEBLK
member.summary: 02118 FIL BLK Block special files are not allowed in this context
member.remarks:
Reason: A file was specified that has been found to be a block special file. These are not allowed in this context.
Remedy: Re-specify a suitable file type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.FILEDIR
member.summary: 02119 FIL DIR Directories are not allowed in this context
member.remarks:
Reason: A file was specified that has been found to be a directory. These are not allowed in this context.
Remedy: Re-specify a suitable file type.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAESRN
member.summary: 02201 EVA SRN NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAESRM
member.summary: 02202 EVA SRM Subselect resulted in multiple rows
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a subselect that should identify only one row but the subselect result set consists of more than one row.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEDAO
member.summary: 02203 EVA DAO Date arithmetic over/under-flow
member.remarks:
Reason: Date arithmetic has caused either an overflow or underflow condition.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. A date cannot have a numeric value for the year that is less than zero or greater than 9999.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVH
member.summary: 02204 EVA IVH Invalid hour value
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified hour is less than zero or greater than 23.
Remedy: Correct the specified hour.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVM
member.summary: 02205 EVA IVM Invalid minute value
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified minutes are less than zero or greater than 59.
Remedy: Correct the specified minutes.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVS
member.summary: 02206 EVA IVS Invalid second value
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified seconds are less than zero or greater than 59.
Remedy: Correct the specified seconds.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVD
member.summary: 02207 EVA IVD Invalid day value
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified day is not valid.
Remedy: Correct the specified day.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVY
member.summary: 02208 EVA IVY Invalid year value
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified year is not valid.
Remedy: Correct the specified year.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVO
member.summary: 02209 EVA IVO Invalid month value
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified month is not valid.
Remedy: Correct the specified month.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAECOR
member.summary: 02210 EVA COR @CHAR value out of range
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified character is outside the range of valid characters.
Remedy: Correct the specified character value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIVL
member.summary: 02211 EVA IVL Invalid length
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified length exceeds allowable limit.
Remedy: Correct the length of the specified value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAENOF
member.summary: 02212 EVA NOF Numeric overflow
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a mathematical related function and a numeric overflow has occurred.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement. This problem may often be caused by inadvertently dividing by zero in your SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEISN
member.summary: 02213 EVA ISN Invalid @CHOOSE selector number
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified @CHOOSE selector number is invalid. A negative selector number maps to the first value in the list (value 0). If the selector number exceeds the number of values in the list, the result is the last value in the list.
Remedy: Correct the @CHOOSE selector number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAESTL
member.summary: 02214 EVA STL String too long
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to concatenate two strings and the resulting string is greater than 900 characters.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement concatenation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEOBS
member.summary: 02215 EVA OBS Function <name> is now obsolete
member.remarks:
Reason: Function is now obsolete.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement and do not use this function.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEVNI
member.summary: 02216 EVA VNI Value is not an integer
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified value is not an integer.
Remedy: Correct the invalid integer value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAENUF
member.summary: 02217 EVA NUF Numeric underflow
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a mathematical related function and a numeric underflow has occurred.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAESNG
member.summary: 02218 EVA SNG Attempt to find square-root of negative number
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to find the square root of a negative number.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEVIN
member.summary: 02219 EVA VIN Value must not be negative
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a @HEX or @FACTORIAL and the specified argument equates to a negative value.
Remedy: Correct the SQL statement.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAENZO
member.summary: 02220 EVA NZO Value is not zero or one
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a @FIND, @LEFT, @LENGTH, @RIGHT, @REPLACE, @SUBSTRING, or @SCAN in double-byte character set mode and the extra, last parameter must be one or zero. One meaning you want this function to operate in single-byte mode. Zero meaning you want to operate in the default, double-byte mode.
Remedy: Correct last parameter in @function. Can only be one or zero.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEENR
member.summary: 02221 EVA ENR Trying to evaluate a non-referenced column
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEIPO
member.summary: 02222 EVA IPO Invalid starting position
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a @SUBSTRING or @HEXDUMP and the position value is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the specified value

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EVAEUBC
member.summary: 02223 EVA UBC Conversion to Unicode Failed
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to convert from a Char to an NChar with an invalid character.
Remedy: Check the contents of the column

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTECOR
member.summary: 02401 RST COR Cannot open result set
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot open the stored result set by the specified name.
Remedy: Verify that the stored result set name is correct and try again.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTECOT
member.summary: 02402 RST COT NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTECCF
member.summary: 02403 RST CCF NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEFNX
member.summary: 02404 RST FNX Filter file does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot delete the stored result set by the specified name or attempting to do an undo result set operation and there is no existing result set to undo.
Remedy: Verify that the store result set name is correct and try again or if attempting to undo a result there is no remedy, you cannot undo a result set if no result set exists.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTERSA
member.summary: 02405 RST RSA Result set already active
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start restriction mode processing or restart a stored result set in restriction mode and the restriction mode (or result set mode) is already active.
Remedy: Stop the current restriction mode process before beginning a new restriction mode or restarting a stored result set.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTERSN
member.summary: 02406 RST RSN Result set not active
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to stop restriction mode processing and restriction (or result set) mode is not currently active OR attempting to position within a result set and the result is empty.
Remedy: None. You cannot stop restriction mode if it is not active and you cannot position within an empty result set.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTERSI
member.summary: 02407 RST RSI Result set identifier too large
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to store, delete, or restart a result set and the result set name identifier is too large.
Remedy: Correct the result set name. Result set names are restricted to being short identifiers (8 characters).

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTESRC
member.summary: 02408 RST SRC NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEPER
member.summary: 02409 RST PER NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEPNA
member.summary: 02410 RST PNA Previous filter not available
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot perform the undo (sqlurs) operation because the previous result set is not available.
Remedy: None. The previous result may not be available because this was the first result set (no previous select in this restriction mode session) or because the user is attempting to undo more than one time without a subsequent select operation. Undo operations are not nestable, that is, you can go back to a previous result set but not back further. The system only maintains the most recently used result set.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTECRS
member.summary: 02411 RST CRS Out of memory at the database computer (RST CRS)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTETMT
member.summary: 02412 RST TMT Too many tables in result set
member.remarks:
Reason: Too many tables form the result set.
Remedy: Modify the SQL statement to use fewer tables.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEQNS
member.summary: 02413 RST QNS Result set restriction mode is not supported for this query
member.remarks:
Reason: Virtual tables are not allowed in restriction mode.
Remedy: None. The query is not supported in restriction mode.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEOBY
member.summary: 02414 RST OBY Can't use ORDER BY when using the result set of previous query
member.remarks:
Reason: ORDER BY cannot be used when using the result set of a previous query in restriction mode.
Remedy: None. ORDER BY cannot be used when using the result set of a previous query in restriction mode. Under restriction mode, the rows come from the previous result set in the order of the previous result set.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEIRS
member.summary: 02415 RST IRS Result row size is too big for a temporary table
member.remarks:
Reason: (This error is now obsolete.) The result row size from a SELECT statement cannot exceed the useable space of a single row page since a temporary table cannot have extents. This restricts the size of a result row to no more than one page, a known problem requiring future enhancement to correct.
Remedy: Modify the SELECT statement to reduce the result row size.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSTEPRO
member.summary: 02416 RST PRO Restriction mode is not supported for procedures
member.remarks:
Reason: This feature is not supported for procedures.
Remedy: Turn restriction mode off.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVENPA
member.summary: 02501 SRV NPA No process available
member.remarks:
Reason: The USER configuration parameter specifies how many processes are allocated by the database server when starting up and the database server has run out of available processes.
Remedy: Bring the database server down and restart it after increasing the USER configuration parameter. The USER keyword specifies the maximum number of clients that can connect to the database server simultaneously. The default setting is 128 users and the maximum setting is 255 users. This keyword is not relevant under OS/2.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEINE
member.summary: 02502 SRV INE INTERNAL USE ONLY - Internal error (SRV INE)
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEOOS
member.summary: 02503 SRV OOS Server is out of sessions
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server or gateway has run short of network sessions.
Remedy: Bring down the database server or gateway and verify that the network has been configured with enough sessions and commands to support the desired number of users.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEMXD
member.summary: 02504 SRV MXD Maximum number of clients <max number> exceeded
member.remarks:
Reason: The maximum number of clients allowed by the Database Administrator for this database server or gateway has been exceeded.
Remedy: Your Database Administrator has limited the number of client connections to the server. Contact your Database Administrator to determine when the server will be next available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVENAN
member.summary: 02505 SRV NAN Installation of duplicate DBNAME
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server is attempting to install a new database name in the database name table and the name already exists.
Remedy: None. Database names cannot be duplicated on the same network. The same database name is allowed locally on a workstation and again on the network using DBXCOMBO.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEINN
member.summary: 02506 SRV INN Invalid database attempting to be installed
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server is attempting to install a new database name in the database name table and the specified database name is invalid.
Remedy: Correct database name. Database names must not exceed sixteen characters. A database name must begin with an alphabetic character and all subsequent characters must be alphanumeric.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVECIS
member.summary: 02507 SRV CIS Cannot install server name
member.remarks:
Reason: The system cannot install the specified server name.
Remedy: Verify that the name of the server being installed does not already exist on the network.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVETMO
member.summary: 02508 SRV TMO INTERNAL USE ONLY - Timeout
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEOOM
member.summary: 02509 SRV OOM Out of memory at the database computer (SRV OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEISN
member.summary: 02510 SRV ISN Invalid servername
member.remarks:
Reason: Specified servername is invalid.
Remedy: Servernames must not exceed eight characters. A servername must begin with an alphabetic character and all subsequent characters must be alphanumeric.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEIPW
member.summary: 02511 SRV IPW NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEACD
member.summary: 02512 SRV ACD Access denied to remote server configured as local-only
member.remarks:
Reason: The user attempted to access a database or server that was not local to the user. The database or server was located remotely in the network, but was configured for local access only. Servers that are configured for local access only can support connections from applications running on the same machine as the server, but cannot accept connections from remote users.
Remedy: Check to see if the database name (or server name, in the case of a server connection) is spelled correctly. Correct any misspellings in the database or server name and try the connection again. If the name is spelled correctly, the problem may be in database name duplication. Try using NETPREFIX in the SQL.INI file to provide better database name isolation. NETPREFIX may need to go into the SQL.INI file for the server issuing this error message, as well as into the SQL.INI file of the application receiving this error message.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEIDP
member.summary: 02513 SRV IDP Invalid database process number
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to cancel a database process and the specified database process number is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the database process number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEPDE
member.summary: 02514 SRV PDE Process does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to cancel a database process and the specified database process does not exist.
Remedy: Correct the database process number.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVECCL
member.summary: 02515 SRV CCL Cannot create logfile, <filename>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open an existing file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the open file failure. Verify that the specified file exists. Verify the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEUCA
member.summary: 02516 SRV UCA Server cancelled by operator with active connections
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server is being cancelled by an operator and active connections exist.
Remedy: None. All active transactions will be rolled back and all connected users will be disconnected.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEDNB
member.summary: 02517 SRV DNB Database name is too big
member.remarks:
Reason: A specified database name exceeds 16 characters.
Remedy: Correct the specified database name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVENLF
member.summary: 02518 SRV NLF NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEIDN
member.summary: 02519 SRV IDN Invalid database name
member.remarks:
Reason: A specified database name is invalid.
Remedy: Correct the invalid database name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEMXU
member.summary: 02520 SRV MXU Maximum number of users <max number> exceeded
member.remarks:
Reason: The USER configuration parameter specifies how many users are allowed by the database server and the server has run out of available users.
Remedy: Bring the database server down and restart it after increasing the USER configuration parameter. The USER keyword specifies the maximum number of clients that can connect to the database server simultaneously. The default setting is 128 users and the maximum setting is 800 users.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVENNO
member.summary: 02521 SRV NNO NOT USED
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is currently not used by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEMXC
member.summary: 02522 SRV MXC Maximum number of clients <maximum number> exceeded
member.remarks:
Reason: The maximum number of clients allowed for this database server or gateway has been exceeded.
Remedy: None. This version of the database server or gateway is restricted in the number of clients allowed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEPLV
member.summary: 02523 SRV PLV Activity log print level must be between 0 and 4 inclusive
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set the activity log print level, and an invalid print level has been specified.
Remedy: Correct the activity log print level. Valid print levels are 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEDBA
member.summary: 02524 SRV DBA This operation requires DBA authority
member.remarks:
Reason: The setting of this server parameter requires DBA authority.
Remedy: None. DBA authority is required to perform this operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEALG
member.summary: 02525 SRV ALG Activity log file name is too long
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to set an activity log file name and the specified file name is too long.
Remedy: Correct the activity log file name. A fully-qualified activity log file name cannot exceed 128 characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVECID
member.summary: 02526 SRV CID The database name may not be the same as server name.
member.remarks:
Reason: The server name used as a database name is reserved for connecting to the MAIN database.
Remedy: Use a database name that is different from the server name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEMDN
member.summary: 02527 SRV MDN MAIN database name found on network
member.remarks:
Reason: When attempting to install the server name as a database name on the network, the database name already existed on another server on the network.
Remedy: Use an alternate server name or deinstall the conflicting database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEISP
member.summary: 02528 SRV ISP Invalid self database process number
member.remarks:
Reason: Database process cannot cancel itself.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVESYS
member.summary: 02529 SRV SYS Protected system process number
member.remarks:
Reason: System process cannot be cancelled by user.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVECPT
member.summary: 02530 SRV CPT Server does not Connect-Pass-Thru mode
member.remarks:
Reason: Server does not support the Connect-Pass-Thru mode. This mode can only be used with certain routers.
Remedy: Turn off SQLECPT using Set Parameter API or do not use connect escape sequence '$$'.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEPIA
member.summary: 02531 SRV PIA Database process is aborting or doing rollback
member.remarks:
Reason: The database process is either in the process of aborting or is processing a rollback, and the process cannot be terminated at this point.
Remedy: If the command is processing a rollback, attempt to re-issue the Cancel command when rollback is complete.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVECTS
member.summary: 02532 SRV CTS Server is running as a Service
member.remarks:
Reason: The server is running as a Service and cannot be terminated by an API Call.
Remedy: To terminate the server, use the Services control panel and shutdown the SQLBase Service.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEEXP
member.summary: 02533 SRV EXP Evaluation period for Gupta SQLBase has expired
member.remarks:
Reason: The server is a evaluation edition and the evaluation period has expired.
Remedy: Contact Gupta Technologies - http://www.opentext.com/gupta

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVELIN
member.summary: 02534 SRV LIN Problem with product licensing
member.remarks:
Reason: During startup, the server is unable to determine that the product is licensed to use.
Remedy: Please purchase and activate the product. For information on how to purchase the product please visit our web site: http://www.opentext.com/gupta

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEPMC
member.summary: 02535 SRV PMC Problem with product licensing
member.remarks:
Reason: During the startup, the server could not correctly determine the product licensing information.
Remedy: Please provide a valid Product Media Code (PMC) for this installation of GUPTA SQLBase

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVEXER

Reason: This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center for assistance.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SRVESSL
member.summary: 02582 SRV SSL The server requires SSL to connect via TCP.
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server has been configured to only allow SSL connections when connecting via TCP/sockets, but the client is not capable of an SSL connection.
Remedy: Upgrade the client to a version with SSL support, or configure the server to accept non-SSL TCP connections.

member.summary: 02583 SRV ICM Invalid connection mode.

Remedy: Use only the API functions to access the database.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSIENAS
member.summary: 02601 RSI NAS No available sessions
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server has run short of network sessions.
Remedy: Bring down the database server and verify that the network has been configured with enough sessions and commands to support the desired number of users.

member.summary: 02602 RSI CAM Out of memory at the database computer (RSI CAM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDESNI
member.summary: 02706 SCD SNI INTERNAL USE ONLY - Scheduler not initialized
member.remarks:
Reason: This is error is only used internally by the SQLBase system. A scheduler function (other than scdInit) was made before the scheduler was initialized via scdInit.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur in an application program. scdInit must be the first scheduler function called. Call scdInit before making any other scheduler calls. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDEAIN
member.summary: 02707 SCD AIN INTERNAL USE ONLY - Scheduler already initialized
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system. scdInit was called more than once.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur in an application program. scdInit must be the first scheduler function call and it must never be called more than once. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDEOOM
member.summary: 02708 SCD OOM Out of memory at the database computer (SCD OOM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDECFP
member.summary: 02709 SCD CFP INTERNAL USE ONLY - Cannot find process
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system. scdPost was called with an invalid process number.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur in an application program. scdPost may only be called with a process number of a currently valid process. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDEPIU
member.summary: 02710 SCD PIU INTERNAL USE ONLY - Process number already in use
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system. scdCreate was called with a process number already in use.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur in an application program. When specifying a process number to scdCreate, the process number given must specify a process that is not currently valid. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDEPIB
member.summary: 02711 SCD PIB INTERNAL USE ONLY - Process is blocked
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system. scdPost was called with the number of a process that is not waiting on a scdSleep (such as a wait on a semaphore).
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur in an application program. scdPost can only be called on a process that is asleep via a call to scdSleep. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.summary: 02722 SCD STC INTERNAL USE ONLY - Semaphore type conflict
member.remarks:
Reason: This inappropriate use of a semaphore scheduler call is an internal error of the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur in an application program. There are two types of semaphores and two sets of functions dealing with them; they cannot be mixed. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.summary: 02723 SCD TMO INTERNAL USE ONLY - Timeout occurred
member.remarks:

Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDECST
member.summary: 02727 SCD CST Cannot create Operating System thread
member.remarks:
Reason: This error code is when running out of operating system resources.
Remedy: Shut down the database server whenever possible. Consult System Administrator to increase the system resources and re-start database server. If you get this error again, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDETMD
member.summary: 02728 SCD TMD Cannot create thread because thread manager was disabled
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is caused by pressing ESC on the server while there are still other users connected to the server. The server is going to be brought done abnormally. This error is returned as a result of thread manager being disabled to prepare the abnormal shutdown.
Remedy: Do not bring server down while other users still connected.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDECAB
member.summary: 02729 SCD CAB Cannot allocate buffer for asynchronous I/O
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a fatal error. Error will only occur when SQLBase allow more than 256 users connected.
Remedy: Use parameter in SQL.INI to increase the buffers.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDECAS
member.summary: 02730 SCD CAS Cannot allocate semaphore for asynchronous I/O
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot allocate semaphore for asynchronous I/O.
Remedy: Operating system ran out of resources.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDECSP
member.summary: 02731 SCD CSP Cannot spawn process for asynchronous I/O
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot spawn child process for asynchronous I/O.
Remedy: Operating system ran out of resources.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDETMP
member.summary: 02732 SCD TMP Too many threads already
member.remarks:
Reason: The maximum allowable number of threads has been reached. New threads will not be accepted until existing ones terminate.
Remedy: Increase the upper bound for the number of concurrent processes by increasing MAXPROCESS.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SCDECCN
member.summary: 02734 SCD CCN Cannot create native thread. OS Error = <OsError>
member.remarks:
Reason: This is a Fatal Error.
Remedy: Stop all database operations and run a CHECK DATABASE operation. If a FAIL.SQL file is available, then save it. Attempt to reproduce the problem via a SQL script, scenario, or using the NETLOG utility (see the DBA Guide for how to produce a NETLOG). Contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSWETNI
member.summary: 02804 RSW TNI Task not initialized
member.remarks:
Reason: This problem may have occurred because the sqlini() function call is not being called before a connect function call like sqlcnc or sqlcnc may be called after calling sqldon without another subsequent sqlini function call.
Remedy: Correct the application program. The sequence of events should be calling sqlini() first followed by any and all other sql functions and finally terminating with a sqldon function call.

member.summary: 02806 RSW TAI Task already initialized
member.remarks:

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSWENAS
member.summary: 02807 RSW NAS No available slots
member.remarks:
Reason: Whenever a Windows program calls the SQLBase API for the first time, it gets allocated a slot where a pointer to its data is kept. Before the Microsoft Windows application terminates, it is suppose to call sqldon() to free the slot. The current Microsoft Windows program is probably failing to call sqldon().
Remedy: Call sqldon() before exiting the Microsoft Windows application program.

member.summary: 02809 RSW ICB Invalid cursor buffer pointer
member.remarks:

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RSWESCT
member.summary: 02810 RSW SCT Session closed/terminated
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is returned to the client computer when the cursor is tied to a network session that no longer exists. Once you get this error on a cursor, subsequent tries will also yield the same error. Other cursors sharing the same network session will get this error also. If applications are exiting without disconnecting all their cursors, the database server can confuse a new instance of an application with an old one. If the new and old instance have the same MS Windows task ID, the database server might tell the new instance to use a network session created by the old instance.
Remedy: Check if some other error occurred before receiving this error. Other errors that may have gone undetected may have caused this error. Also check that all cursors are disconnected before terminating each run of an application. This can be checked by seeing if there are any sessions left on the database server screen after running and exiting each application. Check whether the applications ever terminate in ways where sessions are not disconnected.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEIDN
member.summary: 03006 CFM IDN Inconsistent database name
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system has determined that the database name being installed was prefixed with "L:" (to install a local database) and the server number used by the system was not zero. Or the database name being installed was prefixed with "R:" (to install a remote database) and the server number used by the system was zero.
Remedy: Correct installation of the database name. The "R:" prefix should be used to install on a remote database server with server number greater than zero. To install a local database, use a prefix of "L:" and use a server number of zero.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMECOS
member.summary: 03007 CFM COS Cannot open startup database
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install a new database and the database system cannot locate the START.DBS file.
Remedy: Verify that the START.DBS file is available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMECCD
member.summary: 03008 CFM CCD Cannot create database
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install a new database and the database system could not create the specified database name.
Remedy: Determine why the system could not create the named database file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEIRF
member.summary: 03009 CFM IRF Initialize read failure
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install a new database and the database system could not read from the START.DBS file.
Remedy: Determine why the system could not read the START.DBS file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEIWF
member.summary: 03010 CFM IWF Initialize write failure
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install a new database and the database system could not write to the newly created database file.
Remedy: Determine why the system could not write to the newly created database file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEDBE
member.summary: 03011 CFM DBE Database already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install a new database and the database name already exists.
Remedy: None. You cannot install a database that already exists.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEDBN
member.summary: 03012 CFM DBN Database does not exist
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to install a database that does not exist in the expected filesystem directory.
Remedy: Installing a database means to change its state from inactive to active. Its .DBS and .LOG files need to already exist in the required locations before the operation can succeed. The INSTALL DATABASE command expects the the database file to already exist as <DBDIR>/<DBNAME>/<DBNAME>.DBS, where the DBDIR directory is specified in the server section of the sql.ini file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMECRD
member.summary: 03013 CFM CRD Cannot create directory list
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a directory listing of all existing and installed databases and the database system could not create the directory listing.
Remedy: Contact your local Gupta technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEOOH
member.summary: 03014 CFM OOH Out of handles
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open more than four remote files at the same time.
Remedy: None. Only four remote files can be opened simultaneously.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFMEIVH
member.summary: 03015 CFM IVH Invalid handle
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified file handle is not valid.
Remedy: Use a valid file handle returned by opening the file with the sqlmop API function call.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPEBFE
member.summary: 03201 BKP BFE Backup file already exists
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to perform an online backup without the overwrite option and the backup file already exists.
Remedy: Modify the backup filename or invoke the overwrite option.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPECRB
member.summary: 03202 BKP CRB File Creation Failure - Cannot create backup file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPEBIP
member.summary: 03203 BKP BIP Backup already in progress
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting an online backup procedure and another backup is already in progress.
Remedy: Wait until the current online backup procedure has completed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPEUAB
member.summary: 03204 BKP UAB Out of memory at the database computer (BKP UAB)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPESFA
member.summary: 03205 BKP SFA File seek failure
member.remarks:
Reason: The database server is attempting to seek to the beginning of the backup file during a backup procedure and is encountering a file seek error.
Remedy: Determine why the operating system is generating a file seek error. Verify that the storage media is working correctly.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPEUSG
member.summary: 03206 BKP USG Unknown backup file segment
member.remarks:
Reason: The database system has read a chunk of backup data and the system could not identify the backup file segment.
Remedy: None. The backup file is probably unusable. Contact your local Gupta technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPECAC
member.summary: 03207 BKP CAC Out of memory at the database computer (BKP CAC)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BKPENCF
member.summary: 03208 BKP NCF Need control file to backup database > 2GB (BKP NCF)
member.remarks:
Reason: Database to be backed-up is greater than 2 gigabytes, the maximum file size supported by SQLBase.
Remedy: Create a control file for the backup of this database. The backup files will be created in segments as specified in the control file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESECCN
member.summary: 03301 RES CCN Cannot create new partitioned database file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the create failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of disk. Verify that sufficient disk space is available and verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESECOB
member.summary: 03302 RES COB Cannot open backup file on database server computer
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting a restore database or restore snapshot and the system cannot open the backup file on the database server computer.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the open file failure. Verify that the specified file name was correctly specified and exists on the database computer. Verify that the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESECAC
member.summary: 03303 RES CAC Out of memory at the database computer (RES CAC)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESESFA
member.summary: 03304 RES SFA Backup File Seek Failure
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQLBase system is attempting to re-find the beginning of the backup file and the seek for the beginning of the file has failed.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of file seek failure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESEUAB
member.summary: 03305 RES UAB Out of memory at the database computer (RES UAB)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESESIZ
member.summary: 03306 RES SIZ Restore over maximum file size (RES SIZ)
member.remarks:
Reason: Calculated backup size is greater than 2 GB and restore is to a non-partitioned database.
Remedy: Do the restore to a partitioned database. (See Database Administrator's Guide)

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.RESEROP
member.summary: 03307 RES ROP Unable to reopen database file (RES ROP)
member.remarks:
Reason: Database file could not be reopened in restore mode.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of reopen failure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SFLEBFE
member.summary: 03401 SFL BFE CHECK Failure (SFL BFE): <system free list corrupt>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SFLEOVL
member.summary: 03402 SFL OVL CHECK Failure (SFL OVL): <system free list corrupt>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SFLEENM
member.summary: 03403 SFL ENM CHECK Failure (SFL ENM): <system free list corrupt>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SFLEFPC
member.summary: 03404 SFL FPC CHECK Failure (SFL FPC): <system free list corrupt>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.SFLEBSI
member.summary: 03405 SFL BSI CHECK Failure (SFL BSI): <system free list corrupt>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEULP
member.summary: 03501 EMP ULP Database or object in the database is corrupt (EMP ULP)
member.remarks:
Reason: The database or an object in the database has been discovered to be inconsistent or lacking integrity.
Remedy: Run a CHECK DATABASE command.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEBSI
member.summary: 03502 EMP BSI CHECK Failure (EMP BSI): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEBME
member.summary: 03503 EMP BME CHECK Failure (EMP BME): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEBES
member.summary: 03504 EMP BES CHECK Failure (EMP BES): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEENM
member.summary: 03505 EMP ENM CHECK Failure (EMP ENM): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEPIM
member.summary: 03506 EMP PIM CHECK Failure (EMP PIM): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEBAP
member.summary: 03507 EMP BAP CHECK Failure (EMP BAP): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEIEM
member.summary: 03508 EMP IEM CHECK Failure (EMP IEM): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPEPNA
member.summary: 03509 EMP PNA CHECK Failure (EMP PNA): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EMPERNA
member.summary: 03510 EMP RNA CHECK Failure (EMP RNA): <extent page corrupted>
member.remarks:
Reason: CHECK DATABASE has discovered a problem in the database.
Remedy: If the CHECK DATABASE displays a message saying that a database object is damaged, drop that object. Otherwise, try unloading and reloading the database or restore from a backup copy of the database. You might also try unloading table by table to save as much of the database as possible.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBWENIN
member.summary: 03601 DBW NIN DBWINDOWS is not installed
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to access DBWindows and it is not installed.
Remedy: Install DBWindows and then proceed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DBWECAM
member.summary: 03602 DBW CAM Out of memory at the database computer (DBW CAM)
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough memory at the database engine to perform the requested task.
Remedy: Check available memory at the database computer. Attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available for the database engine, you can reduce size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFENCF
member.summary: 03701 CFF NCF No configuration file
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQL.INI configuration file could not be found after searching the current directory, the \SQLBASE directory, the root directory, or the specified operating system search PATH.
Remedy: Check for the existence of the SQL.INI file in the appropriate directory.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFECOC
member.summary: 03702 CFF COC Cannot open configuration file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open an existing file and a failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the open file failure. Verify that the specified file exists. Verify the number of files allowed open for the operating system permits the additional file, that is, check the FILES= configuration parameter setting.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEMCE
member.summary: 03703 CFF MCE Missing configuration file entry
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot find the configuration file entry [category] in the SQL.INI configuration file.
Remedy: Verify that the configuration file entry exists and that the proper SQL.INI configuration file is being used.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEFCL
member.summary: 03704 CFF FCL File closed
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQLBase system is attempting to read, write, or delete a line from the SQL.INI configuration file and the SQL.INI configuration file is not open.
Remedy: This error should never occur unless there is a problem with the SQL.INI configuration processing software in SQLBase. Contact your local Gupta technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFELSK
member.summary: 03705 CFF LSK SQL.INI configuration disk file seek error
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQLBase system is attempting to seek to a point within the SQL.INI configuration file and the seek operation has failed.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk seek failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFECRD
member.summary: 03706 CFF CRD Read failure of SQL.INI configuration file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to read a file and a disk read failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk read failure. Run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFECWT
member.summary: 03707 CFF CWT Write failure to SQL.INI configuration file
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to write to a file and a disk write failure has occurred.
Remedy: Determine and correct the cause of the disk write failure. Most commonly, it may be because you have run out of available disk space. If sufficient disk space is available, then run a check disk utility (CHKDSK) for the current operating system to verify the status of the disk.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEEOF
member.summary: 03708 CFF EOF INTERNAL USE ONLY - End of file
member.remarks:
Reason: This is not considered an error. This is only an indication that an end of file has been discovered in the SQL.INI file.
Remedy: None. Informational only.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFENDL
member.summary: 03709 CFF NDL No delete line available in the SQL.INI configuration file
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQLBase system is attempting to delete a line within the SQL.INI configuration file and there is no line to delete.
Remedy: This error should never occur unless there is a problem with the SQL.INI configuration processing software in SQLBase. Contact your local Gupta support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEOOM
member.summary: 03710 CFF OOM Out of memory
member.remarks:
Reason: Either the database computer or the client workstation computer is running short of available memory.
Remedy: Check available memory and attempt to make more memory available. To make more memory available at the database computer, you can reduce the size of the CACHE.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEIAV
member.summary: 03711 CFF IAV Invalid APPEND value
member.remarks:
Reason: AUDIT keyword APPEND value is invalid.
Remedy: Correct APPEND value. An AUDIT configuration parameter APPEND value is invalid. Valid values range from zero to 999. The format of the AUDIT SQL.INI configuration parameter is AUDIT=[type],auditname,[directory],[size-value],[append-value], [keep-value],[OVERWRITE],[category-values (comma separated)] where the first argument can be an audit type, followed by the auditname, followed optionally by the destination directory name, followed optionally by the audit file size, followed optionally by the append file number, followed optionally by the KEEP value, followed optionally by the OVERWRITE keyword, and finally followed by the category numbers (comma separated). For more information on these parameters, please see the START AUDIT command documentation in the SQL Language Reference manual.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEICK
member.summary: 03712 CFF ICK Invalid SQL.INI configuration parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: An invalid SQL.INI configuration parameter has been read from the SQL.INI configuration file.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL.INI configuration parameters are correctly specified. Check that the system is reading the SQL.INI file that you think it is reading. See what other SQL.INI files exist in the current directory, the \SQLBase directory, the root directory, or on the operating system search PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEMPV
member.summary: 03713 CFF MPV Missing configuration parameter value
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL.INI configuration parameter has been specified and the expected form of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is KEYWORD=VALUE and the value portion of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is missing.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL.INI configuration parameter values are correctly specified. Check that the system is reading the SQL.INI file that you think it is reading. See what other SQL.INI files exist in the current directory, the \SQLBase directory, the root directory, or on the OS search PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFECFE
member.summary: 03714 CFF CFE Error in configuration file
member.remarks:
Reason: Error(s) are found during the processing of configuration file
Remedy: Correct the SQL.INI file and make sure that the parameters provided there are correct and that they have the correct values assigned.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEANM
member.summary: 03715 CFF ANM Missing AUDIT name configuration parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: Audit name is missing.
Remedy: An AUDIT configuration parameter requires the specification of an audit name. The format of the AUDIT SQL.INI configuration parameter is AUDIT=[type],auditname,[directory],[size-value],[append-value], [keep-value],[OVERWRITE],[category-values (comma separated)] where the first argument can be a audit type, followed by the auditname, followed optionally by the destination directory name, followed optionally by the audit file size, followed optionally by the append file number, followed optionally by the KEEP value, followed optionally by the OVERWRITE keyword, and finally followed by the category numbers (comma separated). For more information on these parameters, please see the START AUDIT command documentation in the SQL Language Reference manual.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEINI
member.summary: 03716 CFF INI Invalid integer parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL.INI configuration parameter has been specified and the expected form of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is KEYWORD=integer-value and the integer-value portion of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is not a valid integer.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL.INI configuration parameter integer-values are correctly specified. Check that the system is reading the SQL.INI file that you think it is reading. See what other SQL.INI files exist in the current directory, the \SQLBase directory, the root directory, or on the OS search PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEINB
member.summary: 03717 CFF INB Invalid boolean parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL.INI configuration parameter has been specified and the expected form of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is KEYWORD=Boolean-value and the Boolean-value portion of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is not a valid Boolean.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL.INI configuration parameter boolean-values are correctly specified. Check that the system is reading the SQL.INI file that you think it is reading. See what other SQL.INI files exist in the current directory, the \SQLBase directory, the root directory, or on the OS search PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEINK
member.summary: 03718 CFF INK Invalid parameter keyword
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL.INI configuration parameter has been specified and the expected form of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is PARAMETER=KEYWORD and the keyword portion of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is not a valid keyword.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL.INI configuration parameter keywords are correctly specified. Check that the system is reading the SQL.INI file that you think it is reading. See what other SQL.INI files exist in the current directory, \SQLBase directory, root directory, or on the OS search PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEMES
member.summary: 03719 CFF MES Missing equal sign on parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL.INI configuration parameter has been specified and the expected form of the SQL.INI configuration parameter is KEYWORD=value and the equal sign (=) is missing.
Remedy: Verify that the SQL.INI configuration parameter has an equal sign correctly specified. Check that the system is reading the SQL.INI file that you think it is reading. See what other SQL.INI files exist in the current directory, \SQLBase directory, root directory, or on the OS search PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFENOP
member.summary: 03720 CFF NOP MAIN database not open to public
member.remarks:
Reason: A DBNAME= SQL.INI configuration parameter specifies the main database and the main database is not available to the public.
Remedy: Remove or change the name of the database that you are attempting to install that has the name of "MAIN".

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEIPL
member.summary: 03721 CFF IPL Inappropriate server prefix length
member.remarks:
Reason: A SERVERPREFIX= SQL.INI configuration parameter specified a serverprefix that is something other than one character.
Remedy: Correct the SERVERPREFIX parameter. A server prefix can only be one character.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEICN
member.summary: 03722 CFF ICN Invalid CLIENTNAME parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: A CLIENTNAME= SQL.INI configuration parameter specified a client name which is either too small or too large. Maximum size is twelve characters.
Remedy: Correct the CLIENTNAME parameter to be from one to twelve characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEEPD
member.summary: 03723 CFF EPD Invalid EPDATECHK parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: The only allowed values of EPDATECHK are parameters are 'ON' or 'OFF'. The default is OFF.
Remedy: Correct the parameter to use 'ON' or 'OFF'.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEIMA
member.summary: 03724 CFF IMA Invalid MACHINE parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: This parameter is used to cause SQLBase to adapt to special non-standard hardware. This is primarily for Japanese NEC machine and other AX standard machines. There are few hardware difference between NEC machine and IBM compatible machine. Currently, the allowed parameters are 'NEC' or 'AX'.
Remedy: Correct the parameter to 'NEC' or 'AX'.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEDDB
member.summary: 03725 CFF DDB Invalid DEFAULTDATABASE
member.remarks:
Reason: The DEFAULTDATABASE name should be a short identifier. The length should not be more than 16 characters and all the characters should be valid identifier characters.
Remedy: Correct the parameter value to a valid short identifier.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEITF
member.summary: 03726 CFF ITF Cannot open error translation file
member.remarks:
Reason: The error translation file specified could not be found.
Remedy: Check the error translation file name spelling. Make sure the file is there.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEOME
member.summary: 03727 CFF OME Out of memory for error translation table
member.remarks:
Reason: Cannot allocate enough memory for error translation table.
Remedy: Find a way to decrease other memory usage (e.g., Memory resident programs) or add more memory to your machine.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEAPC
member.summary: 03728 CFF APC Invalid APPCDLC parameter
member.remarks:
Reason: The value should be 'SDLC' or 'ITRN'. The length should be exactly 4.
Remedy: Check your spelling. Correct the parameter.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEPEX
member.summary: 03729 CFF PEX Cannot open SQL.INI configuration file for read or write
member.remarks:
Reason: The SQL.INI file could not be opened for read or write. Either the file doesn't exist or it is locked by another program which may be writing to the file or has no read/write privilege.
Remedy: Make sure you do have a SQL.INI file. Check the SQL.INI configuration file attribute.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEPSW
member.summary: 03730 CFF PSW Invalid DEFAULTPASSWORD
member.remarks:
Reason: The default password is too long.
Remedy: Correct the default password so that it is one to eight characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEPWD
member.summary: 03731 CFF PWD Invalid PASSWORD
member.remarks:
Reason: The password is too long.
Remedy: Correct the password so that it is one to eight characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFETMZ
member.summary: 03732 CFF TMZ Invalid TIMEZONE
member.remarks:
Reason: A floating point number between -12 and +12 is expected. The unit is hour.
Remedy: Make sure the specified number is between -12 and +12.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEUSR
member.summary: 03733 CFF USR Invalid DEFAULTUSER
member.remarks:
Reason: The length of the default user is too long.
Remedy: Make sure the default user is from one to eight characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEOOF
member.summary: 03734 CFF OOF Only valid values for this parameter are 0 and 1
member.remarks:
Reason: Only 0 for OFF and 1 for ON are accepted for this parameter.
Remedy: Make sure the parameter value is either 1 or 0.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEOCS
member.summary: 03735 CFF OCS Cannot open file for character sets
member.remarks:
Reason: The CHARACTERSET file could not be opened. This means either the file does not exist or the file is in use by another user.
Remedy: Check the file name and make sure you do have that file. Check your spelling. If the specified file name does not have a file extension, .CHR is the default file extension.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFECST
member.summary: 03736 CFF CST Out of memory for character set tables
member.remarks:
Reason: Not enough free memory was found for the character set table.
Remedy: Find a way to decrease other memory usage (e.g., memory resident programs) or add more memory to your machine.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEIVC
member.summary: 03737 CFF IVC Invalid character in character sets
member.remarks:
Reason: The value is out of the range of 0x00 to 0xFF.
Remedy: Check the values in the CHARACTERSET file and make sure they are are within range.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEIRO
member.summary: 03738 CFF IRO Invalid recorder option
member.remarks:
Reason: It is an invalid file name or cannot allocate recorder definition structure. (out of memory)
Remedy: Use a valid file name.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEROS
member.summary: 03739 CFF ROS Recorder option not contained in system
member.remarks:
Reason: This section does not have a recorder option.
Remedy: This line has to be deleted in this section.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFELTL
member.summary: 03740 CFF LTL Line too long in SQL.INI
member.remarks:
Reason: A configuration entry in SQL.INI was too long.
Remedy: Shorten the offending line in SQL.INI. In many cases it is possible to split up one configuration entry into several entries using the same keyword.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEINP
member.summary: 03741 CFF INP Invalid NETPREFIX or NETPREFIX too long
member.remarks:
Reason: The value of the NETPREFIX is invalid. The size of NETPREFIX is limited to three alphanumeric characters.
Remedy: Alter the value of NETPREFIX to be less than or equal to three alphanumeric characters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFETTL
member.summary: 03742 CFF TTL Invalid audit name identifier
member.remarks:
Reason: The AUDIT name should be a short identifier. The length should not be more than eight characters long and all the characters should be valid identifier characters.
Remedy: Correct the auditname parameter value to a valid short identifier. An AUDIT configuration parameter requires the specification of an audit name. The format of the AUDIT SQL.INI configuration parameter is AUDIT=[type],auditname,[directory],[size-value],[append-value], [keep-value],[OVERWRITE],[category-values (comma separated)] where the first argument can be a audit type, followed by the auditname, followed optionally by the destination directory name, followed optionally by the audit file size, followed optionally by the append file number, followed optionally by the KEEP value, followed optionally by the OVERWRITE keyword, and finally followed by the category numbers (comma separated). For more information on these parameters, please see the START AUDIT command documentation in the SQL Language Reference manual.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEAUT
member.summary: 03743 CFF AUT Invalid audit type specified
member.remarks:
Reason: The specified audit type is invalid. Valid audit types are GLOBAL and PERFM. If not specified, the audit defaults to GLOBAL.
Remedy: Correct the audit type parameter. An AUDIT configuration parameter allows for a GLOBAL or PERFM type audit. The format of the AUDIT SQL.INI configuration parameter is AUDIT=[type],auditname,[directory],[size-value],[append-value], [keep-value],[OVERWRITE],[category-values (comma separated)] where the first argument can be a audit type, followed by the auditname, followed optionally by the destination directory name, followed optionally by the audit file size, followed optionally by the append file number, followed optionally by the KEEP value, followed optionally by the OVERWRITE keyword, and finally followed by the category numbers (comma separated). For more information on these parameters, please see the START AUDIT command documentation in the SQL Language Reference manual.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.CFFEAWN
member.summary: 03744 CFF AWN SQL.INI AUDIT parameter without audit name identifier
member.remarks:
Reason: A SQL.INI configuration file AUDIT entry does not contain an AUDIT name identifier. The AUDIT name identifier is required.
Remedy: Correct the SQL.INI configuration file AUDIT parameter. Every AUDIT entry must specify a valid AUDIT name identifier.
