member.summary: 12903 EXF RTL Returned/Receive string too long
member.remarks:
Reason: When a string is passed as a receive parameter to an external function, the modified string returned to the stored procedure cannot be longer than the original string. Also the returned string as a function value cannot be bigger than a platform-dependent limit.
Remedy: Check your external function to make sure that the string manipulation is correct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEEFE
member.summary: 12904 EXF EFE Error number <number> occurred in external function <name>.
member.remarks:
Reason: An error occurred during execution of an external function.
Remedy: Check your external function code for correctness.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECAH
member.summary: 12905 EXF CAH Could not allocate HSTRING datatype.
member.remarks:
Reason: The function SWinInitLPHSTRINGParam returned an error.
Remedy: Check that SWIN*.DLL is present and that the function has been exported.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEDND
member.summary: 12906 EXF DND External function data does not meet the DATE/TIME format
member.remarks:
Reason: Data that is being returned as a parameter or as a return type from an external function does not conform to the required DATE/TIME format.
Remedy: Properly format such data for presenting to the procedure.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECFL
member.summary: 12907 EXF CFL Free Library of <name> failed with error <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: An attempt to free a dynamically linked library failed.
Remedy: Check to make sure that library exists and is not corrupt. Refer to the documentation on the FreeLibrary call in the Microsoft Function reference to get details about the failure error code.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECAO
member.summary: 12908 EXF CAO Cannot get address for external function ordinal <number> in DLL name <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: An attempt to get the address for an external function failed.
Remedy: Check to make sure that the function exists and its ordinal number is correct.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEUEE
member.summary: 12909 EXF UEE Unhandled exception "<code>" encountered in the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: A hardware/software exception was raised.
Remedy: A hardware/software exception was raised during the execution of the external function.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECAM
member.summary: 12910 EXF CAM EFHost cannot allocate memory for function <name>. OS error code is <code>
member.remarks:
Reason: EFHost could not allocate memory for receive/return parameters.
Remedy: The memory allocation failed. Check the error code and correct the situation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFERME
member.summary: 12911 EXF RME Receive memory exceeded the limit <limit> for the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Memory required for receive/return parameters exceeds the limit.
Remedy: The memory required for receive parameters exceeds preset limit for the platform. Redefine parameter passing to use smaller chunks.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECSS
member.summary: 12912 EXF CSS INTERNAL USE ONLY -- Error in computing shared memory size
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECNS
member.summary: 12913 EXF CNS INTERNAL USE ONLY -- Could not allocate internal semaphore
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEECD
member.summary: 12914 EXF ECD EFDaemon came down while executing the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Somebody might have killed the EFDaemon
Remedy: Investigate why EFDaemon came down. If it was brought down by someone, bring it up to restart operation. If not, investigate the cause and bring it up to restart operation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECDS
member.summary: 12915 EXF CDS Cannot deallocate memory just before an EF execution. OS error code is <code>
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase could not deallocate memory for send parameters.
Remedy: The memory deallocation failed. Check the error code and correct the situation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECAS
member.summary: 12916 EXF CAS Couldn't allocate memory just before an EF execution. OS error code is <code>
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase could not allocate memory for send parameters.
Remedy: The memory allocation failed. Check the error code and correct the situation.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECFD
member.summary: 12917 EXF CFD Couldn't find the executable <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase could not locate efdaemon.exe as it is not in the PATH.
Remedy: efdaemon.exe is not installed in the same place as SQLBase server. Your PATH environment variable may be set wrong.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEFSD
member.summary: 12918 EXF FSD Failed to start <name>
member.remarks: Reason: Was able to create the process but perhaps it died. Remedy:

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEFSE
member.summary: 12919 EXF FSE Failed to start EFDaemon. OS error code is <code>
member.remarks:
Reason: Check OS error code.
Remedy: Take corrective action based on the OS error code.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECMR
member.summary: 12920 EXF CMR Couldn't map receive parameter shared memory. Error code is <code>
member.remarks:
Reason: Check OS error code.
Remedy: Take corrective action based on the OS error code.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEURP
member.summary: 12921 EXF URP Unhandled exception "<code>" encountered in receive processing of the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: A hardware/software exception was raised.
Remedy: A hardware/software exception was raised during the receive processing of an external function. Check to make sure that all values are returned correctly to SQLBase.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEIER
member.summary: 12922 EXF IER Internal error <code> encountered in receive processing of the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Undocumented
Remedy: Undocumented

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECGA
member.summary: 12923 EXF CGA Cannot get address for a routine in SWINDOW DLL
member.remarks:
Reason: An attempt to get the address for a routine in SWINDOW DLL failed.
Remedy: Make sure correct version of SWINI60.DLL is installed.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECFH
member.summary: 12924 EXF CFH INTERNAL USE ONLY -- Could not find the handle to EFDaemon
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFECLS
member.summary: 12925 EXF CLS Could not load SWINDOW DLL
member.remarks:
Reason: The Gupta DLL implementing SAL functions may not be in the PATH.
Remedy: Please check to make sure that the correct version of DLLs are installed and it is in the Windows PATH.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEDOV
member.summary: 12926 EXF DOV A receive parameter overran other parameter(s) in function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: All function parameters are passed to an external function in a shared memory block. The external function increased the size of a parameter or changed its address such that it's value is overlaying the memory for other parameters.
Remedy: Check memory allocation, sizes and addresses for strings, and binary values.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEDNI
member.summary: 12927 EXF DNI A datatype <value> is not implemented in the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEEDC
member.summary: 12928 EXF EDC External function daemon crashed while executing the function <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: EFDaemon crashed without informing SQLBase.
Remedy: Investigate why EFDaemon came down. See if there is any trace left in the system log files for the cause of the crash.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEFED
member.summary: 12929 EXF FED Fatal error <code> encountered while communicating with the external function daemon
member.remarks:
Reason: EFDaemon might have crashed without informing SQLBase.
Remedy: Lookup the error code in OS documentation and take action accordingly. You may want to shut down EFDaemon to clear errors.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEHFB
member.summary: 12930 EXF HFB EFHost.exe file format is bad; function name is <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: EFHost.exe file may be corrupted.
Remedy: Reinstall the EFHost.exe file.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEHNF
member.summary: 12931 EXF HNF EFHost.exe file could not be found; function name is <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: EFHost.exe was not your PATH.
Remedy: Check the installation or your PATH environment variable.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEEOE
member.summary: 12932 EXF EOE External function daemon reported OS error code <code>; function name is <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Check OS error code.
Remedy: Check OS error code and attempt to correct the cause. If it does not make sense, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFEUCD
member.summary: 12933 EXF UCD Unhandled exception "<code>" encountered during execution of a function in a Gupta DLL
member.remarks:
Reason: This error is only used internally by the SQLBase system.
Remedy: None. This error code should never occur. If you get this error, contact your local Gupta certified technical support center.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.EXFENNA
member.summary: 12934 EXF NNA NULL value being passed for a numeric datatype in <name>.
member.remarks:
Reason: NULL values are allowed only for non-numeric datatypes.
Remedy: Make sure any numeric parameter has a non-NULL value.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEAEX
member.summary: 13001 BRM AEX SQLBrm is already executing.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start SQLBrm and it's already running.
Remedy: The second SQLBrm will end.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESRQ
member.summary: 13002 BRM SRQ SQLBase is required for execution.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start SQLBrm and SQLBase is not running.
Remedy: Start SQLBase first.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEENN
member.summary: 13003 BRM ENN Enlist:Session Block is missing.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist with a NULL session.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMENOC
member.summary: 13004 BRM NOC Client partner is missing in a session.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send data to client, but session doesn't have a valid partner.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQTI
member.summary: 13005 BRM QTI Query Interface for TranImport failed .
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to import a MTS transaction and the interface isn't published.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQIF
member.summary: 13006 BRM QIF Import failed <error code>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to import a MTS transaction and MTS returned an error code.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMECAF
member.summary: 13007 BRM CAF Create Asynch Object failed <error code>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create an instance of an MTS asynchronous object and MTS returned an error code.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQSI
member.summary: 13008 BRM QSI Query Interface for MTS Sink failed .
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to register as a MTS Resource Manager and a required interface isn't published.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQAI
member.summary: 13009 BRM QAI Query Interface for MTS Resource Ansync Interface failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to register as a MTS Resource Manager and a required interface isn't published.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEENF
member.summary: 13010 BRM ENF Enlist failed <error code>
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist in a MTS transaction and MTS returned an error code.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMECTS
member.summary: 13011 BRM CTS Client send buffer is too small.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send the GetWhereAbouts message to the client, but the buffer is insufficient.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMSE
member.summary: 13012 BRM MSE Client send buffer is too small.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to continue a client, but the client buffer can't hold a response message.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMECRE
member.summary: 13013 BRM CRE Client received failed <error code>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to receive data from the client and WinSock returned an error.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMECSE
member.summary: 13014 BRM CSE Client send failed <error code>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send data to the client and WinSock returned an error.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESRE
member.summary: 13015 BRM SRE Server received failed <error code>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to receive data from the server and SQLMPipe returned an error.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESSE
member.summary: 13016 BRM SSE Server send failed <error code>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send data to the server and SQLMPipe returned an error.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESNB
member.summary: 13017 BRM SNB Server send buffer is missing.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send data to the server but no area is available.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESTO
member.summary: 13018 BRM STO Server send timed-out.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send data to the server but the server didn't answer.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESMF
member.summary: 13019 BRM SMF Server Open Mutex failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to connect to the server but the server didn't have MPIPE initialized.
Remedy: Ensure that SQLBase has SQLMPIPE support active.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESOE
member.summary: 13020 BRM SOE Server Open Event failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to initialize SQLMPIPE support and the Open Event call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMVF
member.summary: 13021 BRM MVF Server MapViewOfFile failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to initialize SQLMPIPE support and the MapViewOfFile call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESEF
member.summary: 13022 BRM SEF Server Set Event failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to initialize SQLMPIPE support and the SetEvent call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESRO
member.summary: 13023 BRM SRO Server Wait on Reader timed-out.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send to the server and the server didn't read the data in the required time period.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESWF
member.summary: 13024 BRM SWF Server Wait on Event failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to send data to the server and the Wait call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESCF
member.summary: 13025 BRM SCF Server Create Event failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to initialize SQLMPIPE support and the CreateEvent call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEOMF
member.summary: 13026 BRM OMF Server OpenFileMapping failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to initialize SQLMPIPE support and the OpenFileMapping call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELCF
member.summary: 13027 BRM LCF Log Create File failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a log file and the Create call failed.
Remedy: Verify that a correct \LogDir was set in the Resource Manager Parameters. If so, consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELOF
member.summary: 13028 BRM LOF Log Create File Mapping failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a log file and the CreateFileMapping call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELNI
member.summary: 13029 BRM LNI Log Create failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a log file but the request failed. See previous errors.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELNS
member.summary: 13030 BRM LNS No Space for logging.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to write a log record but the request failed with no space.
Remedy: Ensure that the log is directed to a volume with sufficient free space.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMNN
member.summary: 13031 BRM MNN Session Block is missing.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to perform a command with a NULL session.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMNC
member.summary: 13032 BRM MNC Client is missing.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to perform an SQL/MTS command with a NULL client.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMENEO
member.summary: 13033 BRM NEO Prepare for commit failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to Prepare a commit with a NULL enlist interface.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEPIF
member.summary: 13034 BRM PIF Prepare for commit failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to Prepare a commit, but the PrepareInfo interface is not available.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMSF
member.summary: 13035 BRM MSF Prepare for commit failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to Prepare a commit, but the PrepareInfoSize call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMPF
member.summary: 13036 BRM MPF Prepare for commit failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to Prepare a commit, but the GetPrepareInfo call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMBA
member.summary: 13037 BRM MBA Communication thread stopped prematurely.
member.remarks:
Reason: A communication thread stopped, but the client and the server are both active.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMII
member.summary: 13038 BRM MII Transaction Enlist failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist a transation, but the TransactionImportWhereInfo interfacePrepareInfo is not available.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMZF
member.summary: 13039 BRM MZF Transaction Enlist failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist a transation, but the GetWhereaboutsSize call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEMWF
member.summary: 13040 BRM MWF Transaction Enlist failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist a transation, but the GetWhereabouts call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMECSF
member.summary: 13041 BRM CSF Registration with MTS failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to register with MTS, but the CreateTransactionManagerSink failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMERSF
member.summary: 13042 BRM RSF Registration with MTS failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to register with MTS, but the ResourceManagerSink interface is unavailable.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMECFF
member.summary: 13043 BRM CFF Registration with MTS failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to register with MTS, but the CreateResourceManagerFactory call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMENIO
member.summary: 13044 BRM NIO Transaction Enlist failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist a transaction with MTS, but there is a null import object.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESQF
member.summary: 13045 BRM SQF Starting SQLBase failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start the server, but the CreateProcess call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEFQF
member.summary: 13046 BRM FQF Starting SQLBase failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start the server, but the CreateProcess call could not locate SQLBase.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEWQF
member.summary: 13047 BRM WQF Starting SQLBase failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start the server, but the WaitForInputIdle call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQTO
member.summary: 13048 BRM QTO Starting SQLBase failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to start the server, but the server did not answer during the required time period.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEREF
member.summary: 13049 BRM REF Recovery transaction re-enlist failed <error>.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to enlist in a transaction during recovery, but the Reenlist call failed.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMERNR
member.summary: 13050 BRM RNR Recovery transaction failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to recover a transaction, but the server failed to return a response.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMERCM
member.summary: 13051 BRM RCM Recovery transaction failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to recover a transaction, but there is a cursor mismatch.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELOP
member.summary: 13052 BRM LOP Listening on Port <port>.
member.remarks:
Reason: This is the WinSock port that the Resource Manager is using to communicate with clients.
Remedy: This is an informational message only. Use this information when communication from the client fails to reach the server. You can change the port number with \Listenport=# in the Resource Manager parameters.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQIU
member.summary: 13053 BRM QIU Query or Reset transaction failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: A unit-of-work, UOW, was received that doesn't match the one that was saved with the transaction when it was enlisted.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELBE
member.summary: 13054 BRM LBE Creating a log file failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a new log file, but the size of the structure doesn't match the blocksize of the file.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELRE
member.summary: 13055 BRM LRE Writing a log record failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a new log file block, but the size of the block doesn't match the blocksize of the file.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMERLF
member.summary: 13056 BRM RLF Recovery failed reading the log file.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to replay a logged message, but the log ID doesn't match the ID of the current log.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMERMI
member.summary: 13057 BRM RMI Recovery failed reading the log file.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to recover a log, but the log isn't in recovery mode.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMELFI
member.summary: 13058 BRM LFI Recovery failed reading the log file.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to open a log file, but the data doesn't match that of a valid Resource Manager log file.
Remedy: Ensure the \LogDir during recovery points to the same directory where the previous log files were saved. This could be a scrambled log file, if so contact Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMEQNU
member.summary: 13059 BRM QNU Query Transaction failed.
member.remarks:
Reason: A unit-of-work, UOW, was received that doesn't match any current session.
Remedy: Consult Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMESDA
member.summary: 13060 BRM SDA Server is down, Enlisted Transaction is aborted.
member.remarks:
Reason: SQLBase is down. Any enlisted, but not yet prepared, transaction is aborted. This is part of Two-Phase Commit.
Remedy: Restart the transaction after SQLBase is up.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.BRMERNS
member.summary: 13061 BRM RNS Failed to create a temporary session during recovery.
member.remarks:
Reason: Attempting to create a new temporary session during recovery, but the creation failed. This transaction can't be recovered.
Remedy: This map be due to an invalid log file. Contact Techical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DRVEAJS
member.summary: 14001 DRV AJS ANSI JOIN syntax not enabled
member.remarks:
Reason: The current operation requires the server to have ANSI JOIN syntax enabled.
Remedy: Set ANSIJoinSyntax=1 in the [dbntsrv] section and restart the server.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DRVEPNS
member.summary: 14002 DRV PNS Partitioned databases are not supported
member.remarks:
Reason: .NET Backup API does not support partitioned databases.
Remedy: None.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.DRVEICO
member.summary: 14003 DRV ICO Invalid configuration option <name>
member.remarks:
Reason: Configuration or connection string option specified is either invalid, or was set to an invalid value.
Remedy: Change or remove the invalid option.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.R00ELEV
member.summary: 19001 R00 LEV ODBC driver is not level 1 compliant.
member.remarks:
Reason: The information returned from the ODBC driver reports that it does not fully support ODBC level 1.
Remedy: Check to see if a more current driver is available.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.R00EFSE
member.summary: 19002 R00 FSE ODBC Router function sequence error.
member.remarks:
Reason: The ODBC driver reported a function sequence error.
Remedy: Contact Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.R00EEOR
member.summary: 19003 R00 EOR End of result set reached.
member.remarks:
Reason: SqlExecute was called after the end of the result set was reached.
Remedy: Try re-preparing the query, or contact Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.R00EUNK
member.summary: 19004 R00 UNK An unknown ODBC Router error occurred.
member.remarks:
Reason: An error occurred in the ODBC Router. This error is currently undocumented.
Remedy: Contact Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseError.R00EIMS
member.summary: 19005 R00 IMS An operation has tried to process data greater than the input / output message limit of 64K.
member.remarks:
Reason: This error can be caused a large number of parameters returning too much data in a single call.
Remedy: Contact Gupta Technical Support.

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.MessageLayer.SQLBaseBindDescriptor
member.summary:
The SQLBaseBindDescriptor class encapsulates re-composed object of a SELECT command, it has a SQLBaseCompileSelectInfo object (CSI), it's Column header string, and the label information string
methods are provided to get field values from CSI, Column Header and Label
member.author: Clement Chan

member.name: F:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.MessageLayer.SQLBaseBindDescriptor.mbn
member.summary:
if this bind descriptor is a named bind variable do the followings: set mbn.mbnnum to 0 using mbn.setBindByNumberFlag(0); set length of bind name using mbn.setLengthOfNumber(nameStr.length()); attach the reference of the name byte buffer using setBindName(namebuf);
if mbn.mbnnum = 0, this is a named bind object mbn.mbnlon is the length of the name string excluding the colon i.e :Customer or :Account etc. bindName contains the name string whose length is indicated by mbn.get
if mbn.mbnnum = 1, this is a numeric bind object mbn.mbnlon is the bind number 1 for :1, 2 for :2 etc.
bindName

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.CommandText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text command to run against the data source.
member.value: The text command to execute. The default value is an empty string ("").
member.remarks: When you set the CommandType to StoredProcedure, you should set the CommandText property to the name of the stored procedure. The command executes this stored procedure when you call one of the Execute methods.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the command time limit.
member.value: The timeout length, in seconds.
member.remarks:
The amount of time (in seconds) to wait for a SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement to complete execution.
After the specified time has elapsed, SQLBase rolls back the command.
Valid values range from 1 to 43,200 seconds (12 hours maximum), and include 0 (zero) which indicates an infinite time limit.
Note that if you are using the sqlset function to set the SQLPCTL (command time limit) parameter, settings for the SQLPAPT (activate process timing) and SQLPSTA (statistics for server) parameters can be affected in the following ways:
• When you enable a command time limit (by specifying a non-zero value in either the cmdtimeout keyword of the server’s sql.ini file or with the SQLPCTL parameter), SQLPSTA (statistics for server) and SQLPAPT (process timing) are automatically turned on.
• If you turn off a command time limit, SQLPSTA (statistics for server) and SQLPAPT (process timing) are automatically turned off, unless you explicitly turned on either parameter after you enabled a command time limit.
• If you explicitly turn off either SQLPSTA (statistics for server) or SQLPAPT (process timing), your command time limit (if you enabled on) is turned off and sql.ini is updated to reflect cmdtimeout=0.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.CommandType
member.summary: Indicates or specifies how the CommandText property is interpreted.
member.value: One of the CommandType values. The default is Text.
member.remarks: When you set the CommandType to StoredProcedure, you should set the CommandText property to the name of the stored procedure. The command executes this stored procedure when you call one of the Execute methods.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.LockTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the lock timeout.
member.value: The timeout length, in seconds.
member.remarks:
The number of seconds for SQLBase to wait for a database lock to be acquired.
This parameter is only relevant for multi-user servers and it is transaction-specific.
The default is 300 seconds. Valid timeout values are:
1 - 1800 inclusive (1 second to 30 minutes)
0 = never wait; return error immediately
-1 = wait forever
This parameter is only relevant for multi-user servers and it is transaction-specific.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.Parameters
member.summary: Collection of bind parameters for the current statement.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.PreserveContext
member.summary: Gets or sets cursor context preservation.
member.value: Boolean value representing on (true) and off (false).
member.remarks:
If cursor context preservation is On (1), SQLBase prevents a COMMIT from destroying an active result set, thereby enabling an application to maintain its position after a COMMIT, INSERT, or UPDATE.
Locks are kept on pages required to maintain the fetch position. Be aware that this can block other applications trying to access the same data. Also, locks can prevent other applications from doing DDL operations.
By default, cursor context preservation is Off (0). A COMMIT destroys a cursor’s result set or compiled command.
SQLBase does not preserve cursor context after an isolation level change or a system-initiated ROLLBACK, such as a deadlock, timeout, etc. SQLBase does preserve cursor context after a user-initiated ROLLBACK if both of the following are true:
1) The application is in Release Locks (RL) isolation level.
2) A data definition language (DDL) statement was not performed.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.ExecuteNonQuery
member.summary: Executes a SQL statement against a connection object.
member.returns: The number of rows affected.
member.remarks:
You can use ExecuteNonQuery to perform catalog operations (for example, querying the structure of a database or creating database objects such as tables), or to change the data in a database by executing UPDATE, INSERT, or DELETE statements.
For UPDATE, INSERT, and DELETE statements, the return value is the number of rows affected by the command. For all other types of statements, the return value is -1.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.ExecuteScalar
member.summary: Executes the query and returns the first column of the first row in the result set returned by the query. All other columns and rows are ignored.
member.returns: The first column of the first row in the result set.
member.remarks:
Use the ExecuteScalar method to retrieve a single value (for example, an aggregate value) from a database. This requires less code than using the ExecuteReader method and performing the operations necessary to generate the single value using the data returned by a DbDataReader.
If the first column of the first row in the result set is not found, a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned. If the value in the database is null, the query returns DBNull.Value.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.SetSQLBaseParameter(System.UInt16,System.Object)
member.summary: This function sets a cursor parameter.
member.param: Numeric parameter of option to set
Value of option, type dependant on option.
member.remarks: Note that many of the parameters are equivalent to keywords in the configuration file (default name sql.ini). For example, calling this function using parameter SQLPUSR is equivalent to manually editing sql.ini and changing the value associated with keyword users. When you manually edit the configuration file, you must stop, then restart, all servers and clients that use that configuration file before the effects of the change will be visible. The same principle applies for this function. If you make a change that affects the configuration file through a call to this function, you must stop and restart servers and clients before the effects of the change will be visible.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseCommand.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the Component and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: This method is called by the public Dispose method and the Finalize method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the disposing parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose with disposing set to false. When the disposing parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this Component references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.InputMessageSize
member.summary: Gets the current input message size
member.value: Size of message, in bytes
member.remarks:
This function changes the maximum size (in bytes) of the input message buffer. The input message buffer is allocated on both the client computer and on the database server. The database server builds an input message in this buffer on the database server computer and sends it across the network to a buffer of the same size on the client. It is called an input message buffer because it is input from the client's point of view.
There is one input message buffer per connected cursor on the client computer. The server maintains an input message buffer that is the size of the largest input message buffer on the client computer.
The input message buffer can receive a return code indicating that the specified operation was successful, the data that is being fetched, and other information. While fetching data from the database, SQLBase compacts as many rows as possible into one input message buffer.
Each sqlfet call reads the next row from the input message buffer until they are exhausted. At this instant, SQLBase transparently fetches the next input buffer of rows depending on the isolation level.
A large input message buffer can help performance while fetching data from the database because it reduces the number of network messages. Note that a large input message buffer can affect system throughput because of concurrency. Any row currently in the input message buffer can have a shared lock on it (depending on the isolation level) preventing other users from changing that row. Therefore, a large input message buffer can cause more shared locks to remain than are necessary.
See the explanation of sqlsil for more information about how each isolation level uses the input message buffer.
SQLBase automatically maintains an input message buffer large enough to hold at least one row of data. Despite the specified input message size, SQLBase dynamically allocates more space if necessary.
A large input message buffer helps performance when reading LONG VARCHAR columns.
This function can also improve overall system performance by decreasing the size of the input message buffer when an application does not need to fetch data.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the current isolation level of this session.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.IsolationLevelType
member.summary: Gets or sets the current isolation level of this session.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.OutputMessageSize
member.summary: Gets the current output message size
member.value: Size of message, in bytes
member.remarks:
The output message buffer is allocated on both the client computer and on the database server. The client builds an output message in this buffer and sends it to a buffer of the same size on the database server. It is called an output message buffer because it is output from the client's point of view.
The most important messages sent from the client to the database server are SQL commands to compile or a row of data to insert.
A large output message buffer does not necessarily increase performance because it only needs to be large enough to hold the largest SQL command to compile, or large enough to hold the largest row of data to insert. A large output message buffer can allocate space unnecessarily on the both the client and the server. Rows are always inserted and sent one row at a time (except in bulk execute mode). A larger output message buffer does not reduce network traffic unless bulk execute is on.
SQLBase automatically maintains an output message buffer large enough to hold any SQL command or a row to insert of any length (given available memory). Despite the specified output message buffer size, SQLBase dynamically allocates more space for the output message buffer if needed.
A large output message buffer can help performance when writing LONG VARCHAR columns.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.SetSQLBaseParameter(System.UInt16,System.Object)
member.summary: This function sets a database parameter.
member.param: Numeric parameter of option to set
Value of option, type dependant on option.
member.remarks: Note that many of the parameters are equivalent to keywords in the configuration file (default name sql.ini). For example, calling this function using parameter SQLPUSR is equivalent to manually editing sql.ini and changing the value associated with keyword users. When you manually edit the configuration file, you must stop, then restart, all servers and clients that use that configuration file before the effects of the change will be visible. The same principle applies for this function. If you make a change that affects the configuration file through a call to this function, you must stop and restart servers and clients before the effects of the change will be visible.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Begins a new transaction on this session with the current isolation level. Call Commit() or Rollback() on the returned object when finished.
member.returns: Transaction object

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.BeginTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Begins a new transaction on this session with a specific isolation level. Call Commit() or Rollback() on the returned object when finished.
member.returns: Transaction object
member.remarks:
The ADO.NET IsolationLevel enum corresponds to SQLBase isolation levels in the following way:
ReadUncommittedRead Committed Level 3 (RC3/R3)
ReadCommittedRead Committed (RC/R1/R2)
RepeatableReadRepeatable Read (RR)
SnapshotRead Only (RO)
SerializableCursor Stability (CS)
NOTE: This does not map 1:1 to the values used in SQLBaseTransaction.IsolationLevel.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection.BeginDbTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Begins a new transaction on this session with a specific isolation level. If isolation level is not specified, default isolation level is used. Call Commit() or Rollback() on the returned object when finished.
member.returns: Transaction object
member.remarks:
The ADO.NET IsolationLevel enum corresponds to SQLBase isolation levels in the following way:
ReadUncommittedRead Committed Level 3 (RC3/R3)
ReadCommittedRead Committed (RC/R1/R2)
RepeatableReadRepeatable Read (RR)
SnapshotRead Only (RO)
SerializableCursor Stability (CS)
NOTE: This does not map 1:1 to the values used in SQLBaseTransaction.IsolationLevel.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseServerConnection.GetServerInformation(Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Enums.ServerInformation,Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Structures.FilterInformation)
member.overloads:
Gets various data from the server. This is equivalent to the C API method sqlgsi.
Passing one or more combination of flags from will return one or more of the following structures:
Flag Return type
The actual return type is , so a cast is required to retrieve the data from any particular element. The return is always an , even if there's a single element.
member.summary: Gets various data from the server. This is equivalent to the C API method sqlgsi.
member.param: Flag combination of items to retrieve.
Optional data to filter results.
member.returns: An indexable list of the specified items. Never null.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseServerConnection.GetServerInformation(Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Enums.ServerInformation,System.UInt16@)
member.summary: Gets various data from the server. This is equivalent to the C API method sqlgsi.
member.param: Flag combination of items to retrieve.
Total number of elements the server has. Note: This may be larger than the actual data returned. If so, there is too much data to retrieve. Try additional filtering.
member.returns: An indexable list of the specified items. Never null.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseServerConnection.GetServerInformation(Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Enums.ServerInformation,Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Structures.FilterInformation,System.UInt16@)
member.summary: Gets various data from the server. This is equivalent to the C API method sqlgsi.
member.param: Flag combination of items to retrieve.
Optional data to filter results.
Total number of elements the server has. Note: This may be larger than the actual data returned. If so, there is too much data to retrieve. Try additional filtering.
member.returns: An indexable list of the specified items. Never null.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseServerConnection.AbortProcess(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Aborts a database process.
member.param: The process number to abort. Retrieve the database process numbers by calling .
member.remarks: This function aborts a database server process. You cannot abort a process that the server is currently processing. For example, if a client sends a SELECT statement to a server, the process cannot be aborted until the server begins returning rows. When a database process is aborted, it ends its network sessions and does a rollback of its transactions.

member.name: T:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction
member.summary: Represents a transaction on a connection. This is not user-instantiable.
member.remarks: Call BeginTransaction on an instance of SQLBaseConnection to create a new transaction.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.#ctor(Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseConnection)
member.summary: Creates a new transaction object, referencing a specific connection.
member.remarks:
This is deprecated and should not be used in new code.
The .NET provider can lose the correct transaction state if this is not handled fully internally.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.Connection
member.summary: Returns the active connection object of this transaction.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.IsolationLevel
member.summary: ADO.NET Isolation level.
member.remarks:
The ADO.NET IsolationLevel enum corresponds to SQLBase isolation levels in the following way:
Read Committed Level 3 (RC3/R3)ReadUncommitted
Read Committed (RC/R1/R2)ReadCommitted
Release Locks (RL)ReadCommitted
Repeatable Read (RR)RepeatableRead
Read Only (RO)Snapshot
Cursor Stability (CS)Serializable
NOTE: This does not map 1:1 to the values used in SQLBaseConnection.BeginTransaction.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.DbConnection
member.summary: Returns the active connection object of this transaction.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transaction.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back transacton.

member.name: M:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.SQLBaseTransaction.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the transaction object when no longer in use.

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Structures.CursorInformation.ProcessNumber
member.summary:
Process number.
This has the full range only on 12.2+ servers.
member.remarks:
This value may not be reliable in all cases. See the table below for more information.
The range of this value varies based on the Database Engine server version:
Condition Range
SQLBase Database Engine 12.2 or higher
All other cases
If the range is limited to (see table above), then the only valid range for process numbers is 1-255.
Process numbers 256 and above will wrap around, in which case this property will return 0 for process 256, 1 for process 257, etc...

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Structures.FilterInformation.ProcessNumber
member.summary: Filter results based on process number, where applicable.
member.remarks: This only accepts process numbers between 1-255. Higher process numbers cannot be filtered. For legacy and compatibility reasons, this value is limited to the range of 1-255. This property cannot be used for processes above 255.

Group Number Meaning
0 Database lock

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Structures.ProcessInformation.ProcessNumber
member.summary:
Process number.
This has the full range only on 12.2+ servers, and then only if is true.
member.remarks:
This value may not be reliable in all cases. See the table below for more information.
The range of this value varies based on several factors:
Condition Range
SQLBase Database Engine 12.2 or higher
is true
SQLBase Database Engine 12.2 or higher
is false
All other cases
If the range is limited to (see table above), then the only valid range for process numbers is 1-255.
Process numbers 256 and above will wrap around, in which case this property will return 0 for process 256, 1 for process 257, etc...

member.name: P:Gupta.SQLBase.Data.Structures.ProcessInformation.Active
member.summary: Returns true if the process is actively performing an operation, false otherwise.

member.name: T:SupportClass.CalendarManager
member.summary: This class manages different features for calendars. The different calendars are internally managed using a hashtable structure.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the year.

member.name: F:SupportClass.CalendarManager.MONTH
member.summary: Field used to get or set the month.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the day of the month.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the hour of the morning or afternoon.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the minute within the hour.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the second within the minute.

member.name: F:SupportClass.CalendarManager.MILLISECOND
member.summary: Field used to get or set the millisecond within the second.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the day of the year.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the day of the month.

member.summary: Field used to get or set the day of the week.

member.summary: Field used to get or set whether the HOUR is before or after noon.
